original: aśeṣacidacidvastuviśeṣiṇe śeṣaśāyine /
analyzed: aśeṣa cit acit vastu viśeṣiṇe śeṣa śāyine
translated: To the one who possesses the particulars of all conscious and unconscious things, to the one who lies down as the remainder,

original: nirmalānantakalyāṇanidhaye viṣṇave namaḥ //
translated: Salutations to Vishnu, the treasure of pure, infinite, and auspicious things.

original: paraṃ brahmaivājñaṃ bhramaparigataṃ saṃsarati tatparopādhyālīḍhaṃ vivaśamaśubhasyāspadam iti /
analyzed: param brahma eva ajñam bhrama parigatam saṃsarati tat para upādhi ālīḍham vivaśam aśubhasya āspadam iti
translated: The ignorant Brahman wanders about, enveloped in delusion, overcome by other limiting adjuncts, helpless, the abode of evil.

original: śrutinyāyāpetaṃ jagati vitataṃ mohanam idaṃ tamo yenāpāstaṃ sa hi vijayate yāmunamuniḥ //
analyzed: śruti nyāya apetam jagati vitatam mohanam idam tamaḥ yena apāstam sa hi vijayate yāmuna muniḥ
translated: The darkness that spreads over the world, devoid of the Vedas and logic, this delusion, by whom it is removed, he alone is the sage Yamuna who triumphs.

original: aśeṣajagaddhitānuśāsanaśrutinikaraśirasi samadhigato 'yam arthaḥ jīvaparamātmayāthātmyajñānapūrvakavarṇāśramadharmetikartavyatākaparamapuruṣacaraṇayugaladhyānārcanapraṇāmādir
analyzed: aśeṣa jagat hita anuśāsana śruti nikara śirasi samadhigataḥ yam arthaḥ jīva paramātma yāthātmya jñāna pūrvaka varṇa āśrama dharma itikartavyatāka paramapuruṣa caraṇa yugala dhyāna arcana praṇāma ādiḥ
translated: This meaning, which is obtained at the head of the multitude of Vedic teachings that instruct for the welfare of the entire world, is as follows: The meditation, worship, prostration, etc. at the feet of the Supreme Person, preceded by the knowledge of the nature of the individual soul and the supreme Self, and accompanied by the duties of the varṇas and āśramas,

original: atyarthapriyas tatprāptiphalaḥ / 🔽asya jīvātmano 'nādyavidyāsaṃcitapuṇyapāparūpakarmapravāhahetukabrahmādisuranaratiryaksthāvarātmakacaturvidhadehapraveśakṛtatattadabhimānajanitāvarjanīyabhavabhayavidhvaṃsanāya
analyzed: 🔽asya jīvātmanaḥ na adya vidyā saṃcita puṇya pāpa rūpa karma pravāha hetuka brahma ādi sura nara tiryak sthāvara ātmaka caturvidha deha praveśa kṛta tad tad abhimāna janita a varjanīya bhava bhaya vidhvaṃsanāya
translated: is extremely dear, and has the attainment of that as its fruit.🔽For the destruction of the inevitable fear of worldly existence, which arises from the conceit of being that and that, caused by the entry of the individual soul into the four kinds of bodies consisting of Brahman, gods, humans, animals, and plants, which is caused by the stream of actions in the form of merit and sin accumulated by beginningless ignorance,

original: dehātiriktātmasvarūpatatsvabhāvatadantarayāmiparamātmasvarūpatatsvabhāvatadupāsanatatphalabhūtātmasvarūpāvirbhāvapūrvakānavadhikātiśayānandabrahmānubhavajñāpane
translated: The entire set of Vedanta texts is engaged in conveying the knowledge of the experience of Brahman, which is of unlimited and supreme bliss, preceded by the manifestation of the nature of the Self, which is the fruit of the meditation on the nature of the Supreme Self, which is the inner controller of the nature of the Self, which is different from the body, and its nature.

original: pravṛttaṃ hi vedāntavākyajātam /
analyzed: pravṛttam hi vedānta vākya jātam
translated: The set of Vedanta texts is engaged in conveying the knowledge of the experience of Brahman, which is of unlimited and supreme bliss, preceded by the manifestation of the nature of the Self, which is the fruit of the meditation on the nature of the Supreme Self, which is the inner controller of the nature of the Self, which is different from the body, and its nature.

original: tat tvam asi /
analyzed: tat tvam asi
translated: That art thou.

original: ayam ātmā brahma /
analyzed: ayam ātmā brahma
translated: This Self is Brahman.

original: ya ātmani tiṣṭhann ātmano 'ntaro yam ātmā na veda yasyātmā śarīraṃ ya ātmānam antaro yamayati sa ta ātmāntaryāmy amṛtaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ātmani tiṣṭhan ātmanaḥ ntaraḥ yam ātmā na veda yasya ātmā śarīram yaḥ ātmānam antaraḥ yamayati sa te ātmā antaryāmī amṛtaḥ
translated: He who, abiding in the Self, is yet different from the Self, whom the Self does not know, whose Self the body is, who controls the Self from within, He is your Self, the inner controller, the immortal one.

original: eṣa sarvabhūtāntarātmāpahatapāpmā divyo deva eko nārāyaṇaḥ /
analyzed: eṣa sarva bhūta antarātmā apahata pāpmā divyaḥ devaḥ ekaḥ nārāyaṇaḥ
translated: He is the inner Self of all beings, free from sin, divine, the one God, Narayana.

original: tam etaṃ vedānuvacanena brāhmaṇā vividiṣanti yajñena dānena tapasānāśakena /
analyzed: tam etam veda anuvacanena brāhmaṇāḥ vividiṣanti yajñena dānena tapasā anāśakena
translated: The Brahmins seek to know Him through the recitation of the Vedas, through sacrifice, through charity, through austerity, and through the unmanifest.

original: brahmavid āpnoti param /
analyzed: brahma vid āpnoti param
translated: One who knows Brahman attains the supreme.

original: tam evaṃ vidvān amṛta iha bhavati nānyaḥ panthā ayanāya vidyata ityādikam /
analyzed: tam evam vidvān amṛtaḥ iha bhavati na anyaḥ panthāḥ ayanāya vidyate iti ādikam
translated: Knowing Him thus, one becomes immortal in this world. There is no other path for liberation.

original: jīvātmanaḥ svarūpaṃ devamanuṣyādiprakṛtipariṇāmaviśeṣarūpanānāvidhabhedarahitaṃ jñānānandaikaguṇaṃ /
analyzed: jīvātmanaḥ svarūpam deva manuṣya ādi prakṛti pariṇāma viśeṣa rūpa nānāvidha bheda rahitam jñāna ānanda eka guṇam
translated: The nature of the individual Self is devoid of the various distinctions in the form of modifications of the Primordial Matter in the form of gods, humans, etc., and is endowed with the single quality of knowledge and bliss.

original: tasyaitasya karmakṛtadevādibhede 'padhvaste svarūpabhedo vācām agocaraḥ svasaṃvedyaḥ /
analyzed: tasya etasya karma kṛta deva ādi bhede padhvaste sva rūpa bhedaḥ vācām agocaraḥ sva saṃvedyaḥ
translated: When the distinction of gods etc. created by karma is destroyed, the distinction in the nature of words is beyond the reach of words and is to be known by oneself.

original: jñānasvarūpam ity etāvad eva nirdeśyam /
analyzed: jñāna svarūpam iti etāvat eva nirdeśyam
translated: It should be described only as the nature of knowledge.

original: tac ca sarveṣām ātmanāṃ samānam /
analyzed: tat ca sarveṣām ātmanām samānam
translated: And that is common to all selves.

original: evaṃvidhacidacidātmakaprapañcasyodbhavasthitipralayasaṃsāranirvartanaikahetubhūtaḥ
analyzed: evaṃvidha cit acit ātmaka prapañcasya udbhava sthiti pralaya saṃsāra nirvartana eka hetu bhūtaḥ
translated: Thus, the sole cause of the creation, sustenance and dissolution of the world consisting of the manifold of consciousness and non-consciousness,

original: samastaheyapratyanīkānantakalyāṇatayā ca svetarasamastavastuvilakṣaṇasvarūpo 'navadhikātiśayāsaṃkhyeyakalyāṇaguṇagaṇaḥ
analyzed: samasta heya pratyanīka ananta kalyāṇa tayā ca sva itara samasta vastu vilakṣaṇa svarūpaḥ na vadhika atiśaya asaṃkhyeya kalyāṇa guṇa gaṇaḥ
translated: and whose nature is distinguished from all other things by being the remedy for all that is to be abandoned and by having infinite auspiciousness beyond measure,

original: sarvātmaparabrahmaparajyotiḥparatattvaparamātmasadādiśabdabhedair nikhilavedāntavedyo
analyzed: sarva ātma para brahma para jyotiḥ para tattva paramātma sat ādi śabda bhedaiḥ nikhila vedānta vedyaḥ
translated: who is to be known through all the Vedānta texts by the different words such as the Self of all, supreme Brahman, supreme light, supreme truth, supreme Self, Sat and so on,

original: bhagavān nārāyaṇaḥ puruṣottama ity antaryāmisvarūpam /🔽asya ca vaibhavapratipādanaparāḥ śrutayaḥ svetarasamastacidacidvastujātāntarātmatayā
analyzed: bhagavān nārāyaṇaḥ puruṣottamaḥ iti antaryāmi svarūpam  asya ca vaibhava pratipādana parāḥ śrutayaḥ sva itara samasta cit acit vastu jāta antarātma tayā
translated: is Lord Nārāyaṇa, the best of beings, in the form of the immanent controller.🔽And the scriptures devoted to describing His glory declare Him to be the inner self of all other conscious and unconscious things,

original: nikhilaniyamanaṃ tacchaktitadaṃśatadvibhūtitadrūpataccharīratattanuprabhṛtibhiḥ śabdais
analyzed: nikhila niyamanam tad śakti tad aṃśa tad vibhūti tad rūpa tad śarīra tad tanu prabhṛtibhiḥ śabdaiḥ
translated: and to be the controller of all by the words such as His power, part of Him, manifestation of Him, form of Him, body of Him, incarnation of Him, and so on.

original: tatsāmānādhikaraṇyena ca pratipādayanti /
analyzed: tad sāmānādhikaraṇyena ca pratipādayanti
translated: And they teach this by means of co-reference.

original: tasya vaibhavapratipādanaparāṇām eṣāṃ sāmānādhikaraṇyādīnāṃ vivaraṇe pravṛttāḥ kecana nirviśeṣajñānamātram eva brahma /
analyzed: tasya vaibhava pratipādana parāṇām eṣām sāmānādhikaraṇya ādīnām vivaraṇe pravṛttāḥ kecana nirviśeṣa jñāna mātram eva brahma
translated: Some, engaged in explaining these co-references, which are intent on teaching its greatness, say that Brahman is mere knowledge without distinctions.

original: tac ca nityamuktasvaprakāśasvabhāvam api tat tvam asy ādisāmānādhikaraṇyāvagatajīvāikyaṃ /
analyzed: tat ca nitya mukta sva prakāśa svabhāvam api tat tvam asi ādi sāmānādhikaraṇya avagata jīva aikyam
translated: And that, though of the nature of eternal, liberated, self-luminous, is identical with the individual soul, as understood from the co-reference That art thou (Chand. 6.8.7).

original: brahmaivājñaṃ badhyate mucyate ca /
analyzed: brahma eva ajñam badhyate mucyate ca
translated: Brahman alone, when ignorant, is bound and liberated.

original: nirviśeṣacinmātrātirekeśvareśitavyādyanantavikalparūpaṃ kṛtsnaṃ jaganmithyā /
analyzed: nirviśeṣa cit mātra atireka īśvara īśitavya ādi ananta vikalpa rūpam kṛtsnam jagat mithyā
translated: The entire world, in the form of endless alternatives such as God, the object of control, etc., which are in excess of mere non-distinct consciousness, is false.

original: kaścid baddhaḥ /
analyzed: kaścid baddhaḥ
translated: Some are bound.

original: kaścin mukta ity iyam avasthā na vidyate /
analyzed: kaścid muktaḥ iti iyam avasthā na vidyate
translated: Some are liberated. This state does not exist.

original: itaḥ pūrvaṃ kecana muktā ity ayam artho mithyā /
analyzed: itas pūrvam kecana muktāḥ iti ayam arthaḥ mithyā
translated: The meaning that some were liberated before this is false.

original: ekam eva śarīraṃ jīvavan nirjīvānītarāṇi /
analyzed: ekam eva śarīram jīvavat nirjīvāni itarāṇi
translated: Only one body is like the individual soul, the others are without individual soul.

original: taccharīraṃ kim iti na vyavasthitam /
analyzed: tat śarīram kim iti na vyavasthitam
translated: Why is that body not determined?

original: ācāryo jñānasyopadeṣṭā mithyā śāstraṃ ca mithyā śāstrapramātā ca mithyā śāstrajanyaṃ jñānaṃ ca mithyā etat sarvaṃ mithyābhūtenaiva śāstreṇāvagamyata
analyzed: ācāryaḥ jñānasya upadeṣṭā mithyā śāstram ca mithyā śāstra pramātā ca mithyā śāstra janyam jñānam ca mithyā etat sarvam mithyā bhūtena eva śāstreṇa avagamyata
translated: The teacher, the instructor of knowledge, is false, and the scripture is false, and the verifier of the scripture is false, and the knowledge produced by the scripture is false. All this is understood only by means of a false scripture.

original: iti varṇayanti /
analyzed: iti varṇayanti
translated: Thus they describe.

original: apare tv apahatapāpmatvādisamastakalyāṇaguṇopetam api brahmaitenaivāikyāvabodhena
analyzed: apare tu apahata pāpma tva ādi samasta kalyāṇa guṇa upetam api brahma etena eva aikya avabodhena
translated: But others, even though Brahman is endowed with all auspicious qualities such as being free from evil,

original: kenacid upādhiviśeṣeṇa saṃbaddhaṃ badhyate mucyate ca nānāvidhamalarūpapariṇāmāspadaṃ ceti vyavasthitāḥ /
analyzed: kenacid upādhi viśeṣeṇa saṃbaddham badhyate mucyate ca nānāvidha mala rūpa pariṇāma āspadam ca iti vyavasthitāḥ
translated: are established that it is bound and liberated by this very knowledge of non-duality, connected with some particular limiting adjunct, and is also the basis of various transformations in the form of impurities.

original: anye punar aikyāvabodhayāthātmyaṃ varṇayantaḥ svābhāvikaniratiśayāparimitodāraguṇasāgaraṃ
analyzed: anye punar aikya avabodha yāthātmyam varṇayantaḥ svābhāvika niratiśaya aparimita udāra guṇa sāgaram
translated: But others, describing the nature of the knowledge of non-duality, argue that Brahman itself, the ocean of natural, unsurpassed, immeasurable, and vast qualities,

original: brahmaiva suranaratiryaksthāvaranārakisvargyapavargicetaneṣu svabhāvato vilakṣaṇam
analyzed: brahmā eva sura nara tiryak sthāvara nāraki svargi apavargi cetaneṣu svabhāvataḥ vilakṣaṇam
translated: is naturally different from the conscious beings in the heavens, humans, animals, plants, and hells, which are subject to rebirth and liberation,

original: avilakṣaṇaṃ ca viyadādinānāvidhamalarūpapariṇāmāspadaṃ ceti pratyavatiṣṭhante /
analyzed: avilakṣaṇam ca viyat ādi nānāvidha mala rūpa pariṇāma āspadam ca iti pratyavatiṣṭhante
translated: and is also the basis of various transformations in the form of impurities such as space, etc., without being different.

original: tatra prathamapakṣasya śrutyarthaparyālocanaparā duṣparihārān doṣān udāharanti /
analyzed: tatra prathama pakṣasya śruti artha paryālocana parāḥ duṣparihārān doṣān udāharanti
translated: Among them, those who are devoted to examining the meaning of the scriptures point out the faults that are difficult to avoid for the first view.

original: prakṛtaparāmarśitacchabdāvagatasvasaṃkalpakṛtajagadudayavibhavavilayādayas tadaikṣata
analyzed: prakṛta parāmarśi tad śabda avagata sva saṃkalpa kṛta jagat udaya vibhava vilaya ādayaḥ tadā aikṣata
translated: The words that and it refer to the original subject, and it is understood that the origination, prosperity, and dissolution of the world are created by its own will. It desired.

original: bahu syāṃ prajāyeyetyārabhya sanmūlāḥ somyemāḥ sarvāḥ prajāḥ sadāyatanāḥ satpratiṣṭhā
analyzed: bahu syām prajāyeya iti ārabhya sat mūlāḥ somya imāḥ sarvāḥ prajāḥ sat āyatanāḥ sat pratiṣṭhā
translated: Beginning with May I be many, may I be born, and ending with O Somya, all these beings have their root in Being, have Being for their abode, and Being for their support,

original: ityādibhiḥ padaiḥ pratipāditās tatsaṃbandhitayā prakaraṇāntaranirdiṣṭāḥ
analyzed: ityādibhiḥ padaiḥ pratipāditāḥ tad saṃbandhi tayā prakaraṇa antara nirdiṣṭāḥ
translated: all these qualities are indicated by these words as connected with that [Being], and are mentioned in a different context.

original: sarvajñatāsarvaśaktitvasarveśvaratvasarvaprakāratvasamābhyadhikanivṛttisatyakāmatvasatyasaṃkalpatvasarvāvabhāsakatvādyanavadhikātiśayāsaṃkhyeyakalyāṇaguṇagaṇā
translated: The innumerable multitudes of auspicious qualities such as omniscience, omnipotence, sovereignty over all, existence in all forms, freedom from equality and superiority, having true desires, having true intentions, illuminating everything, and so on, which are beyond measure and beyond number,

original: apahatapāpmetyādyanekavākyāvagatanirastanikhiladoṣatā ca sarve tasmin pakṣe vihanyante /
analyzed: apahata pāpmā ityādi aneka vākya avagata nirasta nikhila doṣa tā ca sarve tasmin pakṣe vihanyante
translated: and the state of being free from all faults, which is understood from many statements beginning with free from evil, are all contradicted in that view.

original: atha syāt upakrame 'py ekavijñānena sarvavijñānamukhena kāraṇasyaiva satyatāṃ pratijñāya
analyzed: atha syāt upakrame pi eka vijñānena sarva vijñāna mukhena kāraṇasya eva satya tām pratijñāya
translated: Now, if it is argued that at the beginning also, by the statement that through the knowledge of one, there is the knowledge of all, the truth of the cause alone is affirmed,

original: tasya kāraṇabhūtasyaiva brahmaṇaḥ satyatāṃ vikārajātasyāsatyatāṃ mṛddṛṣṭāntena darśayitvā
analyzed: tasya kāraṇa bhūtasya eva brahmaṇaḥ satya tām vikāra jātasya asatya tām mṛd dṛṣṭāntena darśayitvā
translated: and after showing by the example of clay that the existent Brahman alone is the cause, and the world of modifications is false,

original: satyabhūtasyaiva brahmaṇaḥ sad eva somyedam agra āsīd ekam evādvitīyam iti sajātīyavijātīyanikhilabhedanirasanena
analyzed: satya bhūtasya eva brahmaṇaḥ sat eva somya idam agre āsīt ekam eva advitīyam iti sajātīya vijātīya nikhila bheda nirasanena
translated: by negating all kinds of distinctions, whether of the same or different kinds, with the statement This world, O Somya, existed in the beginning as Being alone, one without a second,

original: nirviśeṣataiva pratipāditā /
analyzed: nirviśeṣa tā eva pratipāditā
translated: The state of being without distinctions has been taught.

original: etac chodhakāni prakaraṇāntaragatavākyāny api satyaṃ jñānam anantaṃ brahma /
analyzed: etat śodhakāni prakaraṇa antara gata vākyāni api satyam jñānam anantam brahma
translated: The following statements found in other contexts also purify this: Truth, knowledge, and infinite Brahman.

original: niṣkalaṃ niṣkriyaṃ nirguṇaṃ /
analyzed: niṣkalam niṣkriyam nirguṇam
translated: Partless, actionless, qualityless.

original: vijñānam ānandam ityādīni sarvaviśeṣapratyanīkaikākāratāṃ bodhayanti /
analyzed: vijñānam ānandam ityādīni sarva viśeṣa pratyanīka eka ākāra tām bodhayanti
translated: Knowledge, bliss, and so on - all of these teach the single form that is the opposite of all distinctions.

original: na caikākāratābodhane padānāṃ paryāyatā /
analyzed: na ca eka ākāra tā bodhane padānām paryāya tā
translated: And when teaching the single form, the words are not synonyms.

original: ekatve 'pi vastunaḥ sarvaviśeṣapratyanīkatopasthāpanena sarvapadānām arthavattvād iti /
analyzed: eka tve pi vastunaḥ sarva viśeṣa pratyanīka tā upasthāpanena sarva padānām arthavat tvāt iti
translated: Even when the thing is one, all the words have meaning by presenting the opposite of all distinctions.

original: naitad evam /
analyzed: na etat evam
translated: This is not so.

original: ekavijñānena sarvavijñānaṃ sarvasya mithyātve sarvasya jñātavyasyābhāvān na setsyati /
analyzed: eka vijñānena sarva vijñānam sarvasya mithyātve sarvasya jñātavyasya abhāvāt na setsyati
translated: The knowledge of all by knowing one will not be established in the case of the falsity of all, due to the absence of all that is to be known.

original: satyatvamithyātvayor ekatāprasaktir vā /
analyzed: satya tva mithyātvayoḥ eka tā prasaktiḥ vā
translated: Or there would be the consequence of the identity of truth and falsity.

original: api tv ekavijñānena sarvavijñānaṃ sarvasya tadātmakatvenaiva satyatve sidhyati /
analyzed: api tu eka vijñānena sarva vijñānam sarvasya tad ātmaka tvena eva satya tve sidhyati
translated: Rather, the knowledge of all by knowing one is established only when all is truly of the nature of that.

original: ayam arthaḥ śvetaketuṃ pratyāha stabdho 'sy uta tam ādeśam aprākṣya iti paripūrṇa iva lakṣyase tān ācāryān prati tam apy ādeśaṃ pṛṣṭavān asīti
analyzed: ayam arthaḥ śvetaketum pratyāha stabdhaḥ si uta tam ādeśam a prākṣyaḥ iti paripūrṇaḥ iva lakṣyase tān ācāryān prati tam api ādeśam pṛṣṭavān asi iti
translated: This is the meaning: He says to Shvetaketu, You are dull, or you would have asked about that instruction, as if you were complete, you would have asked about that instruction to the teachers.

original: ādiśyate 'nenety ādeśaḥ /
analyzed: ādiśyate nena iti ādeśaḥ
translated: It is an injunction because it is enjoined by this.

original: ādeṣaḥ praśāsanam /
analyzed: ādeṣaḥ praśāsanam
translated: It is an order.

original: etasya vā akṣarasya gārgi sūryācandramasau vidhṛtau tiṣṭhata ity ādibhir aikyarthyāt /
analyzed: etasya vai akṣarasya gārgi sūryācandramasau vidhṛtau tiṣṭhataḥ iti ādibhiḥ aikyarthyāt
translated: Because of the similarity of meaning with statements such as O Gargi, the sun and moon are held and stand by this syllable,

original: tathā ca mānavaṃ vacaḥ praśāsitāraṃ sarveṣām ityādi /
analyzed: tathā ca mānavam vacaḥ praśāsitāram sarveṣām ityādi
translated: and also because of the statement in the Manava [Smrti], The ruler of all... etc.

original: atrāpy ekam eveti jagadupādānatāṃ pratipādyādvitīyapadenādhiṣṭhātaranivāraṇād asyaivādhiṣṭhātṛtvam api pratipādyate /
analyzed: atra api ekam eva iti jagat upādānatām pratipādya advitīya padena adhiṣṭhātara nivāraṇāt asya eva adhiṣṭhātṛ tvam api pratipādyate
translated: Here also, after teaching that it is the material cause of the world by [the phrase] it is one only, by the word secondless [the text] teaches that it is the ruler, since it does not exclude [the possibility of] a ruler.

original: atas taṃ praśāsitāraṃ jagadupādānabhūtam api pṛṣṭavān asi yena śrutena matena vijñātenāśrutam amatam avijñānaṃ śrutaṃ mataṃ vijñātaṃ bhavatīty
analyzed: atas tam praśāsitāram jagat upādāna bhūtam api pṛṣṭavān asi yena śrutena matena vijñātena a śrutam amatam avijñānam śrutam matam vijñātam bhavati iti
translated: Therefore, you have asked about that ruler, which is the material cause of the world, by hearing about which, thinking about which, and understanding which, what has not been heard, not thought about, and not understood becomes heard, thought about, and understood.

original: uktaṃ syāt /
analyzed: uktam syāt
translated: This is what is said.

original: nikhilajagadudayavibhavavilayādikāraṇabhūtaṃ sarvajñatvasatyakāmatvasatyasaṃkalpatvaparimitodāraguṇagaṇasāgaraṃ kiṃ brahmāpi tvayā śrutam iti
analyzed: nikhila jagat udaya vibhava vilaya ādi kāraṇa bhūtam sarvajña tva satya kāma tva satya saṃkalpa tva parimita udāra guṇa gaṇa sāgaram kim brahma api tvayā śrutam iti
translated: Have you heard about Brahman, which is the cause of the origin, existence, and dissolution of the entire world, which is an ocean of immeasurable and excellent qualities such as omniscience, having true desires, and having true intentions?

original: hārdo bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: hārdaḥ bhāvaḥ
translated: This is the heartfelt sentiment.

original: tasya nikhilakāraṇatayā kāraṇam eva nānāsaṃsthānaviśeṣasaṃsthitaṃ kāryam ity ucyata
analyzed: tasya nikhila kāraṇa tayā kāraṇam eva nānā saṃsthāna viśeṣa saṃsthitam kāryam iti ucyata
translated: Since it is the cause of everything, the effect, which is arranged in various forms, is said to be the cause itself.

original: iti kāraṇabhūtasūkṣmacidacidvastuśarīrakabrahmavijñānena kārrabhūtam akhilaṃ jagad🔽vijñātaṃ bhavatīti hṛdi nidhāya yenāśrutaṃ śrutaṃ bhavaty amataṃ matam avijñātaṃ
analyzed: iti kāraṇa bhūta sūkṣma cit acit vastu śarīraka brahma vijñānena kārra bhūtam akhilam jagat  vijñātam bhavati iti hṛdi nidhāya yena a śrutam śrutam bhavati a matam matam a vijñātam
translated: Thus, by the knowledge of Brahman, which has as its body the subtle entities of consciousness and non-consciousness that are the cause, the entire world, which is the effect,🔽is known. Keeping this in mind, the father asked the son, By whom the unheard becomes heard, the unreflected upon becomes reflected upon, the unknown

original: vijñātaṃ syād iti putraṃ prati pṛṣṭavān pitā /🔽tad etatsakalasya vastujātasyaikakāraṇatvaṃ pitṛhṛdi nihitam ajānan putraḥ parasparavilakṣaṇeṣu
analyzed: vijñātam syāt iti putram prati pṛṣṭavān pitā  tat etat sakalasya vastu jātasya eka kāraṇa tvam pitṛ hṛdi nihitam a jānan putraḥ paraspara vilakṣaṇeṣu
translated: becomes known.

original: vastuṣv anyasya jñānena tadanyavijñānasyāghaṭamānatāṃ buddhvā paricodayati kathaṃ
analyzed: vastuṣu anyasya jñānena tad anya vijñānasya aghaṭamāna tām buddhvā paricodayati katham
translated: The son, not knowing that the father had in mind the oneness of the cause of the entire class of entities, understanding that the knowledge of one thing by another is not possible in mutually distinct

original: nu bagavaḥ sa ādeśa iti /
analyzed: nu bagavaḥ saḥ ādeśaḥ iti
translated: entities, asks, How, O Lord, is that instruction?

original: paricoditaḥ punas tad eva hṛdi nihitaṃ jñānānandāmalatvaikasvarūpam aparicchedyamāhātmyaṃ
analyzed: paricoditaḥ punar tat eva hṛdi nihitam jñāna ānanda amala tva eka svarūpam a paricchedya māhātmyam
translated: Again, when asked, he (the father) points out that very thing kept in mind, which has the pure nature of knowledge and bliss, whose greatness cannot be defined,

original: satyasaṃkalpatvamiśrair anavadhikātiśayāsaṃkhyeyakalyāṇaguṇagaṇair juṣṭam avikārasvarūpaṃ
analyzed: satya saṃkalpa tva miśraiḥ anavadhika atiśaya asaṃkhyeya kalyāṇa guṇa gaṇaiḥ juṣṭam a vikāra svarūpam
translated: endowed with an unlimited, extraordinary, innumerable collection of auspicious qualities mixed with the nature of true will, whose nature is unchanging,

original: paraṃ brahmaiva nāmarūpavibhāgānarhasūkṣmacidacidvastuśarīraṃ svalīlāyai svasaṃkalpenānantavicitrasthiratrasasvarūpajagatsaṃsthānaṃ
analyzed: param brahma eva nāma rūpa vibhāga anarha sūkṣma cit acit vastu śarīram sva līlāyai sva saṃkalpena ananta vicitra sthira trasa svarūpa jagat saṃsthānam
translated: The Supreme Brahman itself, which is not fit to be divided into name and form, which is the subtle body of the entities of consciousness and non-consciousness, which has arranged the universe consisting of infinite varieties of stable and moving forms by its own will for its own play,

original: svāṃśenāvasthitam iti /
analyzed: sva aṃśena avasthitam iti
translated: exists as a part of itself.

original: tajjñānenāsya nikhilasya jñātatāṃ bruvaṃl lokadṛṣṭaṃ kāryakāraṇayor ananyatvaṃ darśayituṃ
analyzed: tad jñānena asya nikhilasya jñāta tām bruvan loka dṛṣṭam kārya kāraṇayoḥ ananya tvam darśayitum
translated: In order to show that the effect and the cause are not different, as is seen in the world, by saying that everything is known by the knowledge of that,

original: dṛṣṭāntam āha yathā somyaikena mṛtpiṇḍena sarvaṃ mṛnmayaṃ vijñātaṃ syād vācārambhaṇaṃ
analyzed: dṛṣṭāntam āha yathā somya ekena mṛd piṇḍena sarvam mṛd mayam vijñātam syāt vācā ārambhaṇam
translated: he gives an example: Just as, my dear, by one lump of clay all that is made of clay would be known, the modification being a mere verbal designation,

original: vikāro nāmadheyaṃ mṛttikety eva satyam iti /
analyzed: vikāraḥ nāmadheyam mṛttikā iti eva satyam iti
translated: clay alone is the truth.

original: ekam eva mṛddravyaṃ svaikadeśena nānāvyavahārāspadatvāya ghaṭaśarāvādinānāsaṃsthānāvasthārūpavikārāpannaṃ
analyzed: ekam eva mṛd dravyam sva eka deśena nānā vyavahāra āspada tvāya ghaṭa śarāva ādi nānā saṃsthāna avasthā rūpa vikāra āpannam
translated: That very clay substance, by one part of itself, becomes the basis of various usages, having attained the modifications in the form of various shapes such as pot, dish, etc.,

original: nānānāmadheyam api mṛttikāsaṃsthānaviśeṣatvān mṛddravyam evettham avasthitaṃ na vastvantaram iti /
analyzed: nānā nāmadheyam api mṛttikā saṃsthāna viśeṣa tvāt mṛd dravyam eva ittham avasthitam na vastu antaram iti
translated: and having various names, but remaining as the clay substance itself due to being a particular shape of clay, not a different substance.

original: yathā mṛtpiṇḍavijñānena tatsaṃsthānaviśeṣarūpam ghaṭaśarāvādi sarvaṃ jñātam eva bhavatītyarthaḥ /
analyzed: yathā mṛd piṇḍa vijñānena tad saṃsthāna viśeṣa rūpam ghaṭa śarāva ādi sarvam jñātam eva bhavati iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that by the knowledge of the lump of clay, everything such as pot, dish, etc., which is in the form of its particular shape, is known.

original: tataḥ kṛtsnasya jagato brahmaikakāraṇatām ajānan putraḥ pṛcchati bhagavāṃs tv eva me tad bravītv iti /
analyzed: tatas kṛtsnasya jagataḥ brahma eka kāraṇatām a jānan putraḥ pṛcchati bhagavān tu eva me tat bravītu iti
translated: Then, not knowing that Brahman is the sole cause of the entire world, the son asks: The revered one himself should tell me that.

original: tataḥ sarvajñaṃ sarvaśakti brahmaiva sarvakāraṇam ity upadiśan sa hovāca sad eva somyedam agra āsīd ekam evādvitīyam iti /
analyzed: tatas sarvajñam sarva śakti brahma eva sarva kāraṇam iti upadiśan sa ha uvāca sat eva somya idam agre āsīt ekam eva advitīyam iti
translated: Then, teaching that Brahman alone, who is omniscient and omnipotent, is the cause of everything, he said: O Somya, this world existed as Being alone in the beginning, one only without a second.

original: atredam iti jagan nirdiṣṭam /
analyzed: atra idam iti jagat nirdiṣṭam
translated: Here, this refers to the world.

original: agra iti ca sṛṣṭeḥ pūrvakālaḥ /
analyzed: agre iti ca sṛṣṭeḥ pūrva kālaḥ
translated: And in the beginning refers to the time before creation.

original: tasmin kāle jagataḥ sadātmakatāṃ sad eveti pratipādya /
analyzed: tasmin kāle jagataḥ sat ātmaka tām sat eva iti pratipādya
translated: At that time, having taught that the world has the nature of Being, with the words as Being alone,

original: tatsṛṣṭikāle 'py aviśiṣṭam iti kṛtvaikam eveti sadāpannasya jagatas tadānīm avibhaktanāmarūpatāṃ
analyzed: tad sṛṣṭi kāle pi a viśiṣṭam iti kṛtvā ekam eva iti sat āpannasya jagataḥ tadānīm avibhakta nāma rūpa tām
translated: and having taught that even at the time of its creation it is not different, by saying one only, and having taught that the world, which is always existent, was undifferentiated in name and form at that time,

original: pratipādya tatpratipādanenaiva sato jagadupādānatvaṃ pratipāditam iti svavyatiriktanimittakāraṇam
analyzed: pratipādya tad pratipādanena eva sataḥ jagat upādānatvam pratipāditam iti sva vyatirikta nimitta kāraṇam
translated: by teaching that very thing, it has been taught that Being is the material cause of the world. Thus, a separate instrumental cause

original: advitīyapadena pratiṣiddham /
analyzed: a dvitīya padena pratiṣiddham
translated: has been negated by the word without a second.

original: tam ādeśam prākṣyo yenāśrutaṃ śrutaṃ bhavatītyādāv eva praśāstitaiva jagadupādānam iti hṛdi nihitam idānīm abhivyaktam /
analyzed: tam ādeśam prākṣyaḥ yena aśrutam śrutam bhavati ityādau eva praśāsti tā eva jagat upādānam iti hṛdi nihitam idānīm abhivyaktam
translated: That teaching, which was placed in the heart with the words that which is to be taught by which the unheard becomes heard, etc., has now been made manifest.

original: svayam eva jagadupādānaṃ jagannimittaṃ ca sat tad aikṣata bahu syāṃ prajāyeyeti /
analyzed: svayam eva jagat upādānam jagat nimittam ca sat tat aikṣata bahu syām prajāyeya iti
translated: Being itself the material cause and the efficient cause of the world, it desired: 'Let me be many, let me be born.'

original: tad etacchabdavācyaṃ paraṃ brahma sarvajñaṃ sarvaśakti satyasaṅkalpam avāptasamastakāmam
analyzed: tat etad śabda vācyam param brahma sarvajñam sarva śakti satya saṅkalpam avāpta samasta kāmam
translated: That which is denoted by the word 'that', the supreme Brahman, omniscient, omnipotent, whose will is true, who has attained all desires,

original: api līlārthaṃ vicitrānantacidacinmiśrajagadrūpeṇāham eva bahu syāṃ tadarthaṃ prajāyeyeti
analyzed: api līlā artham vicitra ananta cit acit miśra jagat rūpeṇa aham eva bahu syām tad artham prajāyeya iti
translated: even for the sake of sport, thought: 'Let me be many in the form of the diverse and infinite world of consciousness and non-consciousness, for that purpose let me be born.'

original: svayam eva saṃkalpya svāṃśaikadeśād eva viyadādibhūtāni sṛṣṭvā punar api saiva sacchabdābhihitā
analyzed: svayam eva saṃkalpya sva aṃśa eka deśāt eva viyat ādi bhūtāni sṛṣṭvā punar api sā eva sat śabda abhihitā
translated: Having thus resolved by itself, having created the elements beginning with ether from a part of itself, that same supreme deity denoted by the word 'Sat'

original: parā devataivam aikṣata hantāham imās tisro devatā anena jīvenātmanānupraviśya nāmarūpe vyākaravāṇīti /
analyzed: parā devatā evam aikṣata hanta aham imāḥ tisraḥ devatāḥ anena jīvena ātmanā anupraviśya nāma rūpe vyākaravāṇi iti
translated: thus desired: 'Let me, having entered these three deities with this living soul, evolve names and forms.'

original: anena jīvenātmaneti jīvasya brahmātmakatvaṃ pratipādya brahmātmajīvānupraveśād eva
analyzed: anena jīvena ātmanā iti jīvasya brahma ātmaka tvam pratipādya brahma ātma jīva anupraveśāt eva
translated: 'With this living soul' indicates that the living soul is of the nature of Brahman. By the entry of the Brahman-soul into the living soul,

original: kṛtsnasyācidvastunaḥ padārthatvam evaṃbhūtasyaiva sarvasya vastuno nāmabhāktvam iti ca darśayati /
analyzed: kṛtsnasya acit vastunaḥ padārtha tvam evaṃbhūtasya eva sarvasya vastunaḥ nāma bhāktvam iti ca darśayati
translated: it shows that the entire non-intelligent substance is the object, and that the entire existent substance, which is of this nature, is the possessor of names.

original: etaduktaṃ bhavati jīvātmā tu brahmaṇaḥ śarīratayā prakāratvād brahmātmakaḥ /
analyzed: etat uktam bhavati jīvātmā tu brahmaṇaḥ śarīra tayā prakāra tvāt brahma ātmakaḥ
translated: This is what is said: The individual soul, being a modification of Brahman in the form of a body, is composed of Brahman.

original: yasyātmā śarīram iti śrutyantarāt /
analyzed: yasya ātmā śarīram iti śruti antarāt
translated: Because of the scriptural text Whose body is the Self.

original: evaṃbhūtasya jīvasya śarīratayā prakārabhūtāni devamanuṣyādisaṃsthānāni vastūnīti brahmātmakāni tāni sarvāṇi /🔽ato devo manuṣyo rākṣasaḥ paśur mṛgaḥ pakṣī vṛkṣo latā kāṣṭhaṃ śilā tṛṇaṃ ghaṭaḥ
analyzed: evaṃbhūtasya jīvasya śarīra tayā prakāra bhūtāni deva manuṣya ādi saṃsthānāni vastūni iti brahma ātmakāni tāni sarvāṇi  atas devaḥ manuṣyaḥ rākṣasaḥ paśuḥ mṛgaḥ pakṣī vṛkṣaḥ latā kāṣṭham śilā tṛṇam ghaṭaḥ
translated: Thus, the individual soul, being of the nature of a body, all those entities in the forms of gods, humans, etc. are its modifications. They are all composed of Brahman.

original: paṭa ityādayaḥ sarve prakṛtipratyayayogenābhidhāyakatayā prasiddhāḥ śabdā loke tattadvācyatayā
analyzed: paṭaḥ ityādayaḥ sarve prakṛti pratyaya yogena abhidhāyaka tayā prasiddhāḥ śabdāḥ loke tad tad vācya tayā
translated: Therefore, all these words that are well-known in the world as denoting by the combination of primary and secondary meanings, such as god, human, demon, animal, deer, bird, tree, creeper, wood, stone, grass, jar,

original: pratīyamānatattatsaṃsthānavastumukhena tadabhimānijīvatadantaryāmiparamātmaparyantasaṃghātasyaiva vācakā iti /
analyzed: pratīyamāna tad tad saṃsthāna vastu mukhena tad abhimāni jīva tad antaryāmi paramātma paryanta saṃghātasya eva vācakāḥ iti
translated: cloth, etc., are denotative of the aggregate itself, which is the individual soul identified with those various forms, and the supreme Self that is its inner controller.

original: evaṃ samastacidacidātmakaprapañcasya sadupādānatāsannimittatāsadādhāratāsanniyamyatāsaccheṣatādi
analyzed: evam samasta cit acit ātmaka prapañcasya sat upādāna tā asat nimitta tā asat ādhāra tā asat niyamya tā asat śeṣa tā ādi
translated: Thus, all the statements about the manifested world consisting of the entire universe of consciousness and non-consciousness, such as being the material cause, being the instrumental cause, being the substratum, being the regulated, being the remainder of the existent, etc.,

original: sarvaṃ ca sanmūlāḥ somyemāḥ sarvāḥ prajāḥ sadāyatanāḥ satpratiṣṭhā ityādinā vistareṇa
analyzed: sarvam ca sat mūlāḥ somya imāḥ sarvāḥ prajāḥ sat āyatanāḥ sat pratiṣṭhāḥ ityādinā vistareṇa
translated: and all the statements beginning with My dear, all these beings have their root in the existent, have the existent as their abode, and the existent as their support, etc., in detail,

original: pratipādya kāryakāraṇabhāvādimukhenāitadātmyam idaṃ sarvaṃ tatsatyam iti kṛtsnasya🔽jagato brahmātmakatvam eva satyam iti pratipādya kṛtsnasya jagataḥ sa evātmā kṛtsnaṃ
analyzed: pratipādya kārya kāraṇa bhāva ādi mukhena aitadātmyam idam sarvam tat satyam iti kṛtsnasya  jagataḥ brahma ātmaka tvam eva satyam iti pratipādya kṛtsnasya jagataḥ saḥ eva ātmā kṛtsnam
translated: Having taught that this whole world is of the nature of that, and that is true, by the way of cause and effect, etc., he teaches that the Brahman-nature of the entire world alone is true.

original: jagat tasya śarīraṃ tasmāt tvaṃśabdavācyam api jīvaprakāraṃ brahmaiveti sarvasya
analyzed: jagat tasya śarīram tasmāt tvam śabda vācyam api jīva prakāram brahma eva iti sarvasya
translated: Having taught that the Brahman-nature of the entire world alone is true, he concludes that Brahman alone is the Self of the entire world, and the entire world is its body. Therefore, even what is denoted by the word that, which is of the nature of the individual soul, is Brahman alone.

original: brahmātmakatvaṃ pratijñātaṃ tat tvam asīti jīvaviśeṣa upasaṃhṛtam /
analyzed: brahma ātmaka tvam pratijñātam tat tvam asi iti jīva viśeṣaḥ upasaṃhṛtam
translated: Thus, the Brahman-nature of all is declared, and the individual soul is concluded in the words that thou art.

original: etad uktaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: etat uktam bhavati
translated: This is what is said:

original: aitadātmyam idaṃ sarvam iti cetanācetanaprapañcam idaṃ sarvam iti nirdiśya tasya prapañcasyaiṣa ātmeti pratipāditaḥ /
analyzed: aitadātmyam idam sarvam iti cetana acetana prapañcam idam sarvam iti nirdiśya tasya prapañcasya eṣaḥ ātmā iti pratipāditaḥ
translated: Having indicated that this whole world is of the nature of that, meaning that this entire world consisting of the conscious and the unconscious is this whole world, it is taught that this is the Self of that world.

original: prapañcoddeśena brahmātmakatvaṃ patipāditam ityarthaḥ /
translated: The meaning is that the Brahman-nature is taught with reference to the world.

original: tad idaṃ brahmātmakatvaṃ kim ātmaśarīrabhāvenota svarūpeṇeti vivecanīyam /
analyzed: tat idam brahma ātmaka tvam kim ātma śarīra bhāvena uta svarūpeṇa iti vivecanīyam
translated: This Brahman-nature should be examined whether it is in the form of the body of the Self or in its own nature.

original: svarūpeṇa ced brahmaṇaḥ satyasaṅkalpādyaḥ tad aikṣata bahu syaṃ prajāyeyety upakramāvagatā bādhitā bhavanti /
analyzed: sva rūpeṇa ced brahmaṇaḥ satya saṅkalpa ādyaḥ tat aikṣata bahu syam prajāyeya iti upakrama avagatāḥ bādhitāḥ bhavanti
translated: If it is in its own nature, then the statements beginning with Brahman, who is Truth, Knowledge, and Infinity, and It thought: Let me be many. Let me procreate myself, which are understood from the beginning, become contradicted.

original: śarīrātmabhāvena ca tad ātmakatvaṃ śrutyantarād viśeṣato 'vagatam antaḥpraviṣṭaḥ🔽śāstā janānāṃ sarvātmeti praśāsitṛtvarūpātmatvena sarveṣāṃ janānām antaḥpraviṣṭo
analyzed: śarīra ātma bhāvena ca tat ātmaka tvam śruti antarāt viśeṣataḥ vagatam antar praviṣṭaḥ  śāstā janānām sarva ātmā iti praśāsitṛ tva rūpa ātma tvena sarveṣām janānām antar praviṣṭaḥ
translated: And its being of the nature of the Self is known in detail from another Vedic text, as being within.🔽The controller of people, the Self of all, having entered within,🔽🔽

original: 'taḥ sarvātmā sarveṣāṃ janānām ātmā sarvaṃ cāsya śarīram iti viśeṣato jñāyate brahmātmakatvam /
analyzed: tasmāt sarva ātmā sarveṣām janānām ātmā sarvam ca asya śarīram iti viśeṣataḥ jñāyate brahma ātmaka tvam
translated: And its being of the nature of Brahman is known in detail from another Vedic text, which says:

original: ya ātmani tiṣṭhann ātmano 'ntaro yam ātmā na veda yasyātmā śarīraṃ ya ātmānam antaro yamayati sa ta ātmāntaryāmyamṛta iti ca /
analyzed: yaḥ ātmani tiṣṭhan ātmanaḥ ntaraḥ yam ātmā na veda yasya ātmā śarīram yaḥ ātmānam antaraḥ yamayati sa te ātmā antaryāmī amṛtaḥ iti ca
translated: He who, being within the Self, is the controller of the Self, whom the Self does not know, whose Self this body is, who controls the Self from within, He is your Self, the inner controller, the immortal.

original: atrāpy anena jīvenātmanetīdam eva jñāyata iti pūrvam evoktam /🔽ataḥ sarvasya cidacidvastuno brahmaśarīratvāt sarvaprakāraṃ sarvaśabdair brahmaivābhidhīyata iti tat tvam iti sāmānādhikaraṇyena jīvaśarīratayā
analyzed: atra api anena jīvena ātmanā iti idam eva jñāyate iti pūrvam eva uktam  atas sarvasya cit acit vastunaḥ brahma śarīra tvāt sarva prakāram sarva śabdaiḥ brahma eva abhidhīyate iti tat tvam iti sāmānādhikaraṇyena jīva śarīra tayā
translated: Here also, it is said earlier that this very thing is known by the statement by this individual Self.

original: jīvaprakāraṃ brahmaivābhihitam /
analyzed: jīva prakāram brahma eva abhihitam
translated: Therefore, since all things, both conscious and unconscious, are the body of Brahman, Brahman alone is denoted by all words in all ways. Thus, in the statement That art thou, Brahman alone is spoken of as the individual Self, as having the body of the individual Self, in terms of the individual Self.

original: evam abhihite saty ayam artho jñāyate tvam iti yaḥ pūrvaṃ dehasyādhiṣṭhātṛtayā pratītaḥ sa paramātmaśarīratayā paramātmaprakārabhūtaḥ paramātmaparyantaḥ
analyzed: evam abhihite sati ayam arthaḥ jñāyate tvam iti yaḥ pūrvam dehasya adhiṣṭhātṛ tayā pratītaḥ sa paramātma śarīra tayā paramātma prakāra bhūtaḥ paramātma paryantaḥ
translated: When this is said, this meaning is understood: He who was previously known as the ruler of the body is of the nature of the supreme self's body, is an aspect of the supreme self, and ends with the supreme self.

original: atas tvam iti śabdas tvatprakāraviśiṣṭaṃ tvadantaryāmiṇam evācaṣṭa iti /
analyzed: atas tvam iti śabdaḥ tvad prakāra viśiṣṭam tvad antaryāmiṇam eva ācaṣṭe iti
translated: Therefore, the word 'you' refers only to the inner controller qualified by you.

original: anena jīvenātmanānupraviśya nāmarūpe vyākaravāṇīti brahmātmakatayaiva jīvasya śarīriṇaḥ
analyzed: anena jīvena ātmanā anupraviśya nāma rūpe vyākaravāṇi iti brahma ātmaka tayā eva jīvasya śarīriṇaḥ
translated: By this individual self I have entered and will manifest names and forms. The individual self, which is of the nature of Brahman,

original: svanāmabhāktvāt tat tvam iti sāmānādhikaraṇyapravṛttayor dvayor api padayor brahmaiva vācyam /
analyzed: sva nāma bhāk tvāt tat tvam iti sāmānādhikaraṇya pravṛttayoḥ dvayoḥ api padayoḥ brahmā eva vācyam
translated: has its own name. Therefore, in the co-reference of the two words 'that' and 'you', Brahman alone is the referent.

original: tatra ca tatpadaṃ jagatkāraṇabhūtaṃ sakalakalyāṇaguṇagaṇākaraṃ nirvadyaṃ nirvikāram ācaṣṭe /🔽tvam iti ca tad eva brahma jīvāntaryāmirūpeṇa saśarīraprakāraviśiṣṭam ācaṣṭe /
analyzed: tatra ca tat padam jagat kāraṇa bhūtam sakala kalyāṇa guṇa gaṇa ākaram nirvadyam nirvikāram ācaṣṭe  tvam iti ca tat eva brahma jīva antaryāmi rūpeṇa sa śarīra prakāra viśiṣṭam ācaṣṭe
translated: And there, the word 'that' refers to Brahman, the cause of the world, the abode of all auspicious qualities, the unborn, and the changeless.🔽And the word 'you' refers to that very Brahman in the form of the inner controller of the individual soul, qualified by the body.

original: tad evaṃ pravṛttinimittabhedenaikasmin brahmaṇy eva tat tvam iti dvayoḥ padayor vṛttir uktā /
analyzed: tat evam pravṛtti nimitta bhedena ekasmin brahmaṇi eva tat tvam iti dvayoḥ padayoḥ vṛttiḥ uktā
translated: Thus, the application of the two words 'that' and 'you' is said to be on Brahman alone, which is one, by the difference in the reasons for their use.

original: brahmaṇo niravadyaṃ nirvikāraṃ sakalakalyāṇaguṇagaṇākaratvaṃ jagatkāraṇatvaṃ cābādhitam /
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ niravadyam nirvikāram sakala kalyāṇa guṇa gaṇa ākara tvam jagat kāraṇa tvam ca abādhitam
translated: The faultlessness, changelessness, and the unquestionable state of being the source of all good qualities of Brahman, and its being the cause of the world, are established.

original: aśrutavedāntāḥ puruṣāḥ padārthāḥ sarve jīvātmanaś ca brahmātmakā iti na paśyati sarvaśabdānāṃ ca kevaleṣu tattatpadārtheṣu vācyaikadeśeṣu vācyaparyavasānaṃ 🔽manyante /
analyzed: a śruta vedāntāḥ puruṣāḥ padārthāḥ sarve jīvātmanaḥ ca brahma ātmakāḥ iti na paśyati sarva śabdānām ca kevaleṣu tad tad padārtheṣu vācya eka deśeṣu vācya paryavasānam  manyante
translated: People who have not heard the Vedanta do not see that all things and all individual souls are of the nature of Brahman. They think that all words end in denoting only the individual things denoted by them.

original: idānīṃ vedāntavākyaśravaṇena brahmakāryatayā tadantaryāmitayā ca sarvasya brahmātmakatvaṃ sarvaśabdānāṃ tattatprakārasaṃsthitabrahmavācitvaṃ 🔽ca jānanti /
analyzed: idānīm vedānta vākya śravaṇena brahma kārya tayā tad antaryāmi tayā ca sarvasya brahma ātmaka tvam sarva śabdānām tad tad prakāra saṃsthita brahma vāci tvam  ca jānanti
translated: Now, by hearing the Vedanta passages, they know that everything is of the nature of Brahman as being created by Brahman or as being its immanent Self, and that all words denote Brahman in various ways.

original: nanv evaṃ gavādiśabdānāṃ tattatpadārthavācitayā vyutpattir bādhitā syāt /
analyzed: nanu evam go ādi śabdānām tad tad padārtha vāci tayā vyutpattiḥ bādhitā syāt
translated: But in that case, the etymological derivation of words like cow as denoting their respective meanings would be contradicted.

original: naivaṃ sarve śabdā acijjīvaviśiṣṭasya paramātmano vācakā ity uktam /
analyzed: na evam sarve śabdāḥ acit jīva viśiṣṭasya paramātmanaḥ vācakāḥ iti uktam
translated: It is not so, because it has been said that all words denote the Supreme Self qualified by the non-intelligent individual souls.

original: nāmarūpe vyākaravāṇīty atra /
analyzed: nāma rūpe vyākaravāṇi iti atra
translated: In the passage I shall create names and forms.

original: tatra laukikāḥ puruṣāḥ śabdaṃ vyāharantaḥ śabdavācye pradhānāṃśasya paramātmanaḥ pratyakṣādyaparicchedyatvād vācyaikadeśabhūte vācyasamāptiṃ 🔽manyante /
analyzed: tatra laukikāḥ puruṣāḥ śabdam vyāharantaḥ śabda vācye pradhāna aṃśasya paramātmanaḥ pratyakṣa ādi aparicchedya tvāt vācya eka deśa bhūte vācya samāptim  manyante
translated: There, worldly people, uttering words, consider that the meaning is completed in the part of the supreme self, which is the principal part of the meaning of the word, because it is not to be determined by perception etc., or in the part of the meaning that is a portion of the meaning.

original: vedāntaśravaṇena ca vyutpattiḥ pūryate /
analyzed: vedānta śravaṇena ca vyutpattiḥ pūryate
translated: And the understanding is completed by listening to the Vedanta.

original: evam eva vaidikāḥ sarve śabdāḥ paramātmaparyantān svārthān bodhayanti /🔽vaidikā eva sarve śabdā vedādav uddhṛtyoddhṛtya pareṇaiva brahmaṇā sarvapadārthān pūrvavat sṛṣṭvā teṣu paramātmaparyanteṣu pūrvavan nāmatayā
analyzed: evam eva vaidikāḥ sarve śabdāḥ paramātma paryantān sva arthān bodhayanti  vaidikāḥ eva sarve śabdāḥ veda ādau uddhṛtya uddhṛtya pareṇa eva brahmaṇā sarva padārthān pūrvavat sṛṣṭvā teṣu paramātma paryanteṣu pūrvavat nāma tayā
translated: In this very way, all the Vedic words convey their meanings up to the supreme self.

original: prayuktāḥ /
analyzed: prayuktāḥ
translated: All the Vedic words themselves were extracted from the Veda by the supreme Brahman itself, and all the meanings were created as before, and they were employed as names in those up to the supreme self as before.

original: tad āha manuḥ
analyzed: tat āha manuḥ
translated: This is stated by Manu:

original: sarveṣāṃ tu nāmāni karmāṇi ca pṛthak pṛthak /
analyzed: sarveṣām tu nāmāni karmāṇi ca pṛthak pṛthak
translated: But all the names and actions separately,

original: vedaśabdebhya evādau pṛthaksaṃsthāś ca nirmame //
analyzed: veda śabdebhyaḥ eva ādau pṛthak saṃsthāḥ ca nirmame
translated: he created from the Vedic words alone in the beginning, and also separate forms.

original: iti / saṃsthāḥ saṃsthānāni rūpāṇīti yāvat /
analyzed: iti saṃsthāḥ saṃsthānāni rūpāṇi iti yāvat
translated: Forms means shapes.

original: āha ca bhagavān parāśaraḥ
analyzed: āha ca bhagavān parāśaraḥ
translated: And the Blessed Lord Parashara says:

original: nāma rūpaṃ bhūtānāṃ kṛtyānāṃ prapañcanam /
analyzed: nāma rūpam bhūtānām kṛtyānām prapañcanam
translated: He created the names and forms of beings and the details of their actions,

original: vedaśabdebhya evādau daivādīnāṃ cakāra saḥ //
analyzed: veda śabdebhyaḥ eva ādau daiva ādīnām cakāra saḥ
translated: from the Vedic words alone in the beginning, and also the deities and others.

original: iti / śrutiś ca sūryācandramasau dhātā yathāpūrvam akalpayad iti /
analyzed: iti śrutiḥ ca sūryācandramasau dhātā yathāpūrvam akalpayat iti
translated: And the Śruti says, “The Creator fashioned the sun and the moon as before.”

original: sūryādīn pūrvavat parikalpya nāmāni ca pūrvavac cakāra ityarthaḥ /
analyzed: sūrya ādīn pūrvavat parikalpya nāmāni ca pūrvavat cakāra iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that having imagined the sun and so on as before, he created the names as before.

original: evaṃ jagadbrahmaṇor ananyatvaṃ prapañcitam /
analyzed: evam jagat brahmaṇoḥ ananya tvam prapañcitam
translated: Thus the non-difference of the world and Brahman has been elaborated.

original: tenaikena jñātena sarvasya jñātato 'papāditā bhavati /
analyzed: tena ekena jñātena sarvasya upapāditā bhavati
translated: By that alone being known, the knownness of all is established.

original: sarvasya brahmakāryatvapratipādanena tadātmakatayaiva satyatvaṃ nānyatheti tat satyam ityuktam /
analyzed: sarvasya brahma kārya tva pratipādanena tad ātmaka tayā eva satya tvam na anyathā iti tat satyam iti uktam
translated: By establishing that all is the effect of Brahman, its reality is by that alone as its essence, not otherwise. Therefore it is said, “That is the truth.”

original: yathā dṛṣṭānte sarvasya mṛdvikārasya mṛdātmanaiva satyatvam /
analyzed: yathā dṛṣṭānte sarvasya mṛd vikārasya mṛd ātmanā eva satya tvam
translated: Just as in the example, the reality of all modifications of clay is by the clay alone as their essence.

original: śodhakavākyāny api niravadyaṃ sarvakalyāṇaguṇākaraṃ paraṃ brahma bodhayanti /
analyzed: śodhaka vākyāni api niravadyam sarva kalyāṇa guṇa ākaram param brahma bodhayanti
translated: The purifying statements also reveal the supreme Brahman, which is faultless and the source of all auspicious qualities.

original: sarvapratyanīkākāratābodhane 'pi tattatpratyanīkākāratāyāṃ bhedasyāvarjanīyatvān na nirviśeṣavastusiddhiḥ /
analyzed: sarva pratyanīka ākāra tā bodhane tad tad pratyanīka ākāra tāyām bhedasya avarjanīya tvāt na nirviśeṣa vastu siddhiḥ
translated: Even in the revelation of the form that is the opposite of all, the difference in each opposite form cannot be avoided, so the establishment of a thing without distinctions is not possible.

original: nanu ca jñānamātraṃ brahmeti pratipādite nirviśeṣajñānamātraṃ brahmeti niścīyate /
analyzed: nanu ca jñāna mātram brahma iti pratipādite nirviśeṣa jñāna mātram brahma iti niścīyate
translated: But when it is taught that Brahman is mere knowledge, it is ascertained that Brahman is mere knowledge without distinctions.

original: naivaṃ /
analyzed: na evam
translated: It is not so.

original: svarūpanirūpaṇadharmaśabdā hi dharmamukhena svarūpam api pratipādayanti /
analyzed: svarūpa nirūpaṇa dharma śabdāḥ hi dharma mukhena svarūpam api pratipādayanti
translated: For words denoting attributes, by means of the attribute, convey the nature [of the object] also.

original: gavādiśabdavat /
analyzed: go ādi śabda vat
translated: Like the words 'cow' etc.

original: tad āha sūtrakāraḥ tadguṇasāratvāt tadvyapadeśaḥ prājñavat /
analyzed: tat āha sūtrakāraḥ tad guṇa sāra tvāt tad vyapadeśaḥ prājña vat
translated: The author of the Sutra says this: The designation [of Brahman as 'sat' etc.] is due to its being the essence of those qualities, like the wise one [Prajapati].

original: yāvad ātmabhāvitatvāc ca na doṣa iti /
analyzed: yāvat ātma bhāvita tvāt ca na doṣaḥ iti
translated: And there is no fault due to its being meditated upon as long as the individual existence [of the knower].

original: jñānena dharmeṇa svarūpam api nirūpitaṃ na jñānamātraṃ brahmeti /
analyzed: jñānena dharmeṇa svarūpam api nirūpitam na jñāna mātram brahma iti
translated: The nature is also indicated by the attribute of knowledge, not just knowledge alone is Brahman.

original: katham idam avagamyata iti ced yaḥ sarvajñaḥ sarvavid ityādijñātṛtvaśruteḥ parāsya śaktir vividhaiva śrūyate svābhāvikī jñānabalakriyā ca /
analyzed: katham idam avagamyate iti ced yaḥ sarvajñaḥ sarva vid ityādi jñātṛ tva śruteḥ parā asya śaktiḥ vividhā eva śrūyate svābhāvikī jñāna bala kriyā ca
translated: If it is asked how this is understood, it is because of the statement of the knower in passages such as 'He who knows all, who knows all' etc. The various powers of Brahman are heard to be natural, of knowledge, strength, and action.

original: vijñātāram are kena vijānīyād ityādiśrutiśatasamadhigatam idam /
analyzed: vijñātāram are kena vijānīyāt ityādi śruti śata samadhigatam idam
translated: By whom can the knower be known? etc. This is understood from hundreds of such statements.

original: jñānasya dharmamātratvād dharmamātrasyaikasya vastutvapratipādanānupapatteś ca /
analyzed: jñānasya dharma mātra tvāt dharma mātrasya ekasya vastu tva pratipādana anupapatteḥ ca
translated: Because knowledge is merely an attribute, and because it is not possible to establish that an attribute alone is the reality.

original: ataḥ satyajñānādipadāni svārthabhūtajñānādiviśiṣṭam eva brahma pratipādayanti /
analyzed: atas satya jñāna ādi padāni svārtha bhūta jñāna ādi viśiṣṭam eva brahma pratipādayanti
translated: Therefore, the words 'truth', 'knowledge', etc. convey Brahman itself as qualified by the knowledge etc. which are its own meanings.

original: tat tvam iti dvayor api padayoḥ svārthaprahāṇena nirviśeṣavastusvarūpopasthāpanaparatve mukhyārthaparityāgaś ca /
analyzed: tat tvam iti dvayoḥ api padayoḥ sva artha prahāṇena nirviśeṣa vastu svarūpa upasthāpana para tve mukhya artha parityāgaḥ ca
translated: And in the two words tat and tvam, there is a giving up of their own meanings, and the purpose is to present the nature of a thing without distinction.

original: nanv aikye tātparyaniścayān na lakṣaṇādoṣaḥ /
analyzed: nanu aikye tātparya niścayāt na lakṣaṇā doṣaḥ
translated: But if oneness is the purport, there is no fault of indication.

original: so 'yaṃ devadatta itivat /
analyzed: saḥ yam devadattaḥ itivat
translated: Like This is Devadatta.

original: yathā so 'yam ity atra sa iti śabdena deśāntarakālāntarasaṃbandhī puruṣaḥ pratīyata ayam iti ca saṃnihitadeśavartamānakālasaṃbandhī /
analyzed: yathā saḥ yam iti atra saḥ iti śabdena deśa antara kāla antara saṃbandhī puruṣaḥ pratīyata ayam iti ca saṃnihita deśa vartamāna kāla saṃbandhī
translated: Just as in This is he, by the word sa a person related to another place and time is understood, and by ayaṃ one related to the present place and time.

original: tayoḥ sāmānādhikaraṇyenāikyaṃ pratīyate /
analyzed: tayoḥ sāmānādhikaraṇyena aikyam pratīyate
translated: Their oneness is understood by the co-reference of the two.

original: tatraikasya yugapadviruddhadeśakālasaṃbandhitayā pratītir na ghaṭata iti dvayor padayoḥ svarūpamātropasthāpanaparatvaṃ svarūpasya cāikyaṃ pratipadyata
analyzed: tatra ekasya yugapad viruddha deśa kāla saṃbandhi tayā pratītiḥ na ghaṭate iti dvayoḥ padayoḥ svarūpa mātra upasthāpana para tvam svarūpasya ca aikyam pratipadyata
translated: In that case, the understanding of one as related to mutually contradictory places and times simultaneously is not possible, so the two words have the purpose of presenting mere nature, and the nature is understood as one.

original: iti cen naitad evam /
analyzed: iti ced na etat evam
translated: If this is argued, it is not so.

original: so 'yaṃ devadatta ity atrāpi lakṣaṇāgandho na vidyate /
analyzed: saḥ yam devadattaḥ iti atra api lakṣaṇā gandhaḥ na vidyate
translated: Even in This is Devadatta, there is no trace of indication.

original: virodhābhāvāt /
analyzed: virodha abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no contradiction.

original: ekasya bhūtavartamānakriyādvayasaṃbaṃdho na viruddhaḥ /
analyzed: ekasya bhūta vartamāna kriyā dvaya saṃbaṃdhaḥ na viruddhaḥ
translated: The relation of one to two actions, past and present, is not contradictory.

original: deśāntarasthitir bhūtvā saṃnihitadeśasthitir vartate /
analyzed: deśa antara sthitiḥ bhūtvā saṃnihita deśa sthitiḥ vartate
translated: Having become situated in a different place, it exists as situated in the place where it is present.

original: ato bhūtavartamānakriyādvayasaṃbandhitayāikyapratipādanam aviruddham /
analyzed: atas bhūta vartamāna kriyā dvaya saṃbandhi tayā āikya pratipādanam aviruddham
translated: Therefore, the teaching of identity in relation to both the past and present actions is not contradictory.

original: deśadvayavirodhaś ca kālabhedena parihṛtaḥ /
analyzed: deśa dvaya virodhaḥ ca kāla bhedena parihṛtaḥ
translated: And the contradiction of the two places is resolved by the difference in time.

original: lakṣaṇāyām api na dvayor api padayor lakṣaṇāsamāśrayaṇam /
analyzed: lakṣaṇāyām api na dvayoḥ api padayoḥ lakṣaṇā samāśrayaṇam
translated: Even in the case of secondary meaning, both words do not rely on secondary meaning.

original: etenaiva lakṣitena virodhaparihārāt /
analyzed: etena eva lakṣitena virodha parihārāt
translated: Because the contradiction is resolved by the very fact that it is indicated.

original: lakṣaṇābhāva evoktaḥ /
analyzed: lakṣaṇa abhāvaḥ eva uktaḥ
translated: The absence of secondary meaning is itself stated.

original: deśāntarasaṃbandhitayā bhūtasyaivānyadeśasaṃbandhitayā vartamānatvāvirodhāt /
analyzed: deśa antara saṃbandhi tayā bhūtasya eva anya deśa saṃbandhi tayā vartamāna tva avirodhāt
translated: Because there is no contradiction in the very past being present in relation to another place by being related to another place.

original: evam atrāpi jagatkāraṇabūtasyaiva parasya brahmaṇo jīvāntaryāmitayā jīvātmatvam aviruddham iti pratipāditam /
analyzed: evam atra api jagat kāraṇa būtasya eva parasya brahmaṇaḥ jīva antaryāmi tayā jīvātma tvam aviruddham iti pratipāditam
translated: In the same way, it has been shown here that it is not contradictory for the supreme Brahman, which is the cause of the world, to have the nature of the individual soul by being the inner controller of the individual soul.

original: yathā bhūtayor eva hi dvayor aikyaṃ sāmānādhikaraṇyena pratīyate /
analyzed: yathā bhūtayoḥ eva hi dvayoḥ aikyam sāmānādhikaraṇyena pratīyate
translated: For the identity of the two past things is understood by co-reference.

original: tatparityāgena svarūpamātrāikyaṃ na sāmānādhikaraṇyārthaḥ bhinnapravṛttinimittānāṃ śabdānām ekasminn arthe vṛttiḥ sāmānādhikaraṇyam iti hi
analyzed: tad parityāgena svarūpa mātra aikyam na sāmānādhikaraṇya arthaḥ bhinna pravṛtti nimittānām śabdānām ekasmin arthe vṛttiḥ sāmānādhikaraṇyam iti hi
translated: The identity of mere nature by abandoning that is not the meaning of co-reference. The application of words with different causes of application to one meaning is co-reference. This is because

original: tathābhūtayor aikyam upapāditam asmābhiḥ /
analyzed: tathābhūtayoḥ aikyam upapāditam asmābhiḥ
translated: And we have shown that the identity of the two is possible.

original: upakramavirodhyupasaṃhārapadena vākyatātparyaniścayaś ca na ghaṭate /
analyzed: upakrama virodhi upasaṃhāra padena vākya tātparya niścayaḥ ca na ghaṭate
translated: Nor is it possible to ascertain the purport of a sentence by the words of the conclusion which are opposed to the opening.

original: upakrame hi tad aikṣata bahu syām ityādinā satyasaṃkalpatvaṃ jagadekakāraṇatvam apy uktam /
analyzed: upakrame hi tat aikṣata bahu syām ityādinā satya saṃkalpa tvam jagat eka kāraṇatvam api uktam
translated: For in the beginning, by the words, 'It thought, let me be many,' etc., the fact of Brahman being the one cause of the world, and having true desires, has been stated.

original: tadvirodhi cāvidyāśrayatvādi brahmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: tad virodhi ca avidyā āśraya tva ādi brahmaṇaḥ
translated: And the fact of Brahman being the substratum of ignorance, etc., is opposed to that.

original: api cārthabhedatatsaṃsargaviśeṣabodhanakṛtapadavākyasya svarūpatālabdhapramāṇabhāvasya śabdasya nirviśeṣavastubodhanāsāmarthān na nirviśeṣavastuni
analyzed: api ca artha bheda tad saṃsarga viśeṣa bodhana kṛta pada vākyasya sva rūpa tā labdha pramāṇa bhāvasya śabdasya nirviśeṣa vastu bodhana a sāmarthāt na nirviśeṣa vastuni
translated: Moreover, a word, which has become a means of valid knowledge by acquiring the nature of a sentence which conveys the knowledge of the difference of the meaning and the particular connection of that, is not capable of conveying the knowledge of a thing which is devoid of all distinctions.

original: śabdaḥ pramāṇam /
analyzed: śabdaḥ pramāṇam
translated: Therefore, a word is not a means of valid knowledge in regard to a thing which is devoid of all distinctions.

original: nirviśeṣa ityādiśabdās tu kenacid viśeṣeṇa viśiṣṭatayāvagatasya vastuno vastvantaragataviśeṣaniṣedhaparatayā bodhakāḥ /
analyzed: nirviśeṣaḥ ityādi śabdāḥ tu kenacid viśeṣeṇa viśiṣṭa tayā avagatasya vastunaḥ vastu antara gata viśeṣa niṣedha para tayā bodhakāḥ
translated: But words like 'without distinction' convey the sense of the negation of the distinction which belongs to another thing, of a thing which is known as qualified by some distinction.

original: itarathā teṣam apy anavabodhakatvam eva /
analyzed: itarathā teṣam api anavabodhaka tvam eva
translated: Otherwise, they also would not convey any sense.

original: prakṛtipratyayarūpeṇa padasyaivānekaviśeṣagarbhatvād anekapadārthasaṃsargabodhakatvāc ca vākyasya /
analyzed: prakṛti pratyaya rūpeṇa padasya eva aneka viśeṣa garbha tvāt aneka padārtha saṃsarga bodhaka tvāt ca vākyasya
translated: Because a word, in the form of a root and a suffix, contains many meanings, and a sentence conveys the knowledge of the connection of many meanings.

original: atha syāt nāsmābhir nirviśeṣe svayaṃprakāśe vastuni śabdaḥ pramāṇam ity ucyate /
analyzed: atha syāt na asmābhiḥ nirviśeṣe svayam prakāśe vastuni śabdaḥ pramāṇam iti ucyate
translated: Now, it may be said: We do not say that words are a means of valid knowledge regarding a self-luminous entity without distinctions.

original: svataḥsiddhasya pramāṇānapekṣatvāt /
analyzed: svatas siddhasya pramāṇa anapekṣa tvāt
translated: Because what is self-established does not depend on a means of valid knowledge.

original: sarvaiḥ śabdais taduparāgaviśeṣā jñātṛtvādayaḥ sarve nirasyante /
analyzed: sarvaiḥ śabdaiḥ tad uparāga viśeṣāḥ jñātṛ tva ādayaḥ sarve nirasyante
translated: By all words, all distinctions such as knowership that are superimposed on it are excluded.

original: sarveṣu viśeṣeṣu nivṛtteṣu vastumātram anavacchinnaṃ svayaṃprakāśaṃ svata evāvatiṣṭhata iti /
analyzed: sarveṣu viśeṣeṣu nivṛtteṣu vastu mātram anavacchinnam svayaṃprakāśam svatas eva avatiṣṭhate iti
translated: When all distinctions are removed, the mere entity, unrestricted, self-luminous, remains by itself.

original: naitad evam /
analyzed: na etat evam
translated: This is not so.

original: kena śabdena tadvastu nirdiśya tadgataviśeṣā nirasyante /
analyzed: kena śabdena tat vastu nirdiśya tad gata viśeṣāḥ nirasyante
translated: By which word is that entity indicated and the distinctions belonging to it excluded?

original: jñaptimātraśabdeneti cen na /
analyzed: jñapti mātra śabdena iti ced na
translated: If it is said by the word mere cognition, no.

original: so 'pi saviśeṣam eva vastvavalambate /
analyzed: saḥ pi sa viśeṣam eva vastu avalambate
translated: That also refers to an entity with distinctions,

original: prakṛtipratyayarūpeṇa viśeṣagarbhatvāt /
analyzed: prakṛti pratyaya rūpeṇa viśeṣa garbha tvāt
translated: because it contains distinctions in the form of the verbal root and suffix.

original: jñā avabodhana iti sakarmakaḥ sakartṛkaḥ kriyāviśeṣaḥ kriyāntaravyāvartakasvabhāvaviśeṣaś ca prakṛtyāvagamyate /
analyzed: jñā avabodhane iti sa karmakaḥ sa kartṛkaḥ kriyā viśeṣaḥ kriyā antara vyāvartaka svabhāva viśeṣaḥ ca prakṛtyā avagamyate
translated: By the verbal root, a particular action that has an object and an agent, and a specific nature that excludes other actions, is understood.

original: pratyayena ca liṅgasaṃkhyādayaḥ /
analyzed: pratyayena ca liṅga saṃkhyā ādayaḥ
translated: And by the suffix, gender, number, etc. are understood.

original: svataḥsiddhāv apy etatsvabhāvaviśeṣavirahe siddhir eva na syāt /
analyzed: svatas siddhau api etad svabhāva viśeṣa virahe siddhiḥ eva na syāt
translated: Even if this were self-established, if it were devoid of specific natures, there would be no establishment at all.

original: anyasādhanasvabhāvatayā hi jñapteḥ svataḥsiddhir ucyate /
analyzed: anya sādhana svabhāva tayā hi jñapteḥ svatas siddhiḥ ucyate
translated: For the self-establishment of cognition is said to be by way of its own nature as the means of knowledge.

original: brahmasvarūpaṃ kṛtsnaṃ sarvadā svayam eva prakāśate cen na tasminn anyadharmādhyāsaḥ saṃbhavati /
analyzed: brahma svarūpam kṛtsnam sarvadā svayam eva prakāśate ced na tasmin anya dharma adhyāsaḥ saṃbhavati
translated: If the entire nature of Brahman always shines forth by itself, then the superimposition of other attributes upon it is not possible.

original: na hi rajjusvarūpe 'vabhāsamāne sarpatvādir adhyasyate /
analyzed: na hi rajju svarūpe vabhāsamāne sarpa tva ādiḥ adhyasyate
translated: For when the nature of the rope appears, the quality of being a snake, etc., is not superimposed.

original: ata eva hi bhavadbhir ācchādikāvidyābhyupagamyate /
analyzed: atas eva hi bhavadbhiḥ ācchādikā vidyā abhyupagamyate
translated: For this very reason, you accept the covering ignorance.

original: tataś ca śāstrīyanivartakajñānasya brahmaṇi tirohitāṃśo viṣayaḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca śāstrīya nivartaka jñānasya brahmaṇi tirohita aṃśaḥ viṣayaḥ
translated: And therefore the object of the scriptural knowledge that removes ignorance is the hidden part in Brahman.

original: anyathā tasya nivartakatvaṃ ca na syāt /
analyzed: anyathā tasya nivartaka tvam ca na syāt
translated: Otherwise, it would not be the remover.

original: adhiṣṭhānātirekirajjutvaprakāśanena hi sarpatvaṃ bādhyate /
analyzed: adhiṣṭhāna atireki rajju tva prakāśanena hi sarpa tvam bādhyate
translated: For the quality of being a snake is negated by the manifestation of the rope as something different from the substratum.

original: ekaś ced viśeṣo jñānamātre vastuni śabdenābhidhīyate sa ca brahmaviśeṣaṇaṃ bhavatīti sarvaśrutipratipāditasarvaviśeṣaṇaviśiṣṭaṃ brahma bhavati
analyzed: ekaḥ ced viśeṣaḥ jñāna mātre vastuni śabdena abhidhīyate sa ca brahma viśeṣaṇam bhavati iti sarva śruti pratipādita sarva viśeṣaṇa viśiṣṭam brahma bhavati
translated: If a particular is denoted by a word in a mere cognition of an object, and that becomes a qualification of Brahman, then Brahman becomes qualified by all the qualifications taught by all the scriptures.

original: ataḥ prāmāṇikānāṃ na kenāpi pramāṇena nirviśeṣavastusiddhiḥ /
analyzed: atas prāmāṇikānām na kena api pramāṇena nirviśeṣa vastu siddhiḥ
translated: Therefore, for the authoritative, there is no establishment of a thing without qualifications by any means of knowledge.

original: nirvikalpakapratyakṣe 'pi saviśeṣam eva vastu pratīyate /
analyzed: nirvikalpaka pratyakṣe sa viśeṣam eva vastu pratīyate
translated: Even in non-conceptual perception, the thing is cognized as qualified.

original: anyathā savikalpake so 'yam iti pūrvāvagataprakāraviśiṣṭapratyayānupapatteḥ /
analyzed: anyathā savikalpake saḥ yam iti pūrva avagata prakāra viśiṣṭa pratyaya anupapatteḥ
translated: Otherwise, in the case of determinate perception, the cognition of the object as qualified by the previously cognized universal would be impossible.

original: vastusaṃsthānaviśeṣarūpatvād gotvāder nirvikalpatadaśāyām api sasaṃsthānam eva vastv ittham iti pratīyate /
analyzed: vastu saṃsthāna viśeṣa rūpa tvāt go tva ādeḥ nirvikalpa tā daśāyām api sa saṃsthānam eva vastu ittham iti pratīyate
translated: Even in the state of indeterminate perception, the object is cognized as having a particular arrangement, because the universal 'cow' etc. has the form of a particular arrangement.

original: dvitīyādipratyayeṣu tasya saṃsthānaviśeṣasyānekavastuniṣṭhatāmātraṃ pratīyate /
analyzed: dvitīyā ādi pratyayeṣu tasya saṃsthāna viśeṣasya aneka vastu niṣṭha tā mātram pratīyate
translated: In the second and subsequent cognitions, only the fact that that particular arrangement belongs to many objects is cognized.

original: saṃsthānarūpaprakārākhyasya padārthasyānekavastuniṣṭhatayānekavastuviśeṣaṇatvaṃ dvitīyādipratyayāvagamyam iti dvitīyādipratyayāḥ savikalpakā 🔽ity ucyante /
analyzed: saṃsthāna rūpa prakāra ākhyasya padārthasya aneka vastu niṣṭha tayā aneka vastu viśeṣaṇa tvam dvitīya ādi pratyaya avagamyam iti dvitīya ādi pratyayāḥ sa vikalpakā  iti ucyante
translated: The fact that the object, which is of the form of an arrangement called a universal, belongs to many objects, and is thus the qualifier of many objects, is cognized by the second and subsequent cognitions. Therefore, the second and subsequent cognitions are said to be determinate.

original: ata evaikasya padārthasya bhinnābhinnatvarūpeṇa dvyātmakatvaṃ viruddhaṃ pratyuktam /
analyzed: atas eva ekasya padārthasya bhinna abhinna tva rūpeṇa dvi ātmaka tvam viruddham pratyuktam
translated: For this very reason, the contradiction in the dual nature of a single object as both different and non-different is refuted.

original: saṃsthānasya saṃsthāninaḥ prakāratayā padārthāntaratvam /
analyzed: saṃsthānasya saṃsthāninaḥ prakāra tayā padārtha antara tvam
translated: The arrangement is a different object from the arranged, as a universal.

original: prakāratvād eva pṛthaksiddhyanarhatvaṃ pṛthaganupalambhaś ceti na dvyātmakatvasiddhiḥ /
analyzed: prakāra tvāt eva pṛthak siddhi anarha tvam pṛthak anupalambhaḥ ca iti na dvi ātmaka tva siddhiḥ
translated: Due to being a universal, it is not capable of separate existence, and is not apprehended separately. Thus, its dual nature is not established.

original: api ca nirviśeṣavastvādinā svayaṃprakāśe vastuni taduparāgaviśeṣāḥ sarvaiḥ śabdair nirasyanta iti vadatā ke te śabdā niṣedhakā iti vaktavyam
analyzed: api ca nirviśeṣa vastu ādinā svayam prakāśe vastuni tad uparāga viśeṣāḥ sarvaiḥ śabdaiḥ nirasyante iti vadatā ke te śabdāḥ niṣedhakāḥ iti vaktavyam
translated: Moreover, when a thing is self-luminous without any distinctions, all the distinctions that may be superimposed on it by words are negated. But it must be said: which are those words that negate?

original: vācārambhaṇaṃ vikāro nāmadheyaṃ mṛttikety eva satyam iti vikāranāmadheyayor vācārambhaṇamātratvāt /
analyzed: vācā ārambhaṇam vikāraḥ nāmadheyam mṛttikā iti eva satyam iti vikāra nāmadheyayoḥ vācā ārambhaṇa mātra tvāt
translated: It is said: The modification is a mere verbal expression, the name is a mere verbal expression, only earth is real. Because the modification and the name are mere verbal expressions,

original: yat tatra kāraṇatayopalakṣyate vastumātraṃ tad eva satyam anyad asatyam itīyaṃ śrutir vadatīti cen naitad upapadyate /
analyzed: yat tatra kāraṇa tayā upalakṣyate vastu mātram tat eva satyam anyat asatyam iti iyam śrutiḥ vadati iti ced na etat upapadyate
translated: if it is argued that the scripture says that only that thing which is perceived as the cause there is real, and everything else is unreal, that is not correct.

original: ekasmin vijñāte sarvaṃ vijñātaṃ bhavatīti pratijñāte 'nyajñānenānyajñānāsaṃbhavaṃ
analyzed: ekasmin vijñāte sarvam vijñātam bhavati iti pratijñāte
translated: When the proposition is made that when one thing is known, everything is known, if one thinks that knowledge of one thing cannot bring about knowledge of another,

original: manvānasyaikam eva vastu vikārādyavasthāviśeṣeṇa pāramārthikenaiva nāmarūpam avasthitaṃ
analyzed: manvānasya ekam eva vastu vikāra ādi avasthā viśeṣeṇa pāramārthikena eva nāma rūpam avasthitam
translated: and if one thinks that only one thing exists, with a particular state of modification as its real name and form,

original: cet tatraikasmin vijñāte tasmād vilakṣaṇasaṃsthānāntaram api tad eveti tatra dṛṣṭānto 'yaṃ nidarśitaḥ /
analyzed: ced tatra ekasmin vijñāte tasmāt vilakṣaṇa saṃsthāna antaram api tat eva iti tatra dṛṣṭāntaḥ yam nidarśitaḥ
translated: then this example is shown: When one thing is known, even another thing with a different configuration is the same.

original: nātra kasyacid viśeṣasya niṣedhakaḥ ko 'pi śabdo dṛśyate /
analyzed: na atra kasyacid viśeṣasya niṣedhakaḥ śabdaḥ dṛśyate
translated: No word is seen here that negates any distinction.

original: vācārambhaṇam iti vācā vyavahāreṇārabhyata ity ārambhaṇam /🔽piṇḍarūpeṇāvasthitāyāḥ mṛttikāyā nāma vānyadvyavahāraś cānyaḥ /
analyzed: vācā ārambhaṇam iti vācā vyavahāreṇa ārabhyate iti ārambhaṇam  piṇḍa rūpeṇa avasthitāyāḥ mṛttikāyāḥ nāma vā anya vyavahāraḥ ca anyaḥ
translated: Or, the word ‘vā’ may be taken as having the sense of ‘eva’, ‘only’; the meaning in that case being ‘the world is only a verbal expression, a mere name, a mere convention’.🔽The name and the convention relating to the clay that lies there in the lump-form is one;

original: ghaṭaśarāvādirūpeṇāvasthitāyās tasyā eva mṛttikāyā anyāni nāmadheyāni vyavahārāś cānyaddaśāḥ /
analyzed: ghaṭa śarāva ādi rūpeṇa avasthitāyāḥ tasyāḥ eva mṛttikāyāḥ anyāni nāmadheyāni vyavahārāḥ ca anya daśāḥ
translated: and the names and the conventions relating to the same clay when it is in the form of the jar, the saucer and so forth are different.🔽Even so, in all cases, it is the same substance, Clay, that is spoken of by different names and conventions, in accordance with its different forms and shapes; and this is the only truth; this is what is indicated by the other knowledge.

original: tathāpi sarvatra mṛttikādravyam ekam eva nānāsaṃsthānanānānāmadheyābhyāṃ nānāvyavahāreṇa cārabhyata ityetad eva satyam ity anenānyajñānenānyajñānasaṃbhavo 🔽nidarśitaḥ /
analyzed: tathā api sarvatra mṛttikā dravyam ekam eva nānā saṃsthāna nānā nāmadheyābhyām nānā vyavahāreṇa ca ārabhyate iti etat eva satyam iti anena anya jñānena anya jñāna saṃbhavaḥ  nidarśitaḥ
translated: In this way, it is shown that the knowledge of one thing is possible through the knowledge of another.

original: nātra kiṃcid vastu niṣidhyata iti pūrvam evāyam arthaḥ prapañcitaḥ / 🔽api ca yenāśrutaṃ śrutam ityādinā brahmavyatiriktasya sarvasya mithyātvaṃ pratijñātaṃ ced yathā somyaikena mṛtpiṇḍenetyādidṛṣṭāntaḥ sādhyavikalaḥ
analyzed: na atra kiṃcid vastu niṣidhyate iti pūrvam eva ayam arthaḥ prapañcitaḥ  api ca yena a śrutam śrutam ityādinā brahma vyatiriktasya sarvasya mithyātvam pratijñātam ced yathā somya ekena mṛd piṇḍena ityādi dṛṣṭāntaḥ sādhya vikalaḥ  /
translated: It has been explained before that in this case, nothing is denied.

original: syāt /
analyzed: syāt
translated: Further, if it were declared that all things, other than Brahman, are false, by such passages as ‘what was not, that became’, then the instance cited in the passage ‘just as, my dear, by one clod of clay’ would be devoid of the probandum.

original: rajjusarpādivan mṛttikāvikārasya ghaṭaśarāvāder asatyatvaṃ śvetaketoḥ śuśrūṣoḥ pramāṇāntareṇa yuktyā cāsiddham ity etad api siṣādhayiṣitam 🔽iti cet /
analyzed: rajju sarpa ādi vat mṛttikā vikārasya ghaṭa śarāva ādeḥ asatya tvam śvetaketoḥ śuśrūṣoḥ pramāṇa antareṇa yuktyā ca asiddham iti etat api siṣādhayiṣitam  iti ced
translated: If it be said that the unreality of the modifications of clay, such as the jar, the saucer, etc., like the unreality of the rope-snake, is not established by other means of knowledge and by reasoning for Śvetaketu who is desirous of learning, then this also is to be proved.

original: yatheti dṛṣṭāntayopādānaṃ na ghaṭate /
analyzed: yathā iti dṛṣṭāntayā upādānam na ghaṭate
translated: If it be said that the use of the example in the words 'as' is not appropriate,

original: sad eva somyedam agra āsīd ekam evādvitīyam evādvitīyam ity atra sad evaikam evety
analyzed: sat eva somya idam agre āsīt ekam eva advitīyam eva advitīyam iti atra sat eva ekam eva iti
translated: because in the passage 'This, verily, O Somya, was Being in the beginning, one only, without a second' the two determinatives 'verily' and 'one only'

original: avadhāraṇadvayenādvitīyam ity anena ca sanmātrātirekisajātīyavijātīyāḥ sarve viśeṣā🔽niṣiddhā iti pratīyata iti cenn etad evam /🔽kāryakāraṇabhāvāvasthādvayāvasthitasyaikasya vastuna ekāvasthāvasthitasya jñānenāvasthāntarāvasthitasyāpi
analyzed: avadhāraṇa dvayena advitīyam iti anena ca sat mātra atireki sajātīya vijātīyāḥ sarve viśeṣāḥ  niṣiddhāḥ iti pratīyate iti ced etat evam  kārya kāraṇa bhāva avasthā dvaya avasthitasya ekasya vastunaḥ eka avasthā avasthitasya jñānena avasthā antara avasthitasya api
translated: and the word 'without a second' seem to imply the denial of all particulars, whether of the same or of a different class, in excess of mere Being, this is not so.

original: vastvaikyena jñātatāṃ dṛṣṭāntena darśayitvā śvetaketor aprajñātaṃ sarvasya brahmakāraṇatvaṃ🔽ca vaktuṃ sad eva somyedam ity ārabdham /
analyzed: vastu aikyena jñātatām dṛṣṭāntena darśayitvā śvetaketoḥ aprajñātam sarvasya brahma kāraṇatvam  ca vaktum sat eva somya idam iti ārabdham
translated: For, having shown by the example that the knowledge of the other state of the one existent which is in the two states of cause and effect is the same as the knowledge of the state in which it is present, he has shown Śvetaketu the non-cognized fact that all is Brahman, the cause,

original: idam agre sad evāsīd iti /
analyzed: idam agre sat eva āsīt iti
translated: and has begun with the words 'This, verily, O Somya, was Being in the beginning' in order to state it.🔽'This was Being in the beginning' means that this was Being in the beginning.

original: agra iti kālaviśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: agre iti kāla viśeṣaḥ
translated: 'In the beginning' is a particular time.

original: idaṃśabdavācyasya prapañcasya sadāpattirūpāṃ kriyāṃ sadravyatāṃ ca vadati /
analyzed: idam śabda vācyasya prapañcasya sat āpatti rūpām kriyām sadravyatām ca vadati
translated: It declares that the universe denoted by the word 'this' has the activity of always coming into existence and the nature of being a real substance.

original: ekam eveti cāsya nānānāmarūpavikāraprahāṇam /
analyzed: ekam eva iti ca asya nānā nāma rūpa vikāra prahāṇam
translated: And 'one only' indicates the abandonment of the various names, forms, and modifications.

original: etasmin pratipādite 'sya jagataḥ sadupādānatā pratipāditā bhavati /
analyzed: etasmin pratipādite sya jagataḥ sat upādāna tā pratipāditā bhavati
translated: When this is taught, the fact that this universe has a real cause is taught.

original: anyatropādānakāraṇasya svavyatiriktādhiṣṭhātrapekṣādarśane 'pi sarvavilakṣaṇatvād
analyzed: anyatra upādānakāraṇasya sva vyatirikta adhiṣṭhātṛ apekṣā darśane pi sarva vilakṣaṇa tvāt
translated: Even though elsewhere the cause of production is seen to require a controller other than itself, due to its being entirely different from everything else,

original: asya sarvajñasya brahmaṇaḥ sarvaśaktiyogo na viruddha ity advitīyapadam adhiṣṭhātrantaraṃ nivārayati /
