analyzed: asya sarvajñasya brahmaṇaḥ sarva śakti yogaḥ na viruddhaḥ iti advitīya padam adhiṣṭhātṛ antaram nivārayati
translated: the union of this omniscient Brahman with all powers is not contradictory. Thus the word 'without a second' excludes another controller.

original: sarvaśaktiyuktatvād eva brahmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: sarva śakti yukta tvāt eva brahmaṇaḥ
translated: It is precisely because Brahman is endowed with all powers

original: kāścana śrutayaḥ prathamam upādānakāraṇatvaṃ pratipādya nimittakāraṇam api tad eveti pratipādayanti /
analyzed: kāścana śrutayaḥ prathamam upādānakāraṇa tvam pratipādya nimitta kāraṇam api tat eva iti pratipādayanti
translated: that some scriptures, after first teaching that it is the material cause, go on to teach that it is also the instrumental cause.

original: yatheyaṃ śrutiḥ /
analyzed: yathā iyam śrutiḥ
translated: For example, this scripture:

original: anyāś ca śrutayo brahmaṇo nimittakāraṇatvam anujñāyāsyaivopādānatādi katham iti paricodya /
analyzed: anyāḥ ca śrutayaḥ brahmaṇaḥ nimitta kāraṇa tvam anujñāya asya eva upādāna tā ādi katham iti paricodya
translated: And other scriptures affirm that Brahman is the instrumental cause. How can it be the material cause and so on? This is the objection.

original: sarvaśaktiyuktatvād upādānakāraṇaṃ taditarāśeṣopakaraṇaṃ ca brahmaiveti pariharanti
analyzed: sarva śakti yukta tvāt upādānakāraṇam tad itara aśeṣa upakaraṇam ca brahmā eva iti pariharanti
translated: They reply that because it is endowed with all powers, Brahman is both the material cause and all the other instruments.

original: kiṃsvid vanaṃ ka u sa vṛkṣa āsīd yato dyāvāpṛthivī niṣṭakṣurmaṇīṣiṇo manasā pṛcchated🔽utdyad adhyatiṣṭhad bhuvanāni dhārayan /🔽brahma vanaṃ brahma sa vṛkṣa āsīd yato dyāvāpṛthivī niṣṭatakṣur manīṣiṇo manasā vibravīmi vaḥ brahmādhyatiṣṭhad bhuvanāni /
analyzed: kim svid vanam kaḥ u sa vṛkṣaḥ āsīt yatas dyāvāpṛthivī niṣṭakṣuḥ maṇīṣiṇaḥ manasā pṛcchata id  utdyat adhyatiṣṭhat bhuvanāni dhārayan  brahma vanam brahma sa vṛkṣaḥ āsīt yatas dyāvāpṛthivī niṣṭatakṣuḥ manīṣiṇaḥ manasā vibravīmi vaḥ brahma adhyatiṣṭhat bhuvanāni
translated: What was the wood, what was the tree, whence the wise, with thought, asked, 'From what did Heaven and Earth spring?'🔽Rising, he stood over the worlds, supporting them.🔽The wood was Brahman, the tree was Brahman, whence the wise, with thought, asked, 'From what did Heaven and Earth spring?' I declare to you with my mind, Brahman stood over the worlds.

original: dhārayann iti sāmānyato dṛṣṭena virodham āśaṅkya brahmaṇaḥ sarvavilakṣaṇatvena parihāra uktaḥ /🔽ataḥ sad eva somyedam agra āsīd ity atrāpy agra ityādyanekaviśeṣā brahmaṇo pratipāditāḥ /🔽bhavadabhimataviśeṣaniṣedhavācī ko 'pi śabdo na dṛśyate /🔽praty uta jagadbrahmaṇoḥ🔽kāryakāraṇabhāvajñāpanāyāgra iti kālaviśeṣasadbhāvaḥ /🔽āsīd iti kriyāviśeṣo /🔽jagadupādānatā jagannimittatā ca /
analyzed: dhārayan iti sāmānyatas dṛṣṭena virodham āśaṅkya brahmaṇaḥ sarva vilakṣaṇa tvena parihāraḥ uktaḥ 🔽atas sat eva somya idam agre āsīt iti atra api agre ityādi aneka viśeṣāḥ brahmaṇaḥ pratipāditāḥ 🔽bhavat abhimata viśeṣa niṣedha vācī śabdaḥ na dṛśyate 🔽prati uta jagat brahmaṇoḥ 🔽kārya kāraṇa bhāva jñāpanāya agre iti kāla viśeṣa sadbhāvaḥ 🔽āsīt iti kriyā viśeṣaḥ 🔽jagat upādāna tā jagat nimitta tā ca

original: nimittopādānayor bhedanirasanena tasyaiva brahmaṇaḥ sarvaśaktiyogaś cety aprajñātaḥ sahasraśo viśeṣā eva pratipāditāḥ /
analyzed: nimitta upādānayoḥ bheda nirasanena tasya eva brahmaṇaḥ sarva śakti yogaḥ ca iti aprajñātaḥ sahasraśas viśeṣāḥ eva pratipāditāḥ  /
translated: By the refutation of the difference of cause and effect, the non-cognition of Brahman as having all powers is shown to be a thousandfold error.

original: yato vāstavakāryakāraṇabhāvādivijñāne pravṛttam ata evāsad evedam agra āsīd ityārabhyāsatkāryavādaniṣedhaś ca kriyate kutas tu khalu somyaivaṃ 🔽syād iti /
analyzed: yatas vāstava kārya kāraṇa bhāva ādi vijñāne pravṛttam atas eva asat eva idam agre āsīt iti ārabhya asat kārya vāda niṣedhaḥ ca kriyate kutas tu khalu somya evam  syāt iti
translated: Since the doctrine of the non-existence of the effect is propounded in the beginning with the words This was non-existent in the beginning, the refutation of the doctrine of the non-existence of the effect is made with the words But how could this be so, O Śvetaketu?

original: prāgasata utpattir ahetuketyarthaḥ /
analyzed: prāk asataḥ utpattiḥ ahetukā iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the origination of the existent from the non-existent is causeless.

original: tad evopapādayati katham asataḥ saj jāyeteti /
analyzed: tat eva upapādayati katham asataḥ sat jāyeta iti
translated: He explains that very thing with How could the existent be born from the non-existent?

original: asata utpannam asadātmakam eva bhavatītyarthaḥ /
analyzed: asataḥ utpannam asat ātmakam eva bhavati iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that what is born from the non-existent has the nature of the non-existent itself.

original: yathā mṛd utpannaṃ ghaṭādikaṃ mṛdātmakam /
analyzed: yathā mṛd utpannam ghaṭa ādikam mṛd ātmakam
translated: For example, a pot, which is born from clay, has the nature of clay.

original: sata utpattir nāma vyavahāraviśeṣahetubhūto 'vasthāviśeṣayogaḥ /
analyzed: sataḥ utpattiḥ nāma vyavahāra viśeṣa hetu bhūtaḥ vasthā viśeṣa yogaḥ
translated: The origination of the existent is the possession of a particular state that is the cause of a particular usage.

original: etad uktaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: etat uktam bhavati
translated: This is what is said.

original: ekam eva kāraṇabhūtaṃ dravyam avasthāntarayogena kāryam ity ucyata ity ekavijñānena sarvavijñānaṃ pratipipādayiṣitam /
analyzed: ekam eva kāraṇa bhūtam dravyam avasthā antara yogena kāryam iti ucyate iti eka vijñānena sarva vijñānam pratipipādayiṣitam
translated: It is intended to show that by the knowledge of one thing, the knowledge of all is accomplished, by saying that the same substance which is the cause is called the effect by the connection with a different state.

original: tad asatkāryavāde na setsyati /
analyzed: tat asatkārya vāde na setsyati
translated: That will not be established in the doctrine of the non-existence of the effect.

original: tathā hi nimittasamavāyyasamavāyiprabhṛtiḥ kāraṇair avayavyākhyaṃ kāryaṃ dravyāntaram
analyzed: tathā hi nimitta samavāyi asamavāyi prabhṛtiḥ kāraṇaiḥ avayavi ākhyam kāryam dravya antaram
translated: For thus, the effect called the whole is produced as a different substance from the cause, by the causes such as the inherence in the cause, the non-inherence in the cause, etc.

original: evotpadyata iti kāraṇabhūtād vastunaḥ kāryasya vastvantaratvān na tajjñānenāsya jñātatā
analyzed: eva utpadyate iti kāraṇa bhūtāt vastunaḥ kāryasya vastu antara tvāt na tad jñānena asya jñāta tā
translated: Since the effect, which is a substance, is different from the cause, which is a substance, its cognition cannot in any way bring about the cognition of the effect.

original: katham api saṃbhavatīti /🔽katham avayavi dravyāntaraṃ nirasyata iti cet /🔽kāraṇagatāvasthāntarayogasya dravyāntarotpattivādinaḥ saṃpratipannasyaivaikatvanāmāntarāder
analyzed: katham api saṃbhavati iti  katham avayavi dravya antaram nirasyate iti ced  kāraṇa gata avasthā antara yogasya dravya antara utpatti vādinaḥ saṃpratipannasya eva eka tva nāma antara ādeḥ
translated: How is the whole, which is a different substance, refuted?

original: upapādakatvād dravyāntarādarśanāc ceti kāraṇam evāvasthāntarāpannaṃ kāryam ity ucyata ity uktam /
analyzed: upapādaka tvāt dravya antara adarśanāt ca iti kāraṇam eva avasthā antara āpannam kāryam iti ucyate iti uktam
translated: Because the cause, which is accepted by the one who advocates the production of a different substance as being connected with a different state, is the producer of the name of oneness, etc., and because a different substance is not seen, it is said that the cause itself, which has attained a different state, is called the effect.

original: nanu niradhiṣṭhānabhramāsaṃbhavajñāpanāyāsatkāryavādanirāsaḥ kriyate /
analyzed: nanu niradhiṣṭhāna bhrama asaṃbhava jñāpanāya asatkārya vāda nirāsaḥ kriyate
translated: But the denial of the doctrine of non-existent effects is done by showing that error is impossible without a basis.

original: tathā hy ekaṃ cidrūpaṃ satyam evāvidyāc chāditaṃ jagadrūpeṇa vivartata ity avidyāśrayatvāya mūlakāraṇaṃ satyam ity abhyupagantavyam ity asatkāryavādanirāsaḥ
analyzed: tathā hi ekam cit rūpam satyam eva avidyāt chāditam jagat rūpeṇa vivartate iti avidyā āśraya tvāya mūlakāraṇam satyam iti abhyupagantavyam iti asatkārya vāda nirāsaḥ
translated: For thus, the one true form of consciousness, which is obscured by ignorance, appears as the form of the world through evolution. Therefore, ignorance must be accepted as the true fundamental cause, which is the basis of ignorance. Thus, the doctrine of non-existent effects is denied.

original: naitad evam /
analyzed: na etat evam
translated: This is not so.

original: ekavijñānena sarvavijñānapratijñādṛṣṭāntamukhena satkāryavādasyaiva prasaktatvād ity uktam /
analyzed: eka vijñānena sarva vijñāna pratijñā dṛṣṭānta mukhena satkārya vādasya eva prasakta tvāt iti uktam
translated: Because the doctrine of the effect being existent is relevant, since the example of the proposition that all things are known by one knowledge is given.

original: bhavatpakṣe niradhiṣṭhānabhramāsaṃbhavasya durupapādatvāc ca /
analyzed: bhavat pakṣe niradhiṣṭhāna bhrama asaṃbhavasya durupapāda tvāt ca
translated: And because it is difficult to establish the impossibility of error without a basis in your view.

original: yasya hi cetanagatadoṣaḥ pāramārthiko doṣāśrayatvaṃ ca pāramārthikaṃ tasya pāramārthikadoṣeṇa yuktasyāpāramārthikagandharvanagarādidarśanam
analyzed: yasya hi cetana gata doṣaḥ pāramārthikaḥ doṣa āśraya tvam ca pāramārthikam tasya pāramārthika doṣeṇa yuktasya a pāramārthika gandharvanagara ādi darśanam
translated: For one whose fault lies in the conscious being, and whose basis of fault is ultimate, for him, who is endowed with an ultimate fault, the seeing of an ultimate gandharva city, etc.,

original: yasya tu doṣaś cāpāramārthiko doṣāśrayatvaṃ cāpāramārthikaṃ tasyāpāramārthikenāpy āśrayeṇa tad upapannam iti bhavatpakṣe na niradhiṣṭhānabhramāsaṃbhavaḥ
analyzed: yasya tu doṣaḥ ca apāramārthikaḥ doṣa āśraya tvam ca apāramārthikam tasya apāramārthikena api āśrayeṇa tat upapannam iti bhavat pakṣe na niradhiṣṭhāna bhrama asaṃbhavaḥ
translated: But for one whose fault is not ultimate, and whose basis of fault is not ultimate, for him, it is possible even with a non-ultimate basis. Thus, in your view, there is no impossibility of error without a basis.

original: śodhakeṣv api satyaṃ jñānam anantaṃ brahma /
analyzed: śodhakeṣu api satyam jñānam anantam brahma
translated: Even in the purifying [texts], truth, knowledge, and infinite Brahman.

original: ānando brahmetyādiṣu vākyeṣu sāmānyādhikaraṇyavyutpattisiddhānekaguṇaviśiṣṭaikārthāvabodhanam aviruddham iti sarvaguṇaviśiṣṭaṃ brahmābhidhīyata
analyzed: ānandaḥ brahma ityādiṣu vākyeṣu sāmānya adhikaraṇya vyutpatti siddha aneka guṇa viśiṣṭa eka artha avabodhanam aviruddham iti sarva guṇa viśiṣṭam brahma abhidhīyata
translated: In the sentences beginning with Bliss is Brahman, it is not contradictory to understand a single meaning qualified by many qualities established by the derivation of the general subject. Thus, Brahman, qualified by all qualities, is stated.

original: iti pūrvam evoktam /
analyzed: iti pūrvam eva uktam
translated: This has been stated before.

original: athāta ādeśo neti netīti bahudhā niṣedho dṛṣyata iti cet /
analyzed: atha atas ādeśaḥ na iti na iti iti bahudhā niṣedhaḥ dṛṣyate iti ced
translated: Now, if it be said that the prohibition, “Not so! Not so!” is seen in many places,

original: kim atra niṣidhyata iti vaktavyam /🔽dve vāva brahmaṇo rūpe mūrtaṃ caivāmūrtaṃ ceti mūrtāmūrtātmakaḥ prapañcaḥ sarvo 'pi niṣidhyata iti cen naivam /
analyzed: kim atra niṣidhyate iti vaktavyam  dve vāva brahmaṇaḥ rūpe mūrtam ca eva amūrtam ca iti mūrta amūrta ātmakaḥ prapañcaḥ niṣidhyate iti ced na evam
translated: it must be said what is prohibited here.🔽If it be said that the entire universe consisting of the embodied and the unembodied is prohibited, since it is said, “Verily, Brahman has two forms, the embodied and the unembodied,” it is not so.

original: brahmaṇo rūpatayāprajñātaṃ sarvaṃ rūpatayopadiśya punar tad eva niṣeddhum ayuktam /
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ rūpa tayā a prajñātam sarvam rūpa tayā upadiśya punar tat eva niṣeddhum ayuktam
translated: It is not proper to prohibit again what has been taught as a form of Brahman, which is not known as Brahman.

original: prakṣālanād dhi paṅkasya dūrād asparśanaṃ varam iti nyāyāt /
analyzed: prakṣālanāt hi paṅkasya dūrāt asparśanam varam iti nyāyāt
translated: For, by the principle that “It is better to keep away from mud from a distance, than to wash it off,”

original: kas tarhi niṣedhavākyārthaḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ tarhi niṣedha vākya arthaḥ
translated: then what is the meaning of the sentence of prohibition?

original: sūtrakāraḥ svayam eva vadati prakṛtaitāvattvaṃ hi pratiṣedhati tato bravīti ca bhūya iti /
analyzed: sūtrakāraḥ svayam eva vadati prakṛta etāvat tvam hi pratiṣedhati tatas bravīti ca bhūyas iti
translated: The author of the aphorisms himself says, “It denies the limitedness of Brahman, which is the subject-matter, and then speaks further.”

original: uttaratra atha nāmadheyaṃ saty asya satyaṃ prāṇā vai satyaṃ teṣām eṣa satyam iti satyādiguṇagaṇasya pratipāditatvāt pūrvaprakṛtaitāvanmātraṃ
analyzed: uttaratra atha nāmadheyam satī asya satyam prāṇāḥ vai satyam teṣām eṣa satyam iti satya ādi guṇa gaṇasya pratipādita tvāt pūrva prakṛta etāvat mātram
translated: Since the group of qualities beginning with truth, such as “Truth, verily, is the vital breaths; of them, this is the truth,” is taught later, the limitedness of Brahman, which is the subject-matter,

original: na bhavati brahmeti /
analyzed: na bhavati brahma iti
translated: is not so.

original: brahmaṇa etāvanmātratā pratiṣidhyata iti sūtrārthaḥ /
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ etāvat mātra tā pratiṣidhyate iti sūtra arthaḥ
translated: The meaning of the aphorism is that the limitedness of Brahman is denied.

original: neha nānāsti kiṃcanetyādinā nānātvapratiṣedha eva dṛṣyata iti cet /
analyzed: na iha nānā asti kiṃcana ityādinā nānātva pratiṣedhaḥ eva dṛṣyate iti ced
translated: If it be said that the negation of difference is seen in such passages as, “There is no diversity here of any kind,”

original: atrāpy uttaratra sarvasya vaśī sarvasyeśana iti satyasaṅkalpatvasarveśvaratvapratipādanāc
analyzed: atra api uttaratra sarvasya vaśī sarvasya īśanaḥ iti satya saṅkalpa tva sarva īśvara tva pratipādanāt
translated: we reply: Here also, in the subsequent passage, “He is the controller of all, the lord of all,” the teaching of the nature of being the fulfiller of desires and of being the lord of all

original: cetanavastuśarīra īśvara iti sarvaprakārasaṃsthitaḥ sa eka eveti tatpratyanīkābrahmātmakanānātvaṃ
analyzed: cetana vastu śarīre īśvaraḥ iti sarva prakāra saṃsthitaḥ saḥ ekaḥ eva iti tad pratyanīka a brahma ātmaka nānātvam
translated: shows that God has a body consisting of conscious entities. Thus, He is established in all ways as one only. Therefore, the difference consisting of Brahman and the self, which is contrary to Him,

original: pratiṣiddhaṃ na bhavadabhimatam /
analyzed: pratiṣiddham na bhavat abhimatam
translated: is not negated, as you maintain.

original: sarvāsv evaṃprakārāsu śrutiṣv iyam eva sthitir iti na kvacid api brahmaṇaḥ saviśeṣatvaniṣedhakavācī ko 'pi śabdo dṛśyate /
analyzed: sarvāsu evaṃprakārāsu śrutiṣu iyam eva sthitiḥ iti na kvacid api brahmaṇaḥ sa viśeṣa tva niṣedhaka vācī śabdaḥ dṛśyate  /
translated: In all such passages of the Veda, this is the only conclusion. Therefore, in no place is any word found that negates the qualified nature of Brahman.

original: api ca nirviśeṣajñānamātraṃ brahma tac cāchādikāvidyātirohitasvarūpaṃ svagatanānātvaṃ paśyatīty ayam artho na ghaṭate /
analyzed: api ca nirviśeṣa jñāna mātram brahma tat ca āchādika avidyā tirohita svarūpam svagata nānātvam paśyati iti ayam arthaḥ na ghaṭate
translated: Moreover, this meaning does not hold: Brahman is mere consciousness without any distinctions, and that, seeing its own nature concealed by the superimposed ignorance, sees difference within itself.

original: tirodhānaṃ nāma prakāśanivāraṇam /
analyzed: tirodhānam nāma prakāśa nivāraṇam
translated: Concealment means the prevention of manifestation.

original: svarūpātirekiprakāśadharmānabhyupagamena prakāśasyaiva svarūpatvāt svarūpanāśa eva syāt /
analyzed: svarūpa atireki prakāśa dharma an abhyupagamena prakāśasya eva svarūpa tvāt svarūpa nāśaḥ eva syāt
translated: Since manifestation is itself the nature, because it is not accepted as having the attribute of manifestation that is different from its own nature, there would be the destruction of its own nature.

original: prakāśaparyāyaṃ jñānaṃ nityaṃ sa ca prakāśo 'vidyātirohita iti bāliśabhāṣitam idam /
analyzed: prakāśa paryāyam jñānam nityam sa ca prakāśaḥ vidyā tirohitaḥ iti bāliśa bhāṣitam idam
translated: The statement that knowledge, which is the manifestation, is eternal, and that it is concealed by ignorance, is foolish talk.

original: avidyayā prakāśatirohita iti prakāśotpattipratibandho vidyamānasya vināśo vā /
analyzed: avidyayā prakāśa tirohitaḥ iti prakāśa utpatti pratibandhaḥ vidyamānasya vināśaḥ vā
translated: If it is said that the manifestation is concealed by ignorance, then either the arising of the manifestation is obstructed, or the existing [manifestation] is destroyed.

original: prakāśasyānutpādyatvād vināśa eva syāt /
analyzed: prakāśasya an utpādya tvāt vināśaḥ eva syāt
translated: Since the manifestation is not produced, it would be only destroyed.

original: prakāśo nityo nirvikāras tiṣṭhatīti cet /
analyzed: prakāśaḥ nityaḥ nirvikāraḥ tiṣṭhati iti ced
translated: If it is said that the eternal manifestation remains unchanged,

original: satyām apy avidyāyāṃ brahmaṇi na kiṃcit tirohitam iti nānātvaṃ paśyatīti bhavatām ayaṃ vyavahāraḥ satsv anirvacanīya eva /
analyzed: satyām api avidyāyām brahmaṇi na kiṃcid tirohitam iti nānātvam paśyati iti bhavatām ayam vyavahāraḥ satsu anirvacanīyaḥ eva
translated: then even in the presence of ignorance, nothing is concealed in Brahman, and this usage of yours, that one sees diversity, would be truly indescribable.

original: nanu ca bhavato 'pi vijñānasvarūpa ātmābhyupagantavyaḥ /
analyzed: nanu ca bhavataḥ pi vijñāna svarūpaḥ ātmā abhyupagantavyaḥ
translated: But even for you, the self must be accepted as the form of consciousness.

original: sa ca svayaṃprakāśaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca svayaṃprakāśaḥ
translated: And that is self-luminous.

original: tasya ca devādisvarūpātmābhimāne svarūpaprakāśatirodhānam avaśyam āśrayaṇīyam /
analyzed: tasya ca deva ādi sva rūpa ātma abhimāne sva rūpa prakāśa tirodhānam avaśyam āśrayaṇīyam
translated: And in the conceit of the self in the form of a god, etc., the manifestation of one's own nature must necessarily be concealed.

original: svarūpaprakāśe sati svātmany ākārāntarādhyāsāyogāt /
analyzed: svarūpa prakāśe sati svātmani ākāra antara adhyāsa ayogāt
translated: Because when there is the manifestation of one's own nature, it is impossible to superimpose another form on one's own self.

original: ato bhavataś cāyaṃ samāno doṣaḥ /
analyzed: atas bhavataḥ ca ayam samānaḥ doṣaḥ
translated: Therefore, this fault is the same for you.

original: kiṃ cāsmākam ekasminn evātmani bhavadudīritaṃ durghaṭatvam bhavatām ātmānantyābhyupagamāt sarveṣv ayaṃ doṣaḥ pariharaṇīyaḥ /
analyzed: kim ca asmākam ekasmin eva ātmani bhavat udīritam durghaṭa tvam bhavatām ātma ānantya abhyupagamāt sarveṣu ayam doṣaḥ pariharaṇīyaḥ  /
translated: Moreover, this difficulty that you have pointed out in regard to one soul is to be met in every soul, since you admit of the plurality of souls.

original: atrocyate svabhāvato malapratyanīkānantajñānānandaikasvarūpaṃ svābhāvikānavadhikātiśayāparimitodāraguṇasāgaraṃ🔽nimeṣakāṣṭhākalāmuhūrtādiparārdhaparyantāparimitavyavacchedasvarūpasarvotpattisthitivināśādisarvapariṇāmanimittabhūtakālakṛtapariṇāmāspaṣṭānantamahāvibhūti
analyzed: atrā ucyate svabhāvataḥ mala pratyanīka ananta jñāna ānanda eka svarūpam svābhāvika anavadhika atiśaya aparimita udāra guṇa sāgaram
translated: To this we reply: The Supreme Brahman alone is to be known, which is by nature the sole essence of infinite knowledge and bliss, the counteractive of all impurity, which is the ocean of natural, unlimited, infinite, and vast excellences,🔽which is the cause of all creation, sustentation, destruction, and all other modifications, which is the source of all divisions of time, from a twinkling of the eye, a kṣaṇa, a nāḍikā, a muhūrta, a yāma, a day and night, a pakṣa, a month, a ṛtu, a ṣaṣṭha, a saṃvatsara, a parārdha, and so on, up to the final dissolution of the world, which is the cause of the indistinctness of all modifications produced by time, which is of infinite and great glory,

original: svalīlāparikarasvāṃśabhūtānantabaddhamuktanānāvidhacetanatadbhogyabhūtānantavicitrapariṇāmaśakticetanetaravastujātāntaryāmitvakṛtasarvaśaktiśarīratvasarvaprakarśāvasthānāvasthitaṃ🔽paraṃ brahmaiva vedyaṃ /
analyzed: 🔽param brahma eva vedyam
translated: which is the inner controller of all things, animate and inanimate, which are produced by its own will, which are its own parts, which are infinite, which are bound and liberated, which are of various kinds, which are possessed of the power of infinite and various modifications, which are either intelligent or non-intelligent, which is therefore the body of all powers, which is the abode of all manifestation, and which is ever existent in all conditions.

original: tatsākṣātkārakṣamabhagavaddvaipāyanaparāśaravālmīkimanuyājñavalkyagautamāpastambaprabhṛtimunigaṇapraṇītavidhyarthavādamantrasvarūpavedamūletihāsapurāṇadharmaśāstropabhṛṃhitaparamārthabhūtānādinidhanāvicchinnapāṭhasaṃpradāyargyajuḥsāmātharvarūpānantaśākhaṃ
analyzed: tad sākṣātkāra kṣama bhagavat dvaipāyana parāśara vālmīki manu yājñavalkya gautama āpastamba prabhṛti muni gaṇa praṇīta vidhi arthavāda mantra svarūpa veda mūla itihāsa purāṇa dharma śāstra upabhṛṃhita parama artha bhūta anādi nidhana avicchinna pāṭha saṃpradāya ṛc yajus sāma atharva rūpa ananta śākham
translated: The Vedas, which are the root of the injunctions, explanatory passages, and mantras composed by the sages such as Vyasa, Parashara, Valmiki, Manu, Yajnavalkya, Gautama, and Apastamba, who are capable of directly perceiving the Lord, and which are enriched by the Itihasa, Purana, and Dharma Shastras that contain the ultimate truth, are eternal, beginningless, and uninterrupted in their recitation and tradition. They consist of the infinite branches in the form of the Rig, Yajur, Sama, and Atharva Vedas.

original: vedaṃ cābhyupagacchatām asmākaṃ kiṃ na setsyati /
analyzed: vedam ca abhyupagacchatām asmākam kim na setsyati
translated: For us who accept the Veda, which has as its root the Vedas in the form of injunctions, explanatory passages, and mantras composed by the groups of sages such as Vyasa, Parashara, Valmiki, Manu, Yajnavalkya, Gautama, and Apastamba, and which is enriched by the Itihasa, Puranas, and Dharma Shastras that contain the ultimate truth, which is beginningless and endless, and which has an unbroken tradition of recitation, and which has an infinite number of branches in the form of the Rig, Yajur, Sama, and Atharva Vedas, what will not be accomplished?

original: yathoktaṃ bhagavatā dvaipāyanena mahābhārate
analyzed: yathā uktam bhagavatā dvaipāyanena mahābhārate
translated: As stated by the Blessed Vyasa in the Mahabharata:

original: yo mām ajam anādiṃ ca vetti lokamaheśvaram /
analyzed: yaḥ mām ajam anādim ca vetti loka mahā īśvaram
translated: He who knows Me as unborn, without beginning, and the great Lord of the world,

original: dvāv imau puraṣau loke kṣaraś cākṣara eva ca /
analyzed: dvau imau pura ṣau loke kṣaraḥ ca akṣaraḥ eva ca
translated: There are two persons in the world, the perishable and the imperishable.

original: kṣaraḥ sarvāṇi bhūtāni kūṭastho 'kṣara ucyate //
analyzed: kṣaraḥ sarvāṇi bhūtāni kūṭasthaḥ kṣaraḥ ucyate
translated: The perishable is all beings, the immutable is said to be the Supreme.

original: uttamaḥ puruṣas tv anyaḥ paramātmety udāhṛtaḥ /
analyzed: uttamaḥ puruṣaḥ tu anyaḥ paramātmā iti udāhṛtaḥ
translated: But there is another, higher person, called the Supreme Self,

original: yo lokatrayam āviśya vibhartyavyaya īśvaraḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ lokatrayam āviśya vibharti avyayaḥ īśvaraḥ
translated: Who, having entered the three worlds, sustains them as the imperishable Lord.

original: kālaṃ ca pacate tatra na kālas tatra vai prabhūḥ /
analyzed: kālam ca pacate tatra na kālaḥ tatra vai prabhūḥ
translated: And time is cooked there, time is not the master there.

original: ete vai nirayās tāta sthānasya paramātmanaḥ //
analyzed: ete vai nirayāḥ tāta sthānasya paramātmanaḥ
translated: These, O son, are the hells of the Supreme Self.

original: avyaktādiviśeṣāntaṃ pariṇāmarddhisaṃyuktam /
analyzed: avyakta ādi viśeṣa antam pariṇāma ṛddhi saṃyuktam
translated: From the unmanifest to the specific, endowed with evolution and prosperity,

original: krīḍā harer idaṃ sarvaṃ kṣaram ity avadhāryatām //
analyzed: krīḍā hareḥ idam sarvam kṣaram iti avadhāryatām
translated: all this is the play of Hari. Know that it is perishable.

original: kṛṣṇa eva hi lokānām utpattir api cāpyayaḥ /
analyzed: kṛṣṇaḥ eva hi lokānām utpattiḥ api ca apyayaḥ
translated: Kṛṣṇa alone is the origin and dissolution of the worlds.

original: kṛṣṇasya hi kṛte bhūtam idaṃ viśvaṃ carācaram //
analyzed: kṛṣṇasya hi kṛte bhūtam idam viśvam carācaram
translated: This entire universe of the moving and unmoving has been created for Kṛṣṇa.

original: iti / kṛṣṇasya hi kṛta iti kṛṣṇasya śeṣabhūtaṃ sarvam ityarthaḥ /
analyzed: iti kṛṣṇasya hi kṛte iti kṛṣṇasya śeṣa bhūtam sarvam iti arthaḥ
translated: Thus, for Kṛṣṇa's sake means that everything is subordinate to Kṛṣṇa.

original: bhagavatā parāśareṇāpy uktam
analyzed: bhagavatā parāśareṇa api uktam
translated: It has also been said by the sage Parāśara:

original: śuddhe mahāvibhūtyākhye pare brahmaṇi śabdyate /
analyzed: śuddhe mahāvibhūti ākhye pare brahmaṇi śabdyate
translated: In the pure supreme Brahman called Mahāvibhu,

original: maitreya bhagavacchabdaḥ sarvakāraṇakāraṇe //
analyzed: maitreya bhagavat śabdaḥ sarva kāraṇa kāraṇe
translated: the word Bhagavān is used, O Maitreya, in the cause of all causes.

original: jñānaśaktibalāiśvaryavīryatejāṃsy aśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: jñāna śakti bala aiśvarya vīrya tejāṃsi aśeṣatas
translated: Knowledge, power, strength, lordship, valor, and radiance, in their entirety,

original: bhagavacchabdavācyāni vinā heyair guṇādibhiḥ //
analyzed: bhagavat śabda vācyāni vinā heyaiḥ guṇa ādibhiḥ
translated: are denoted by the word Bhagavān, devoid of the faults of qualities and so on.

original: evam eṣa mahāśabdo maitreya bhagavān iti /
analyzed: evam eṣa mahā śabdaḥ maitreya bhagavān iti
translated: Thus, O Maitreya, this great word Bhagavān

original: paramabrahmabhūtasya vāsudevasya nānyagaḥ //
analyzed: parama brahma bhūtasya vāsudevasya na anya gaḥ
translated: is not used for anyone else but Vāsudeva, who is the supreme Brahman.

original: tatra pūjyapadārthoktiparibhāṣāsamanvitaḥ /
analyzed: tatra pūjya padārtha ukti paribhāṣā samanvitaḥ
translated: There, the word Bhagavān, along with the definition stating the meaning of the word pūjya (worthy of worship),

original: śabdo 'yaṃ nopacāreṇa tv anyatra hy upacārataḥ //
analyzed: śabdaḥ yam na upacāreṇa tu anyatra hi upacārataḥ
translated: is not used figuratively, for elsewhere it is used figuratively.

original: evaṃprakāram amalaṃ satyaṃ vyāpakam akṣayam /
analyzed: evaṃprakāram amalam satyam vyāpakam akṣayam
translated: Thus, this kind is pure, true, all-pervading, and imperishable,

original: samastaheyarahitaṃ viṣṇvākhyaṃ paramaṃ padam //
analyzed: samasta heya rahitam viṣṇu ākhyam paramam padam
translated: The supreme state called Viṣṇu, devoid of all that is to be abandoned.

original: kalāmuhūrtādimayaś ca kālo na yadvibhūteḥ pariṇāmahetuḥ //
analyzed: kalā muhūrta ādi mayaḥ ca kālaḥ na yad vibhūteḥ pariṇāma hetuḥ
translated: And time consisting of kalās, muhūrtas, etc. is not the cause of transformation of His glory.

original: krīḍato bālakasyeva ceṣṭās tasya niśāmaya //
analyzed: krīḍataḥ bālakasya iva ceṣṭāḥ tasya niśāmaya
translated: Contemplate the activities of Him who is sporting like a child.

original: ityādi / manunāpi
analyzed: ityādi manunā api
translated: Thus, etc. Manu also says:

original: praśāsitāraṃ sarveṣām aṇīyāṃsam aṇīyasām /
analyzed: praśāsitāram sarveṣām aṇīyāṃsam aṇīyasām
translated: The controller of all, smaller than the smallest,

original: ityuktam / yājñavalkyenāpi
analyzed: iti uktam yājñavalkyena api
translated: Thus it is said. Yājñavalkya also says:

original: kṣetrasyeśvarajñānād viśuddhiḥ paramā matā /
analyzed: kṣetrasya īśvara jñānāt viśuddhiḥ paramā matā
translated: Purification is considered supreme through the knowledge of the Lord of the field.

original: iti / āpastambenāpi pūḥ prāṇinaḥ sarva eva guhāśayasyeti /
analyzed: iti āpastambena api pūḥ prāṇinaḥ sarve eva guhā āśayasya iti
translated: Thus. Āpastamba also says: The entire universe of beings is the abode of the one who dwells in the cave.

original: sarve prāṇino guhāśayas paramātmanaḥ pūḥ puraṃ śarīram ityarthaḥ /
analyzed: sarve prāṇinaḥ guhā āśayaḥ paramātmanaḥ pūḥ puram śarīram iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that all beings are the city, the body, of the supreme self, the one who dwells in the cave.

original: prāṇina iti sajīvātmabhūtasaṃghātaḥ /
analyzed: prāṇinaḥ iti sa jīva ātma bhūta saṃghātaḥ
translated: Beings means a collection of living souls and elements.

original: nanu ca kim anenāḍambareṇa /
analyzed: nanu ca kim anena āḍambareṇa
translated: But what is the use of this spectacle?

original: codyaṃ tu na parihṛtam /
analyzed: codyam tu na parihṛtam
translated: But the objection is not removed.

original: ucyate /
analyzed: ucyate
translated: It is said:

original: evam abhyupagacchatām asmākam ātmadharmabhūtasya caitanyasya svābhāvikasyāpi karmaṇā pāramārthikaṃ saṃkocaṃ vikāsaṃ ca bruvatāṃ sarvam idaṃ
analyzed: evam abhyupagacchatām asmākam ātma dharma bhūtasya caitanyasya svābhāvikasya api karmaṇā pāramārthikam saṃkocam vikāsam ca bruvatām sarvam idam
translated: For those who accept this, for us who say that consciousness, which is a property of the self, though natural, has real contraction and expansion through action, all this

original: parihṛtam /
analyzed: parihṛtam
translated: is removed.

original: bhavas tu prakāśa eva svarūpam iti prakāśo na dharmabhūtas tasya saṃkocavikāsau vā nābyupagamyete /
analyzed: bhavaḥ tu prakāśaḥ eva svarūpam iti prakāśaḥ na dharma bhūtaḥ tasya saṃkoca vikāsau vā na abyupagamyete
translated: But existence is only light, its own nature. So light is not a property of it, nor is its contraction or expansion accepted.

original: prakāśaprasārānutpattim eva tirodhānabhūtāḥ karmādayaḥ kurvanti /
analyzed: prakāśa prasāra anutpattim eva tirodhāna bhūtāḥ karma ādayaḥ kurvanti
translated: Karmas and others, which are obscuring, make the non-origination of the expansion of light.

original: avidyā cet tirodhānaṃ tirodhānabhūtatayāvidyayā svarūpabhūtaprakāśanāśa iti pūrvam evoktam /
analyzed: avidyā ced tirodhānam tirodhāna bhūta tayā avidyayā sva rūpa bhūta prakāśa nāśaḥ iti pūrvam eva uktam
translated: If ignorance is the obscuration, then by the obscuring ignorance, the destruction of the light which is the nature is said to be earlier.

original: asmākaṃ tv avidyārūpeṇa karmaṇā svarūpanityadharmabhūtaprakāśaḥ saṃkucitaḥ /
analyzed: asmākam tu avidyā rūpeṇa karmaṇā sva rūpa nitya dharma bhūta prakāśaḥ saṃkucitaḥ
translated: But for us, by karma in the form of ignorance, the light which is the eternal property of the nature is contracted.

original: tena devādisvarūpātmābhimāno bhavatīti viśeṣaḥ / yathoktam
analyzed: tena deva ādi sva rūpa ātma abhimānaḥ bhavati iti viśeṣaḥ yathā uktam
translated: Therefore, the conception of the self as having the form of a god and so on occurs. This is the difference. As it is said:

original: avidyā karmasaṃjñānyā tṛtīyā śaktir iṣyate //
analyzed: avidyā karma saṃjñā anyā tṛtīyā śaktiḥ iṣyate
translated: The third power is accepted as called ignorance and karma.

original: yathā kṣetraśaktiḥ sā veṣṭitā nṛpa sarvagā /
analyzed: yathā kṣetra śaktiḥ sā veṣṭitā nṛpa sarvagā
translated: O king, that power is enveloped like the power of the field, and is all-pervading.

original: saṃsāratāpān akhilān avāpnoty atisaṃtatān //
analyzed: saṃsāra tāpān akhilān avāpnoti ati saṃtatān
translated: One attains all the extremely intense sufferings of worldly existence.

original: tayā tirohitatvāc ca śaktiḥ kṣetrajñasaṃjñitā /
analyzed: tayā tirohita tvāt ca śaktiḥ kṣetrajña saṃjñitā
translated: And because of being obscured by that, the power called the individual soul

original: sarvabhūteṣu bhūpāle tāratamyena vartate //
analyzed: sarva bhūteṣu bhūpāle tāratamyena vartate
translated: exists in all beings, O king, in a graded manner.

original: iti / kṣetrajñānāṃ svadharmabhūtasya jñānasya karmasaṃjñāvidyayā saṃkocaṃ vikāsaṃ ca darśayati /
analyzed: iti kṣetrajñānām svadharma bhūtasya jñānasya karma saṃjñā avidyayā saṃkocam vikāsam ca darśayati
translated: Thus, it shows the contraction and expansion of the knowledge which is the self-nature of the knowers of the field, by the ignorance called action.

original: api cācchādikāvidyā śrutibhiś cāikyopadeśabalāc ca brahmasvarūpatirodhānaheyadoṣarūpāśrīyate tasyāś ca mithyārūpatvena prapañcavatsvadarśanamūladoṣāpekṣatvāt
analyzed: api ca ācchādikā avidyā śrutibhiḥ ca aikya upadeśa balāt ca brahma svarūpa tirodhāna heya doṣa rūpā āśrīyate tasyāḥ ca mithyā rūpa tvena prapañca vat sva darśana mūla doṣa apekṣa tvāt
translated: Moreover, the covering ignorance is accepted as the fault in the form of the obscuration of the nature of Brahman, by the Upaniṣads, by the teaching of non-duality, and by the power of the teaching. And that, being false, like the world, depends on the fault at its root, which is the wrong view of itself.

original: na sā mithyā darśanamūladoṣaḥ syād iti brahmaiva mithyādarśanamūlaṃ syāt /
analyzed: na sā mithyā darśana mūla doṣaḥ syāt iti brahma eva mithyā darśana mūlam syāt
translated: That wrong view of itself would not be the fault at the root of the false view. Therefore, Brahman itself would be the false view at the root.

original: tasyāś cānāditve 'pi mithyārūpatvād eva brahmadṛśyatvenaivānāditvāt taddarśanamūlaparamārthadoṣānabhyupagamāc ca brahmaiva taddarśanamūlaṃ
analyzed: tasyāḥ ca anādi tve pi mithyā rūpa tvāt eva brahma dṛśya tvena eva anādi tvāt tad darśana mūla paramārtha doṣa anabhyupagamāt ca brahma eva tad darśana mūlam
translated: And that, even though beginningless, is seen by Brahman itself, because it is false, and because it is beginningless only along with the view of Brahman. And because it is not accepted that the ultimate fault at the root of the view of that is Brahman itself, Brahman is the fault at the root of the view of that.

original: tasya nityatvād anirmokṣa eva /
analyzed: tasya nitya tvāt anirmokṣaḥ eva
translated: And because that is eternal, there is no liberation.

original: ata evedam api nirastam ekam eva śarīraṃ jīvavat /
analyzed: atas eva idam api nirastam ekam eva śarīram jīva vat
translated: For this very reason, this is also refuted: The one body is like the living being.

original: nirjīvānītarāṇi śarīrāṇi svapnadṛṣṭanānāvidhānantaśarīrāṇāṃ yathā nirjīvatvam /
analyzed: nirjīvāni itarāṇi śarīrāṇi svapna dṛṣṭa nānāvidha ananta śarīrāṇām yathā nirjīva tvam
translated: The other bodies are without living beings, like the infinite various bodies seen in a dream.

original: tatra svapne draṣṭuḥ śarīram ekam eva jīvavat /
analyzed: tatra svapne draṣṭuḥ śarīram ekam eva jīvavat
translated: There, in a dream, the body of the seer is one only, like the living being.

original: tasya svapnavelāyāṃ dṛśyabhūtanānāvidhaśarīrāṇāṃ nirjīvatvam eva /
analyzed: tasya svapna velāyām dṛśya bhūta nānāvidha śarīrāṇām nirjīva tvam eva
translated: In his dream state, the various kinds of bodies that appear are devoid of life.🔽By this alone, because they are imagined, the living beings are false. Thus,

original: anenaikenaiva parikalpitatvāj jīvā mithyābhūtā iti brahmaṇā svasvarūpavyatiriktasya
analyzed: anena ekena eva parikalpita tvāt jīvāḥ mithyā bhūtāḥ iti brahmaṇā sva svarūpa vyatiriktasya
translated: because the state of being a living being and all bodies are imagined, apart from the nature of Brahman itself,

original: jīvabhāvasya sarvaśarīrāṇāṃ ca kalpitatvād ekasminn api śarīre śarīravaj jīvabhāvasya🔽ca mithyārūpatvāt sarvāṇi śarīrāṇi mithyārūpāṇi /
analyzed: jīva bhāvasya sarva śarīrāṇām ca kalpita tvāt ekasmin api śarīre śarīra vat jīva bhāvasya  ca mithyā rūpa tvāt sarvāṇi śarīrāṇi mithyā rūpāṇi
translated: and because the state of being a living being, like the body, is false in even one body, all bodies are false.

original: tatra jīvabhāvaś ca mithyārūpa ity ekasya śarīrasya tatra jīvabhāvasya ca na kaścid viśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: tatra jīva bhāvaḥ ca mithyārūpaḥ iti ekasya śarīrasya tatra jīva bhāvasya ca na kaścid viśeṣaḥ
translated: There, the state of being a living being is also false. So there is no difference between that and the state of being a living being in one's own body.

original: asmākaṃ tu svapne draṣṭuḥ svaśarīrasya tasminn ātmasadbhāvasya ca prabodhavelāyām
analyzed: asmākam tu svapne draṣṭuḥ sva śarīrasya tasmin ātma sadbhāvasya ca prabodha velāyām
translated: But for us, at the time of waking, the seer's own body and the existence of the self in it

original: abādhitatvān anyeṣāṃ śarīrāṇāṃ tadgatajīvānāṃ ca bādhitatvāt te sarve mithyābhūtāḥ
analyzed: a bādhita tvāt anyeṣām śarīrāṇām tad gata jīvānām ca bādhita tvāt te sarve mithyā bhūtāḥ
translated: are unobstructed, while the other bodies and the living beings in them are obstructed. Therefore, they are all false.

original: svaśarīram ekaṃ tasmiñ jīvabhāvaś ca paramārtha iti viśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: sva śarīram ekam tasmin jīva bhāvaḥ ca paramārthaḥ iti viśeṣaḥ
translated: Our own body is one, and the state of being a living being in it is real. This is the difference.

original: api ca kena vā vidyānivṛttiḥ sā kīdṛśīti vivecanīyam /
analyzed: api ca kena vā vidyā nivṛttiḥ sā kīdṛśī iti vivecanīyam
translated: Moreover, by whom is the cessation of ignorance? What is that like? This should be analyzed.

original: aikyajñānaṃ nivartakaṃ nivṛttiś cānirvacanīyapratyanīkākāreti cet /
analyzed: aikya jñānam nivartakam nivṛttiḥ ca anirvacanīya pratyanīka ākārā iti ced
translated: If it be said that the knowledge of identity is the remover, and the cessation is of the form of the opposite of the inexpressible,

original: anirvacanīyapratyanīkaṃ nirvacanīyaṃ tac ca sad vāsad vā dvirūpaṃ vā koṭyantaraṃ na vidyate /
analyzed: anirvacanīya pratyanīkam nirvacanīyam tat ca sat vā asat vā dvirūpam vā koṭi antaram na vidyate
translated: then the opposite of the inexpressible is expressible, and that is either existent or non-existent or of dual nature, there is no other alternative.

original: brahmavyatirekeṇaitadabhyupagame punar avidyā na nivṛttā syāt /
analyzed: brahma vyatirekeṇa etat abhyupagame punar avidyā na nivṛttā syāt
translated: If this is accepted as being different from Brahman, then ignorance would not cease.

original: brahmaiva cen nivṛttis tatprāg apy aviśiṣṭam iti vedāntajñānāt pūrvam eva nivṛttiḥ syāt /
analyzed: brahmā eva ced nivṛttiḥ tad prāk api aviśiṣṭam iti vedānta jñānāt pūrvam eva nivṛttiḥ syāt
translated: If it is Brahman itself that ceases, then it is the same before also. So cessation would be even before the knowledge of the Vedanta.

original: aikyajñānaṃ nivartakaṃ tadabhāvāt saṃsāra iti bhavaddarśanaṃ vihanyate /
analyzed: aikya jñānam nivartakam tad abhāvāt saṃsāraḥ iti bhavat darśanam vihanyate
translated: And the doctrine that the knowledge of identity is the remover, and the world is due to the absence of that, is contradicted.

original: kiñ ca nivartakajñānasyāpy avidyārūparvāt tannivartanaṃ keneti vaktavyam /
analyzed: kim ca nivartaka jñānasya api avidyā rūpa rvāt tad nivartanam kena iti vaktavyam
translated: Moreover, since the knowledge that is the remover is also of the nature of ignorance, it must be said by what that is removed.

original: nivartakajñānaṃ svetarasamastabhedaṃ nivartya kṣaṇikatvād eva svayam eva vinaśyati dāvānalaviṣanāśanaviṣāntaravad iti cen na /
analyzed: nivartaka jñānam sva itara samasta bhedam nivartya kṣaṇika tvāt eva svayam eva vinaśyati dāva anala viṣa nāśana viṣa antara vat iti ced na
translated: If it be said that the knowledge that is the remover, having removed all the differences other than itself, perishes by itself alone due to momentariness, like the poison that destroys the poison of a forest fire, no (it is not so).

original: nivartakajñānasya brahmavyatiriktatvena tatsvarūpatadutpattivināśānāṃ mithyārūpatvāt tadvināśarūpā vidyā tiṣṭhaty eveti tadvināśadarśanasya
analyzed: nivartaka jñānasya brahma vyatirikta tvena tad svarūpa tad utpatti vināśānām mithyā rūpa tvāt tad vināśa rūpā vidyā tiṣṭhati eva iti tad vināśa darśanasya
translated: Because the knowledge which is the cause of cessation is different from Brahman, its nature, origin, and destruction are false, so the knowledge which is the destruction of that remains. Therefore, the view of its destruction

original: nivartakaṃ vaktacyam eva /
analyzed: nivartakam vaktacyam eva
translated: must be stated to be the cause of cessation.

original: dāvāgnyādīnām api pūrvāvasthāvirodhipariṇāmaparaṃparāvarjanīyaiva /
analyzed: dāva agni ādīnām api pūrva avasthā virodhi pariṇāma paraṃparā varjanīyā eva
translated: Even in the case of forest fires, etc., a succession of transformations that are incompatible with the previous state is unavoidable.

original: api ca cinmātrabrahmavyatiriktakṛtsnaniṣedhaviṣayajñānasya ko 'yaṃ jñātā /
analyzed: api ca cit mātra brahma vyatirikta kṛtsna niṣedha viṣaya jñānasya kaḥ yam jñātā
translated: Moreover, who is the knower of the knowledge which has as its content the negation of everything except Brahman, which is pure consciousness?

original: adhyāsarūpa iti cen na /
analyzed: adhyāsa rūpaḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is said to be in the form of superimposition, no (it is not so).

original: tasya niṣedhatayā nivartakajñānakarmatvāt tatkartṛtvānupapatteḥ /
analyzed: tasya niṣedha tayā nivartaka jñāna karma tvāt tad kartṛ tva anupapatteḥ
translated: Because it is the object of the knowledge which is the cause of cessation by way of negation, it cannot be the agent of that.

original: brahmasvarūpa eveti cen na /
analyzed: brahma svarūpaḥ eva iti ced na
translated: If it is said to be Brahman itself, no (it is not so).

original: brahmaṇo nivartakajñānaṃ prati jñātṛtvaṃ kiṃ svarūpam utādhyastam /
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ nivartaka jñānam prati jñātṛ tvam kim svarūpam uta adhyastam
translated: With regard to Brahman, is the knowership of the knowledge which is the cause of cessation its nature or is it superimposed?

original: adhyastaṃ ced ayam adhyāsas tanmūlavidyāntaraṃ ca nivartakajñānaviṣayatayā tiṣṭhaty eva /
analyzed: adhyastam ced ayam adhyāsaḥ tad mūla vidyā antaram ca nivartaka jñāna viṣaya tayā tiṣṭhati eva
translated: If it is superimposed, then this superimposition and the other knowledge which is its root remain as the content of the knowledge which is the cause of cessation.

original: tannivartakāntarābhyupagame tasyāpi trirūpatayānavasthaiva /
analyzed: tad nivartaka antara abhyupagame tasya api tri rūpa tayā anavasthā eva
translated: If another cause of its cessation is accepted, then for that also, because it has the three aspects, there is the same infinite regress.

original: sarvasya hi jñānasya trirūpakatvavirahe jñānatvam eva hīyate /
analyzed: sarvasya hi jñānasya tri rūpaka tva virahe jñāna tvam eva hīyate
translated: For if any cognition lacks the three aspects, it loses its very nature as cognition.

original: kasyacit kaṃcanārthaviśeṣaṃ prati siddhirūpatvāt /
analyzed: kasyacid kaṃcana artha viśeṣam prati siddhi rūpa tvāt
translated: Because for some, it has the nature of establishing a certain particular object.

original: jñānasya trirūpatvavirahe bhavatāṃ svarūpabhūtajñānavan nivartakajñānam apy anivartakaṃ syāt /
translated: If cognition lacks the three aspects, then for you, the cognition that brings about cessation would not be a cognition that brings about cessation, just like the cognition that is the nature of Brahman.

original: brahmasvarūpasyaiva jñātṛtvābhyupagame 'smadīya eva pakṣaḥ parigṛhītaḥ syāt /
analyzed: brahma svarūpasya eva jñātṛ tva abhyupagame smadīyaḥ eva pakṣaḥ parigṛhītaḥ syāt
translated: If the nature of Brahman itself is accepted as the knower, then our very position would be accepted.

original: nivartakajñānasvarūpajñātṛtvaṃ ca svanivartyāntargatam iti vacanaṃ bhūtalavyatiriktaṃ
analyzed: nivartaka jñāna svarūpa jñātṛ tvam ca sva nivartya antargatam iti vacanam bhū tala vyatiriktam
translated: And the statement that the nature of the cognition that brings about cessation is included within what is to be ceased by itself is as laughable as the statement

original: kṛtsnaṃ chinnaṃ devadattenety asyām eva chedanakriyāyām asyāś chedanakriyāyāś chettṛtvasya
analyzed: kṛtsnam chinnam devadattena iti asyām eva chedana kriyāyām asyāḥ chedana kriyāyāḥ chettṛ tvasya
translated: that the entire cutting apart of the ground except for the ground itself is done by Devadatta, and that in this very act of cutting, this act of cutting has the nature of cutting,

original: ca chedyāntarbhāvavacanavad upahāsyam /
analyzed: ca chedya antarbhāva vacana vat upahāsyam
translated: and that the nature of the knower of the statement that the cutting is included within what is to be cut is included within what is to be cut by that statement.

original: api ca nikhilabhedanivartakam idam aikyajñānaṃ kena jātam iti vimarśanīyam /
analyzed: api ca nikhila bheda nivartakam idam aikya jñānam kena jātam iti vimarśanīyam
translated: Moreover, it should be considered by whom this cognition of unity, which brings about the cessation of all differences, is produced.

original: śrutyaiveti cen na /
analyzed: śrutyā eva iti ced na
translated: If it is said to be by the Veda itself, that is not so.

original: tasyā brahmavyatiriktāyā avidyāparikalpitatvāt prapañcabādhakajñānasyotpādakatvaṃ na saṃbhavati /
analyzed: tasyāḥ brahma vyatiriktāyāḥ avidyā parikalpita tvāt prapañca bādhaka jñānasya utpādaka tvam na saṃbhavati
translated: Because that [Veda], which is imagined to be different from Brahman, cannot be the producer of the cognition that negates the world.

original: tathā hi duṣṭakāraṇajātam api rajjusarpajñānaṃ na duṣṭakāraṇajanyena rajjur iyaṃ na sarpa iti jñānena bādhyate /🔽rajjusarpajñānabhaye vartamāne kenacidbhrāntena puruṣeṇa rajjur iyaṃ na sarpa ityukte
analyzed: tathā hi duṣṭa kāraṇa jātam api rajju sarpa jñānam na duṣṭa kāraṇa janyena rajjuḥ iyam na sarpaḥ iti jñānena bādhyate  rajju sarpa jñāna bhaye vartamāne kenacid bhrāntena puruṣeṇa rajjuḥ iyam na sarpaḥ iti ukte
translated: For, even the knowledge of a snake in a rope, though born of a defective cause, is not contradicted by the knowledge that this is a rope and not a snake, which is born of a defective cause.🔽Even when the knowledge of a snake in a rope and the fear of it are present, when a man who is deluded says this is a rope and not a snake,

original: 'py ayaṃ bhrānta iti jñāte sati tadvacanaṃ rajjusarpajñānasya bādhakaṃ na bhavati
analyzed: pi ayam bhrāntaḥ iti jñāte sati tat vacanam rajju sarpa jñānasya bādhakam na bhavati
translated: even though it is known that he is deluded, his words do not contradict the knowledge of a snake in a rope.

original: bhayaṃ ca na nivartate /
analyzed: bhayam ca na nivartate
translated: And the fear does not cease.

original: prayojakajñānavataḥ śravaṇavelāyām eva hi brahmavyatiriktatvena śruter api bhrāntimūlatvaṃ jñātam iti /
analyzed: prayojaka jñānavataḥ śravaṇa velāyām eva hi brahma vyatirikta tvena śruteḥ api bhrānti mūla tvam jñātam iti
translated: For one who has the knowledge of the one who enjoins, when he hears the scripture, even though the scripture is heard as being different from Brahman, its root in delusion is known.

original: nivartakajñānasya jñātus tatsāmagrībhūtaśāstrasya ca brahmavyatiriktatayā yadi bādhyatvam ucyate hanta tarhi prapañcanivṛtter mithyātvam āpatatīti
analyzed: nivartaka jñānasya jñātuḥ tad sāmagrī bhūta śāstrasya ca brahma vyatirikta tayā yadi bādhya tvam ucyate hanta tarhi prapañca nivṛtteḥ mithyātvam āpatati iti
translated: If it is said that the knowledge that causes cessation and the scripture that is a part of its means, being different from Brahman, are contradicted, then alas! the falsity of the cessation of the world would follow.

original: prapañcasya satyatā syāt /
analyzed: prapañcasya satya tā syāt
translated: So the reality of the world would be.

original: svapnadṛṣṭapuruṣavākyāvagatapitrādimaraṇasya mithyātvena pitrādisatyatāvat /
analyzed: svapna dṛṣṭa puruṣa vākya avagata pitṛ ādi maraṇasya mithyātvena pitṛ ādi satya tā vat
translated: Like the reality of the father, etc., due to the falsity of the death of the father, etc., understood from the words of a man seen in a dream.

original: kiñca tat tvam asy ādivākyaṃ na prapañcasya bādhakam /
analyzed: kiñca tat tvam asi ādi vākyam na prapañcasya bādhakam
translated: Moreover, the initial statement That thou art is not the refutation of the world.

original: bhrāntimūlatvād bhrāntaprayuktarajjusarpabādhakavākyavat /
analyzed: bhrānti mūla tvāt bhrānta prayukta rajju sarpa bādhaka vākya vat
translated: Because it has delusion as its basis, like a statement refuting a rope-snake created by delusion.

original: nanu ca svapne kasmiṃścid bhaye vartamāne svapnadaśāyām evāyaṃ svapna iti jñāte sati pūrvabhayanivṛttir dṛṣṭā /
analyzed: nanu ca svapne kasmiṃścid bhaye vartamāne svapna daśāyām eva ayam svapnaḥ iti jñāte sati pūrva bhaya nivṛttiḥ dṛṣṭā
translated: But in a dream, when someone is experiencing fear, upon knowing This is a dream in the dream state, the previous fear is seen to cease.

original: tadvad atrāpi saṃbhavatīti /
analyzed: tadvat atra api saṃbhavati iti
translated: The same can happen here as well.

original: naivam /
analyzed: na evam
translated: Not so.

original: svapnavelāyām eva so 'pi svapna iti jñāte sati punarbhayānivṛttir eva dṛṣṭeti na kaścid viśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: svapna velāyām eva saḥ svapnaḥ iti jñāte sati punarbhaya anivṛttiḥ eva dṛṣṭā iti na kaścid viśeṣaḥ
translated: When it is known That is also a dream even in the dream state, the recurrence of fear is seen. So there is no difference.

original: śravaṇavelāyām eva so'pi svapna iti jñātam evetyuktam /
analyzed: śravaṇa velāyām eva saḥ api svapnaḥ iti jñātam eva iti uktam
translated: It has been said that it is known That is also a dream even at the time of hearing.

original: yad api cedam uktaṃ bhrāntiparikalpitatvena mithyārūpam api śāstram advitīyaṃ brahmeti bodhayati tasya sato brahmaṇo viṣayasya paścāt tanabādhādarśanād
analyzed: yat api ca idam uktam bhrānti parikalpita tvena mithyā rūpam api śāstram advitīyam brahma iti bodhayati tasya sataḥ brahmaṇaḥ viṣayasya paścāt tana bādhā darśanāt
translated: And what has been said - that even a false scripture with an imagined basis teaches the non-dual Brahman - that Brahman, the object, is not seen to be refuted later,

original: brahma susthitam eveti /
analyzed: brahma susthitam eva iti
translated: so Brahman is well-established.

original: tad ayuktam /
analyzed: tat ayuktam
translated: That is not correct.

original: śūnyam eva tat tvam iti vākyena tasyāpi bādhitatvāt /
analyzed: śūnyam eva tat tvam iti vākyena tasya api bādhita tvāt
translated: Because that [Brahman] is also refuted by the statement That is void, thou art.

original: idaṃ bhrāntimūlavākyam iti cet /
analyzed: idam bhrānti mūla vākyam iti ced
translated: If it is said that this statement has delusion as its basis,

original: sad advitīyaṃ brahmeti vākyam api bhrāntimūlam iti tvayaivoktam /
analyzed: sat advitīyam brahma iti vākyam api bhrānti mūlam iti tvayā eva uktam
translated: You yourself have said that the statement Brahman is the only real, without a second is also based on error.

original: paścāt tanabādhādarśanaṃ tu sarvaśūnyavākyasyaiveti viśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: paścāt tana bādhā darśanam tu sarva śūnya vākyasya eva iti viśeṣaḥ
translated: The later observation of contradiction applies only to the statement of complete emptiness, this is the difference.

original: sarvaśūnyavādino brahmavyatiriktavastumithyātvavādinaś ca svapakṣasādhanapramāṇapāramārthyānabyupagamenābhiyuktair vādānadhikāra eva pratipāditaḥ
analyzed: sarva śūnyavādinaḥ brahma vyatirikta vastu mithyātva vādinaḥ ca sva pakṣa sādhana pramāṇa pāramārthya an abyupagamena abhiyuktaiḥ vāda anadhikāraḥ eva pratipāditaḥ
translated: It has been shown by the learned that those who advocate complete emptiness and the falsity of entities other than Brahman are not entitled to debate, since they accept the ultimate validity of the means of knowledge for establishing their own position.

original: adhikāro 'nabhyupāyatvān na vāde śūnyavādinaḥ / iti /
analyzed: adhikāraḥ na abhyupāya tvāt na vāde śūnyavādinaḥ iti
translated: As it is said: The proponent of emptiness is not entitled to debate, because he does not accept any means of knowledge.

original: api ca pratyakṣadṛṣṭasya prapañcasya mithyātvaṃ kena pramāṇena sādhyate /
analyzed: api ca pratyakṣa dṛṣṭasya prapañcasya mithyātvam kena pramāṇena sādhyate
translated: Moreover, by what means of knowledge is the falsity of the world, which is perceived by direct perception, established?

original: pratyakṣasya doṣamūlatvenānyathāsiddhisaṃbhavān nirdoṣaṃ śāstram ananyathāsiddhaṃ pratyakṣasya bādhakam iti cet /🔽kena doṣeṇa jātaṃ pratyakṣam anantabhedaviṣayam iti vaktavyam /
analyzed: pratyakṣasya doṣa mūla tvena anyathāsiddhi saṃbhavāt nirdoṣam śāstram ananyathāsiddham pratyakṣasya bādhakam iti ced  kena doṣeṇa jātam pratyakṣam ananta bheda viṣayam iti vaktavyam
translated: If it is argued that scripture, being faultless and not established in any other way, contradicts direct perception, because it is established in another way due to the faults of direct perception,🔽then it must be said by what fault direct perception has become having an infinite number of distinctions as its object.

original: anādibhedavāsanākhyadoṣajātaṃ pratyakṣam iti cet /
analyzed: anādi bheda vāsanā ākhya doṣa jātam pratyakṣam iti ced
translated: If it is argued that direct perception arises from the class of faults called beginningless impressions of distinctions,🔽then it follows that the world is not false, because it is an effect.

original: hanta tarhy anenaiva doṣeṇa jātaṃ śāstram apīty ekadoṣamūlatvāc chāstrapratyakṣayor na bādhyabādhakabhāvasiddhiḥ /
analyzed: hanta tarhi anena eva doṣeṇa jātam śāstram api iti eka doṣa mūla tvāt śāstra pratyakṣayoḥ na bādhya bādhaka bhāva siddhiḥ
translated: Well then, the scriptures also are born with this very fault. Therefore, since the scriptures and perception have the same root in the form of a fault, the establishment of the relation of the object to be negated and the negating factor is not possible.

original: ākāśavāyvādibhūtatadārabdhaśabdasparśādiyuktamanuṣyatvādisaṃsthānasaṃsthitapadārthagrāhi pratyakṣam /🔽śāstraṃ tu pratyakṣādyaparicchedyasarvāntarātmatvasatyatvādyanantaviśeṣaṇaviśiṣṭabrahmasvarūpatadupāsanādyārādhanaprakāratatprāptipūrvakatatprasādalabhyaphalaviśeṣatadaniṣṭakaraṇamūlanigrahaviśeṣaviṣayam
analyzed: ākāśa vāyu ādi bhūta tad ārabdha śabda sparśa ādi yukta manuṣya tva ādi saṃsthāna saṃsthita padārtha grāhi pratyakṣam  śāstram tu pratyakṣa ādi aparicchedya sarva antarātma tva satya tva ādi ananta viśeṣaṇa viśiṣṭa brahma sva rūpa tad upāsana ādi ārādhana prakāra tad prāpti pūrvaka tad prasāda labhya phala viśeṣa tad aniṣṭa karaṇa mūla nigraha viśeṣa viṣayam
translated: Perception apprehends objects having the form of human beings etc., endowed with sound, touch etc. of the elements such as space, air etc., and their derivatives.🔽The scriptures deal with Brahman, whose nature is characterized by innumerable attributes such as being the inner self of all, being true etc., which cannot be determined by perception etc., with the means of propitiating it such as the contemplation of it etc., with the means of attaining it, with the special fruits obtainable through its grace after attaining it, and with the special punishments to be inflicted on those who do not perform what is desirable.

original: iti na śātrapratyakṣayor virodhaḥ /
analyzed: iti na śātra pratyakṣayoḥ virodhaḥ
translated: Thus there is no contradiction between the scriptures and perception.

original: anādinidhanāvicchinnapāṭasaṃpradāyatādyanekaguṇaviśiṣṭasya śāstrasya balīyastvaṃ
analyzed: anādinidhana avicchinna pāṭa saṃpradāya tā ādi aneka guṇa viśiṣṭasya śāstrasya balīyaḥ tvam
translated: The scriptures, which are distinguished by many qualities such as having an unbroken tradition from beginningless time, are more powerful.

original: vadatā pratyakṣapāramārthyam avaśyam abhyupagantavyam ity alam anena śrutiśatavitativātavegaparāhatakudṛṣṭiduṣṭayuktijālatūlanirasanenety uparamyate
analyzed: vadatā pratyakṣa pāramārthyam avaśyam abhyupagantavyam iti alam anena śruti śata vitati vātavega parāhata kudṛṣṭi duṣṭa yukti jāla tūla nirasanena iti uparamyate
translated: One who asserts this must necessarily accept the ultimate reality of perception. Therefore, I desist from refuting the net of bad arguments based on bad views, which are blown away by the force of the wind of the hundred branches of the Vedas.

original: dvitīye tu pakṣa upādhibrahmavyatiriktavastvantarānabhyupagamād brahmaṇy evopādhisaṃsargād aupādhikāḥ sarve doṣā brahmaṇy eva bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: dvitīye tu pakṣe upādhi brahma vyatirikta vastu antara anabhyupagamāt brahmaṇi eva upādhi saṃsargāt aupādhikāḥ sarve doṣāḥ brahmaṇi eva bhaveyuḥ
translated: But in the second case, because of the non-acceptance of any other thing apart from the qualified Brahman, all the faults due to the contact of limiting adjuncts would be in Brahman itself.

original: tataś cāpahatapāpmatvādinirdoṣatvaśrutayaḥ sarve vihanyante /
analyzed: tatas ca apahata pāpma tva ādi nirdoṣa tva śrutayaḥ sarve vihanyante
translated: And then all the scriptural statements about Brahman being free from faults such as sin, etc. would be contradicted.

original: yathā ghaṭākāśādeḥ paricchinnatayā mahākāśād vailakṣaṇyaṃ parasparabhedaś ca dṛśyate🔽tatrasthā guṇā vā doṣā vānavacchinne mahākāśe na saṃbadhyante evam upādhikṛtabhedavyavasthitajīvagatā
analyzed: yathā ghaṭa ākāśa ādeḥ paricchinna tayā mahā ākāśāt vailakṣaṇyam paraspara bhedaḥ ca dṛśyate  tatrasthāḥ guṇāḥ vā doṣāḥ vā anavacchinne mahā ākāśe na saṃbadhyante evam upādhi kṛta bheda vyavasthita jīva gatā
translated: Just as the limited space in a pot, etc. is seen to be different from the great space, and there is mutual difference,🔽so the qualities or faults residing in the individual souls, which are established by the limiting adjuncts,

original: doṣā anupahite pare brahmaṇi na saṃbadhyanta iti cet /
analyzed: doṣāḥ anupahite pare brahmaṇi na saṃbadhyante iti ced
translated: do not apply to the supreme Brahman which is not limited. If it is argued that the faults of the individual souls do not apply to the supreme Brahman,

original: naitad upapadyate /
analyzed: na etat upapadyate
translated: this is not correct.

original: niravayavasyākāśasyānavacchedyasya ghaṭādibhiś chedāsaṃbhavāt tenaivākāśena ghaṭādayaḥ saṃyuktā iti brahmaṇo 'py acchedyatvād brahmaivopādhisaṃyuktaṃ 🔽syāt /
analyzed: niravayavasya ākāśasya anavacchedyasya ghaṭa ādibhiḥ cheda asaṃbhavāt tena eva ākāśena ghaṭa ādayaḥ saṃyuktāḥ iti brahmaṇaḥ api acchedya tvāt brahma eva upādhi saṃyuktam  syāt
translated: Because it is not possible to limit the undivided space by pots, etc., since space is indivisible, it is said that pots, etc. are in contact with space itself. Similarly, since Brahman is also indivisible, Brahman itself would be in contact with the limiting adjuncts.

original: ghaṭasaṃyuktākāśapradeśo 'nyasmād ākāśapradeśād bhidyata ic cet /
analyzed: ghaṭa saṃyukta ākāśa pradeśaḥ ni asmāt ākāśa pradeśāt bhidyate id ced
translated: If it is argued that the part of space in contact with the pot is different from another part of space,🔽then it follows that space is divided.

original: ākāśasyaikasyaiva pradeśabhedena ghaṭādisaṃyogād ghaṭādau gacchati tasya ca pradeśabhedasyāniyama🔽iti tadvad brahmaṇy eva pradeśabhedāniyamenopādhisaṃsargād upādhau gacchati saṃyuktaviyuktabrahmapradeśabhedāc
analyzed: ākāśasya ekasya eva pradeśa bhedena ghaṭa ādi saṃyogāt ghaṭa ādau gacchati tasya ca pradeśa bhedasya aniyamaḥ  iti tadvat brahmaṇi eva pradeśa bheda aniyamena upādhi saṃsargāt upādhau gacchati saṃyukta viyukta brahma pradeśa bhedāt
translated: And the space, though one only, by the connection with the pot, etc., in the different parts of the pot, etc., and the parts of that space being not regulated,🔽in the same way, in Brahman also, by the connection with the limiting adjuncts, in the unregulated parts of Brahman, the limiting adjuncts go, and by the regulation and non-regulation of the parts of Brahman connected and not connected,

original: ca brahmaṇy evopādhisaṃsargaḥ kṣaṇe kṣaṇe bandhamokṣau syātām iti santaḥ parihasanti /
analyzed: ca brahmaṇi eva upādhi saṃsargaḥ kṣaṇe kṣaṇe bandha mokṣau syātām iti santaḥ parihasanti  /
translated: in Brahman itself, bondage and liberation would occur every moment. Thus the wise ones laugh at this.

original: niravayavasyaivākāśasya śrotrendriyatve 'pīndriyavyavasthāvad brahmaṇy api vyavasthopapadyata iti cet /
analyzed: niravayavasya eva ākāśasya śrotra indriya tve pi indriya vyavasthā vat brahmaṇi api vyavasthā upapadyate iti ced
translated: If it is argued that even when space, which is partless only, is the organ of hearing, the regulation of the organs is possible even in Brahman,

original: na vāyuviśeṣasaṃskṛtakarṇapradeśasaṃyuktasyaivākāśapradeśasyendriyatvāt tasya ca pradeśāntarābhede 'pīndriyavyavasthopapadyate /
analyzed: na vāyu viśeṣa saṃskṛta karṇa pradeśa saṃyuktasya eva ākāśa pradeśasya indriya tvāt tasya ca pradeśa antara abhede pi indriya vyavasthā upapadyate
translated: it is not so, because only that part of space which is connected with the part of the ear refined by a particular wind is the organ, and the regulation of the organs is possible even in that, though there is no difference from other parts.

original: ākāśasya tu sarveṣāṃ śarīreṣu gacchat svaniyamena sarvapradeśasaṃyoga iti brahmaṇy upādhisaṃyogapradeśāniyama eva /
analyzed: ākāśasya tu sarveṣām śarīreṣu gacchat sva niyamena sarva pradeśa saṃyogaḥ iti brahmaṇi upādhi saṃyoga pradeśa aniyamaḥ eva
translated: But in the case of space, which goes into all bodies, there is connection with all parts according to its own regulation. Therefore, in Brahman itself, there is no regulation of the parts connected with the limiting adjuncts.

original: ākāśasya svarūpeṇaiva śrotrendriyatvam abhyupagamyāpīndriyavyavasthokatā /
analyzed: ākāśasya sva rūpeṇa eva śrotra indriya tvam abhyupagamya api indriya vyavasthokatā
translated: Even if we admit that the auditory organ is nothing but ākāśa, the establishment of the organs is not possible.

original: paramārthatas tv ākāśo na śrotrendriyam /
analyzed: paramārthataḥ tu ākāśaḥ na śrotra indriyam
translated: But in reality ākāśa is not the auditory organ.

original: vaikārikād ahaṃkārād ekādaśendriyāṇi jāyanta iti hi vaidikāḥ /
analyzed: vaikārikāt ahaṃkārāt ekādaśa indriyāṇi jāyante iti hi vaidikāḥ
translated: For the followers of the Veda declare that the eleven organs are produced from the modified egoism.

original: yathoktaṃ bhagavatā parāśareṇa🔽taijasānīndriyāṇy āhur devā vaikārikā daśa /
analyzed: yathā uktam bhagavatā parāśareṇa  taijasāni indriyāṇi āhuḥ devāḥ vaikārikāḥ daśa
translated: As has been said by the revered Parāśara:🔽The gods are said to be the eleven organs produced from the modified egoism.

original: ekādaśaṃ manaś cātra devā vaikārikāḥ smṛtāḥ // iti /
analyzed: ekādaśam manaḥ ca atra devāḥ vaikārikāḥ smṛtāḥ iti
translated: The gods are said to be the eleven organs produced from the modified egoism.

original: ayam arthaḥ /
analyzed: ayam arthaḥ
translated: This is the meaning.

original: vaikārikas taijaso bhūtādir iti trividho 'haṃkāraḥ /
analyzed: vaikārikaḥ taijasaḥ bhūtādiḥ iti trividhaḥ haṃkāraḥ
translated: Egoism is of three kinds: modified, luminous, and elemental.

original: sa ca kramāt sāttviko rājasas tāmasaś ca /🔽tatra tāmasād bhūtāder ākāśādīni bhūtāni jāyanta iti sṛṣṭikramam uktvā taijasād rājasād
analyzed: sa ca kramāt sāttvikaḥ rājasaḥ tāmasaḥ ca  tatra tāmasāt bhūtādeḥ ākāśa ādīni bhūtāni jāyante iti sṛṣṭi kramam uktvā taijasāt rājasāt
translated: And it is, in order, of the quality of goodness, passion, and darkness.

original: ahaṃkārād ekadaśendriyāṇi jāyanta iti paramatam upanyasya sāttvikāhaṃkārād vaikārikānīndriyāṇi
analyzed: ahaṃkārāt eka daśa indriyāṇi jāyante iti para matam upanyasya sāttvika ahaṃkārāt vaikārikāni indriyāṇi
translated: Having stated the order of creation that the elements, beginning with ākāśa, are produced from the elemental egoism of darkness, he sets forth the opinion of others that the eleven organs are produced from the luminous egoism of passion and the modified egoism of goodness.

original: jāyanta iti svamatam ucyate devā vaikārikāḥ smṛtā iti /
analyzed: jāyante iti sva matam ucyate devāḥ vaikārikāḥ smṛtāḥ iti
translated: He states his own opinion that the organs are produced from the modified egoism: The gods are said to be the eleven organs.

original: devā indriyāṇi /
analyzed: devāḥ indriyāṇi
translated: The gods are the organs.

original: evam indriyāṇām āhaṃkārikāṇāṃ bhūtaiś cāpy āyanaṃ mahābhārata ucyate /
analyzed: evam indriyāṇām āhaṃkārikāṇām bhūtaiḥ ca api āyanam mahābhārataḥ ucyate
translated: Thus, the going of the senses, which are made of ego, into the elements is said to be the Great Departure in the Mahābhārata.

original: bhautikatve 'pīndriyāṇām ākāśādibhūtavikāratvād evākāśādibhūtapariṇāmaviśeṣā vyavasthitā
analyzed: bhautika tve pi indriyāṇām ākāśa ādi bhūta vikāra tvāt eva ākāśa ādi bhūta pariṇāma viśeṣā vyavasthitā
translated: Even though the senses are made of the elements, they are established as special transformations of the elements such as space, just because they are modifications of the elements such as space.

original: eva śarīravat puruṣāṇām indriyāṇi bhavantīti brahmaṇy acchedye niravayave nirvikāre
analyzed: eva śarīra vat puruṣāṇām indriyāṇi bhavanti iti brahmaṇi acchedye niravayave nirvikāre
translated: Just as the body is for the embodied souls, the senses are for the souls. Thus, in Brahman, which is indivisible, partless, and changeless,

original: tv aniyamenānantaheyopādhisaṃsargadoṣo duṣparihara eveti śraddadhānānām evāyam pakṣa
analyzed: tu aniyamena ananta heya upādhi saṃsarga doṣaḥ duṣpariharaḥ eva iti śraddadhānānām eva ayam pakṣa
translated: the fault of an unrestricted connection with the infinite objects to be abandoned is indeed difficult to avoid. Therefore, those who have faith

original: iti śāstravido na bahu manyante /🔽svarūpapariṇāmābhyupagamād avikāratvaśrutir bādhyate /
analyzed: iti śāstra vidaḥ na bahu manyante  svarūpa pariṇāma abhyupagamāt avikāra tva śrutiḥ bādhyate
translated: do not consider this view to be very important.🔽If it is argued that the statement of changelessness is contradicted by the acceptance of a change in nature,

original: niravadyatā ca brahmaṇaḥ śaktipariṇāma iti cet /
analyzed: niravadya tā ca brahmaṇaḥ śakti pariṇāmaḥ iti ced
translated: and that the faultlessness of Brahman is a transformation of power,

original: keyaṃ śaktir ucyate /
analyzed: kā iyam śaktiḥ ucyate
translated: what is this power said to be?

original: kiṃ brahmapariṇāmarūpā /
analyzed: kim brahma pariṇāma rūpā
translated: Is it of the form of a transformation of Brahman?

original: uta brahmaṇo 'nanyā kāpīti /
analyzed: uta brahmaṇaḥ nanyā kā api iti
translated: Or is it something different from Brahman?

original: ubhayapakṣe 'pi svarūpapariṇāmo 'varjanīya eva /
analyzed: ubhaya pakṣe sva rūpa pariṇāmaḥ varjanīyaḥ eva
translated: Even in both cases, a change in nature is unavoidable.

original: tṛtīye 'pi pakṣe jīvabrahmaṇor bhedavad abhedasya cābhyupagamāt tasya ca tadbhāvāt
analyzed: tṛtīye pi pakṣe jīva brahmaṇoḥ bheda vat abhedasya ca abhyupagamāt tasya ca tad bhāvāt
translated: In the third case also, because of the acceptance of the difference and non-difference of the individual soul and Brahman, and because of that being their nature,

original: saubharibhedavac ca svāvatārabhedavac ca sarvasyeśvarabhedatāt sarve jīvagatā doṣās tasyaiva syuḥ /
analyzed: saubhari bheda vat ca sva avatāra bheda vat ca sarvasya īśvara bheda tāt sarve jīva gatāḥ doṣāḥ tasya eva syuḥ
translated: And just as there is a difference in the Subhadra and the incarnations, so there is a difference in the Lord for everyone. All the faults that reside in the individual souls would belong to Him.

original: etad uktaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: etat uktam bhavati
translated: This is what is said.

original: īśvaraḥ svarūpeṇaiva suranaratiryaksthāvarādibhedenāvasthita iti hi tadātmakatvavarṇanaṃ kriyate /
analyzed: īśvaraḥ sva rūpeṇa eva sura nara tiryak sthāvara ādi bhedena avasthitaḥ iti hi tad ātmaka tva varṇanam kriyate
translated: For it is said that the description is made that the Lord Himself, in His own form, exists in the distinctions of gods, humans, animals, plants, etc.

original: tathā saty ekamṛtpiṇḍārabdhaghaṭaśarāvādigatāny udakāharaṇādīni sarvakāryāṇi yathā tasyaiva bhavanti /
analyzed: tathā sati eka mṛd piṇḍa ārabdha ghaṭa śarāva ādi gatāni udaka āharaṇa ādīni sarva kāryāṇi yathā tasya eva bhavanti
translated: If that is so, then just as all the functions such as carrying water, etc., of the pot, dish, etc., made from a single lump of clay belong to that [clay],

original: evaṃ sarvajīvagatasukhaduḥkhādi sarvam īśvaragatam eva syāt /
analyzed: evam sarva jīva gata sukha duḥkha ādi sarvam īśvara gatam eva syāt
translated: in the same way, all the happiness, suffering, etc., that reside in all individual souls would belong to the Lord alone.

original: ghaṭaśarāvādisaṃsthānānupayuktamṛddravyaṃ yathā kāryāntarānvitam evam eva surapaśumanujādijīvatvānupayukteśvaraḥ
analyzed: ghaṭa śarāva ādi saṃsthāna anupayukta mṛd dravyam yathā kārya antara anvitam evam eva sura paśu manuja ādi jīva tva anupayukta īśvaraḥ
translated: Just as the clay substance that is not useful for the shapes of the pot, dish, etc. is connected with another effect, in the same way, the Lord, who is not useful for the individual souls of gods, animals, humans, etc.,

original: sarvajñaḥ satyasaṃkalpatvādikalyāṇaguṇākara iti cet satyaṃ sa eveśvara ekenāṃśena
analyzed: sarvajñaḥ satya saṃkalpa tva ādi kalyāṇa guṇa ākaraḥ iti ced satyam saḥ eva īśvaraḥ ekena aṃśena
translated: is omniscient, the abode of auspicious qualities such as truthfulness of resolve, etc. If this is said, it is true that He, the Lord, is the abode of auspicious qualities with one part,

original: kalyāṇaguṇagaṇākaraḥ sa evānyenāṃśena heyaguṇākara ity uktam /
analyzed: kalyāṇa guṇa gaṇa ākaraḥ saḥ eva anyena aṃśena heya guṇa ākaraḥ iti uktam
translated: and with another part He is the abode of qualities to be abandoned. This has been said.

original: dvayor aṃśayor īśvarāviśeṣāt /
analyzed: dvayoḥ aṃśayoḥ īśvara aviśeṣāt
translated: Because there is no difference between the two parts in being the Lord.

original: dvav aṃśau vyavasthitav iti cet /
analyzed: dvau aṃśau vyavasthitau iti ced
translated: If it is said that the two parts are established,

original: kas tena lābhaḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ tena lābhaḥ
translated: what is the gain from that?

original: ekasyaivānekāṃśena nityaduḥkhitvād aṃśāntareṇa sukhitvam api neśvaratvāya kalpate /🔽yathā devadattasyaikasmin haste candanapaṅkānulepakeyūrakaṭakāṅgulīyālaṃkāras tasyaivānyasmin
analyzed: ekasya eva aneka aṃśena nitya duḥkhi tvāt aṃśa antareṇa sukhi tvam api nā īśvara tvāya kalpate  yathā devadattasya ekasmin haste candana paṅka anulepa keyūra kaṭaka aṅgulīya alaṃkāraḥ tasya eva anyasmin
translated: Because of being eternally miserable with many parts, even the state of being happy with another part is not suitable for being God.🔽Just as for Devadatta, there is the decoration of sandalwood paste, bracelets, armlets, and rings on one hand, and

original: haste mudgarābhighātaḥ kālānalajvālānupraveśaś ca tadvad eveśvarasya syād iti brahmājñānapakṣād
analyzed: haste mudgara abhighātaḥ kāla anala jvālā anupraveśaḥ ca tadvat eva īśvarasya syāt iti brahma ajñāna pakṣāt
translated: on the other hand, there is the striking with a hammer and the entry of the flames of the fire of time, in the same way, it would be for God. Thus, this position of difference and non-difference

original: api pāpīyān ayaṃ bhedābhedapakṣaḥ /
analyzed: api pāpīyān ayam bheda abheda pakṣaḥ
translated: is worse than the position of Brahman's ignorance.

original: aparimitaduḥkhasya pāramārthikatvāt saṃsāriṇām anantatvena dustaratvāc ca /
analyzed: aparimita duḥkhasya pāramārthika tvāt saṃsāriṇām ananta tvena dustara tvāt ca
translated: Because of the ultimate reality of immeasurable suffering, and because of the difficulty of crossing due to the infinity of transmigrating beings.

original: tasmād vilakṣaṇo 'yaṃ jīvāṃśa iti cet /
analyzed: tasmāt vilakṣaṇaḥ yam jīvāṃśaḥ iti ced
translated: If it is said that this part of the individual soul is different from that,

original: āgato 'si tarhi madīyaṃ panthānam /
analyzed: āgataḥ si tarhi madīyam panthānam
translated: then you have come to my path.

original: īśvarasya svarūpeṇa tādātmyavarṇane syād ayaṃ doṣaḥ /
analyzed: īśvarasya sva rūpeṇa tādātmya varṇane syāt ayam doṣaḥ
translated: This fault would occur if the identity with God were described in terms of his nature.

original: ātmaśarīrabhāvena tu tādātmyapratipādane na kaścid doṣaḥ /
analyzed: ātma śarīra bhāvena tu tādātmya pratipādane na kaścid doṣaḥ
translated: But when the identity is taught in terms of the state of being the body of the Self, there is no fault at all.

original: praty uta nikhilabhuvananiyamanādir mahān ayaṃ guṇagaṇaḥ pratipādito bhavati /
analyzed: prati uta nikhila bhuvana niyamana ādiḥ mahān ayam guṇa gaṇaḥ pratipāditaḥ bhavati
translated: On the contrary, it is taught that this great collection of qualities, such as the control of the entire world, and so on, is established.

original: sāmānādhikaraṇyaṃ ca mukhyavṛttam /
analyzed: sāmānādhikaraṇyam ca mukhya vṛttam
translated: And the co-reference is primary.

original: api caikasya vastuno bhinnābhinnatvaṃ viruddhatvān na saṃbhavatītyuktam /
analyzed: api ca ekasya vastunaḥ bhinna abhinna tvam viruddha tvāt na saṃbhavati iti uktam
translated: Moreover, it has been said that it is contradictory for one thing to be both different and non-different.

original: ghaṭasya paṭād bhinnatve sati tasya tasminn abhāvaḥ /
analyzed: ghaṭasya paṭāt bhinna tve sati tasya tasmin abhāvaḥ
translated: If the pot is different from the cloth, then it does not exist in that [cloth].

original: abhinnatve sati tasya ca bhāva iti /
analyzed: abhinna tve sati tasya ca bhāvaḥ iti
translated: If it is non-different, then it does exist.

original: ekasmin kāle caikasmin deśe caikasya hi padārthasya yugapatsadbhāvo 'sadbhāvaś ca viruddhaḥ /
analyzed: ekasmin kāle ca ekasmin deśe ca ekasya hi padārthasya ca viruddhaḥ
translated: And it is contradictory for one thing to both exist and not exist simultaneously in one place at one time.

original: jātyātmanā bhāvo vyaktyātmanā cābhāva iti cet /
analyzed: jāti ātmanā bhāvaḥ vyakti ātmanā ca abhāvaḥ iti ced
translated: If it is argued that it exists as a universal and does not exist as an individual,

original: jāter muṇḍena cābhāve sati khaṇḍe muṇḍasyāpi sadbhāvaprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: jāteḥ muṇḍena ca abhāve sati khaṇḍe muṇḍasya api sadbhāva prasaṅgaḥ
translated: then if the universal does not exist in the shaved [head], it would follow that the shaved [head] also exists.

original: khaṇḍena ca jāter abhinnatve sadbhāvo bhinnatve cāsadbhāvaḥ aśve mahiśatvasyaiveti virodho duṣparihara eva /
analyzed: khaṇḍena ca jāteḥ abhinna tve sadbhāvaḥ bhinna tve ca asadbhāvaḥ aśve mahiśa tvasya eva iti virodhaḥ duṣpariharaḥ eva
translated: And if the universal is non-different from the part, it exists, and if it is different, it does not exist. The same is true of the non-existence of a buffalo in a horse. The contradiction is difficult to avoid.

original: jātyāder vastusaṃsthānatayā vastunaḥ prakāratvāt prakāraprakāriṇoś ca padārthāntaratvaṃ🔽prakārasya pṛthaksiddhyanarhatvaṃ pṛthaganupalambhaś ca tasya ca saṃsthānasya cānekavastuṣu
analyzed: jāti ādeḥ vastu saṃsthāna tayā vastunaḥ prakāra tvāt prakāra prakāriṇoḥ ca padārtha antara tvam 🔽prakārasya pṛthak siddhi anarha tvam pṛthak anupalambhaḥ ca tasya ca saṃsthānasya ca aneka vastuṣu
translated: Since the universal and so on are the arrangement of the thing, and the thing is the type, and the type and the bearer of the type are different things,🔽and the type is not fit to be established separately, and is not apprehended separately, and that [arrangement] and the arrangement are in many things,

original: prakāratayāvasthitaś cetyādi pūrvam uktam / 🔽so 'yam iti buddhiḥ prakārāikyād ayam api daṇḍīti buddhimat /
analyzed: prakāra tayā avasthitaḥ ca ityādi pūrvam uktam  saḥ yam iti buddhiḥ prakāra āikyāt ayam api daṇḍī iti buddhimat
translated: And it was said earlier that it exists as a mode.🔽This cognition is of the form this is that, and the cognition this is also a staff-holder is due to the identity of the mode.

original: ayam ca jātyādiprakāro vastuno bheda ity ucyate /🔽tadyoga eva vastuno bhinnam iti vyavahārahetur ityarthaḥ /
analyzed: ayam ca jāti ādi prakāraḥ vastunaḥ bhedaḥ iti ucyate  tad yogaḥ eva vastunaḥ bhinnam iti vyavahāra hetuḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: And this mode such as the universal etc. is said to be the difference of the entity.🔽The meaning is that the mere connection with that is the cause of the usage of the entity as different.

original: sa ca vastuno bhedavyavahārahetuḥ svasya ca saṃvedanavat /
analyzed: sa ca vastunaḥ bheda vyavahāra hetuḥ svasya ca saṃvedana vat
translated: And that cause of the usage of the entity as different is like the cognition of itself.

original: yathā saṃvedanaṃ vastuno vyavahārahetuḥ svasya vyavahārahetuś ca bhavati /
analyzed: yathā saṃvedanam vastunaḥ vyavahāra hetuḥ svasya vyavahāra hetuḥ ca bhavati
translated: Just as cognition is the cause of the usage of the entity and is also the cause of one's own usage.

original: ata eva sanmātragrāhi pratyakṣaṃ na bhedagrāhītyādivādā nirastāḥ /
analyzed: atas eva sanmātra grāhi pratyakṣam na bheda grāhi ityādi vādāḥ nirastāḥ
translated: For this very reason, the statements that perception grasps only existence and does not grasp difference etc. are refuted.

original: jātyādisaṃsthānasaṃsthitasyaiva vastunaḥ pratyakṣeṇa gṛhītatvāt tasyaiva saṃsthānarūpajātyādeḥ pratiyogyapekṣayā bhedavyavahārahetutvāc ca
