original: sarveśvaraḥ sarvadṛksarvavettā samastaśaktiḥ parameśvarākhyaḥ //
translated: The Lord of all, the seer of all, the knower of all, possessing all powers, called the Supreme Lord.

original: saṃjñāyate yena tad astadoṣaṃ śuddhaṃ paraṃ nirmalam ekarūpam /
analyzed: saṃjñāyate yena tat asta doṣam śuddham param nirmalam eka rūpam
translated: By which that is known, free from faults, pure, supreme, stainless, of one form,

original: saṃdṛśyate vāpy adhigamyate vā tajjñānam ajñānam ato 'nyad uktam //
analyzed: saṃdṛśyate vā api adhigamyate vā tat jñānam ajñānam atas uktam
translated: Is seen or realized, that is knowledge; anything else is said to be ignorance.

original: iti parabrahmasvarūpaviśeṣanirṇayāyaiva pravṛttam / 🔽anyāni sarvāṇi purāṇāny etadavirodhena neyāni /
analyzed: iti para brahma svarūpa viśeṣa nirṇayāya eva pravṛttam  anyāni sarvāṇi purāṇāni etad avirodhena neyāni
translated: Thus, this (text) is undertaken only to determine the specific nature of the supreme Brahman.🔽All other Puranas should be interpreted without contradicting this.

original: anyaparatvaṃ ca tattadārambhaprakārair avagamyate /
analyzed: anya para tvam ca tad tad ārambha prakāraiḥ avagamyate
translated: And their being about something else is understood from the ways they are begun.

original: sarvātmanā viruddhāṃśas tāmasatvād anādaraṇīyaḥ /
analyzed: sarva ātmanā viruddha aṃśaḥ tāmasa tvāt an ādaraṇīyaḥ
translated: The entire contradictory part is to be disregarded because of its being of the tamas quality.

original: nanv asminn api
analyzed: nanu asmin api
translated: But even in this (text),

original: sṛṣṭisthityantakaraṇīṃ brahmaviṣnuśivātmikāṃ /
analyzed: sṛṣṭi sthiti anta karaṇīm brahma viṣnu śiva ātmikām
translated: The one who creates, maintains and destroys, who is of the nature of Brahma, Vishnu and Shiva,

original: sa saṃjñā yāti bhagavān eka janārdanaḥ //
analyzed: sa saṃjñā yāti bhagavān eka janārdanaḥ
translated: That Lord is known as Janardana.

original: iti trimūrtosāmyaṃ pratīyate /
analyzed: iti trimūrti sāmyam pratīyate
translated: Thus, the equality of the three forms is understood.

original: naitad evam /
analyzed: na etat evam
translated: This is not so.

original: eka eva janārdana iti jana ardanasyaiva brahmaśivādikṛtsnaprapañcatādātmyaṃ vidhīyate /
analyzed: ekaḥ eva janārdanaḥ iti jana ardanasya eva brahma śiva ādi kṛtsna prapañca tādātmyam vidhīyate
translated: It is enjoined that Janardana alone is identical with Brahma, Shiva, and the entire universe.

original: jagac ca sa iti pūrvoktam eva vivṛṇoti sraṣṭā sṛjati cātmānaṃ viṣṇuḥ pālyaṃ ca pāti ca /
analyzed: jagat ca saḥ iti pūrva uktam eva vivṛṇoti sraṣṭā sṛjati ca ātmānam viṣṇuḥ pālyam ca pāti ca
translated: And the world is He. He, Vishnu, creates Himself and protects what is to be protected.

original: upasaṃhriyate cānte saṃhartā ca svatyaṃprabhuḥ //
analyzed: upasaṃhriyate ca ante saṃhartā ca svatyaṃprabhuḥ
translated: In the end, He, the Lord, is withdrawn.

original: iti ca sraṣṭṛtvenāvasthitaṃ brahmaṇaṃ sṛjyaṃ ca saṃhartāraṃ saṃhāryaṃ ca yugapan
analyzed: iti ca sraṣṭṛ tvena avasthitam sṛjyam ca saṃhartāram saṃhāryam ca yugapad
translated: Thus, having pointed out Brahma, who exists as the creator, and what is to be created, and the destroyer, and what is to be destroyed, simultaneously,

original: nirdiśya sarvasya viṣṇutādātmyopadeśāt sṛjyasaṃhāryabhūtād vastunaḥ sraṣṭṛsaṃhartror
analyzed: nirdiśya sarvasya viṣṇu tādātmya upadeśāt sṛjya saṃhārya bhūtāt vastunaḥ sraṣṭṛ saṃhartroḥ
translated: and by teaching the identity of everything with Vishnu, a distinction is seen between the created and the destroyer, and the created and the destroyed,

original: janārdanavibhūtitvena viśeṣo dṛśyate /
analyzed: janārdana vibhūti tvena viśeṣaḥ dṛśyate
translated: as being the manifestations of Janardana.

original: janārdanaviṣṇuśabdayoḥ paryāyatvena brahmaviṣṇuśivātmikām iti vibhūtim /🔽ata eva svecchayā līlārthaṃ vibhūtyantarbhāva ucyate /
analyzed: janārdana viṣṇu śabdayoḥ paryāya tvena brahma viṣṇu śiva ātmikām iti vibhūtim  atas eva sva icchayā līlā artham vibhūti antarbhāvaḥ ucyate
translated: The words Janardana and Vishnu are synonyms. The manifestation is of the nature of Brahma, Vishnu, and Shiva.🔽For this very reason, the inclusion within the manifestation is said to be for the sake of play by His own will.

original: yathedam anantaram evocyate
analyzed: yathā idam anantaram eva ucyate
translated: For this very reason, it is said immediately after this:

original: pṛthivyāpas tathā tejo vāyur ākāśa eva ca /
analyzed: pṛthivī apaḥ tathā tejaḥ vāyuḥ ākāśaḥ eva ca
translated: Earth, water, fire, air, and space,

original: sarvendriyāntaḥkaraṇaṃ puruṣākhyaṃ hi yaj jagat //
analyzed: sarva indriya antaḥkaraṇam puruṣa ākhyam hi yat jagat
translated: For the universe is called the soul of the Purusha, which is the inner controller of all the senses.

original: sa eva sarvabhūtātmā viśvarūpo yato 'vyayaḥ /🔽sargādikaṃ tato 'syaiva bhūtastham upakārakam //
analyzed: saḥ eva sarva bhūta ātmā viśva rūpaḥ yatas vyayaḥ  sarga ādikam bhūta stham upakārakam
translated: He alone is the soul of all beings, the all-formed, because He is imperishable.🔽Therefore, the creation etc. are beneficial to Him alone, who abides in the elements.

original: sa eva sṛjyaḥ sa ca sarvakartā sa eva pātyatti ca pālyate ca /
analyzed: saḥ eva sṛjyaḥ sa ca sarva kartā saḥ eva pāti atti ca pālyate ca
translated: He alone is to be created, and He is the creator of all, He alone protects and is protected.

original: brahmādyavasthābhir aśeṣamūrtir viṣṇur variṣṭho varado vareṇyaḥ // iti /
analyzed: brahma ādi avasthābhiḥ aśeṣa mūrtiḥ viṣṇuḥ variṣṭhaḥ vara daḥ vareṇyaḥ iti
translated: Vishnu, the best, the giver of boons, the most excellent, with all forms in the states beginning with Brahma.

original: atra sāmānādhikaraṇyanirdiṣṭaṃ heyamiśraprapañcatādātmyaṃ niravadyasya nirvikārasya
analyzed: atra sāmānādhikaraṇya nirdiṣṭam heya miśra prapañca tādātmyam niravadyasya nirvikārasya
translated: Here, the identity with the world mixed with the undesirable, indicated by the co-reference, of the faultless, changeless

original: samastakalyāṇaguṇātmakasya brahmaṇaḥ katham upapadyata ity āśaṅkhya sa eva sarvabhūtātmā
analyzed: samasta kalyāṇa guṇa ātmakasya brahmaṇaḥ katham upapadyate iti āśaṅkhya saḥ eva sarva bhūta ātmā
translated: Brahman, consisting of all auspicious qualities, is how it is possible? Suspecting this, He alone is the soul of all beings,

original: viśvarūpo yato 'vyaya iti svayam evopapādayati /🔽sa eva sarveśvaraḥ parabrahmabhūto viṣṇur eva sarvaṃ jagad iti pratijñāya sarvabhūtātmā viśvarūpo yato 'vyaya iti hetur uktaḥ /
analyzed: viśvarūpaḥ yatas vyayaḥ iti svayam eva upapādayati  saḥ eva sarva īśvaraḥ para brahma bhūtaḥ viṣṇuḥ eva sarvam jagat iti pratijñāya sarva bhūta ātmā viśva rūpaḥ yatas vyayaḥ iti hetuḥ uktaḥ
translated: the all-formed, because He is imperishable, He Himself explains.🔽Having declared that Vishnu alone is the Supreme Brahman, the Lord of all, and all this universe, the reason is stated: He is the soul of all beings, the all-formed, because He is imperishable.

original: sarvabhūtānām ayam ātmā viśvaśarīro yato 'vyaya ityarthaḥ /
analyzed: sarva bhūtānām ayam ātmā viśva śarīraḥ yatas vyayaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: He is the soul of all beings, the body of the universe, because He is imperishable.

original: vakṣyati ca satsarvaṃ vai hares tanur iti /
analyzed: vakṣyati ca sat sarvam vai hareḥ tanuḥ iti
translated: And he will say: All that is good is the body of Hari.

original: etad uktaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: etat uktam bhavati
translated: This is what is said.

original: asyāvyayasyāpi parasya brahmaṇo viṣṇor viśvaśarīratayā tādātmyaviruddham ity ātmaśarīrayoś ca svabhāvā vyavasthitā eva /
analyzed: asya avyayasya api parasya brahmaṇaḥ viṣṇoḥ viśva śarīra tayā tādātmya viruddham iti ātma śarīrayoḥ ca svabhāvāḥ vyavasthitāḥ eva
translated: Even of this imperishable supreme Brahman, Vishnu, as the body of the universe, there is no contradiction of identity. And the natures of the self and the body are indeed established.

original: evaṃbhūtasya sarveśvarasya viṣṇoḥ prapañcāntarbhūtaniyāmyakoṭiniviṣṭabrahmādidevatiryaṅmanuṣyeṣu tat tat samāśrayaṇīyatvāya svecchāvatāraḥ
analyzed: evaṃbhūtasya sarveśvarasya viṣṇoḥ prapañca antarbhūta niyāmya koṭi niviṣṭa brahma ādi deva tiryak manuṣyeṣu tat tat samāśrayaṇīya tvāya sva icchā avatāraḥ
translated: Thus, the incarnation of Vishnu, the Lord of all, in the form of Brahma and other gods, animals and humans, who are included in the universe and are subject to the highest limit, is for the purpose of being resorted to by them, according to their own will.

original: tad etad brahmādīnāṃ bhāvanātrayānvayena karmavaśyatvaṃ bhagavataḥ parabrahmabhūtasya
analyzed: tat etat brahma ādīnām bhāvanā traya anvayena karma vaśya tvam bhagavataḥ para brahma bhūtasya
translated: This is clearly stated in the sixty-fourth chapter on the auspicious abode, that Brahma and others are subject to karma by being connected with the three kinds of thoughts, and that the incarnation of the Lord, who is the supreme Brahman,

original: vāsudevasya nikhilajagadupakārāya svecchayā svenaiva rūpeṇa devādiṣv avatāra iti🔽ca ṣaṣṭe 'ṃśe śubhāśrayaprakaraṇe suvyaktam uktam /
analyzed: vāsudevasya nikhila jagat upakārāya sva icchayā svena eva rūpeṇa deva ādiṣu avatāraḥ iti  ca ṣaṣṭe ṃśe śubha āśraya prakaraṇe su vyaktam uktam
translated: Vasudeva, in the form of gods and others, is for the sake of helping the entire world, according to His own will.🔽In His incarnations in the form of gods and others, He does not have a natural body. This is stated in the Mahabharata:

original: asya devādirūpeṇāvatāreṣv api na prākṛto deha iti mahābhārate na bhūtasaṃghasaṃsthāno deho 'sya paramātmanaḥ /
analyzed: asya deva ādi rūpeṇa avatāreṣu api na prākṛtaḥ dehaḥ iti mahābhārate na bhūta saṃgha saṃsthānaḥ paramātmanaḥ
translated: The body of the supreme Self is not composed of a collection of elements.

original: iti pratipāditaḥ /
analyzed: iti pratipāditaḥ
translated: This is what is taught.

original: śrutibhiś ca ajāyamāno bahudhā vijāyate tasya dhīrāḥ parijānanti yonim iti /
analyzed: śrutibhiḥ ca a jāyamānaḥ bahudhā vijāyate tasya dhīrāḥ parijānanti yonim iti
translated: And by the Vedic texts: Though unborn, He appears to be born in many ways. The wise know His source.

original: karmavaśyānāṃ brahmādīnām anicchatām api tattatkarmānuguṇaprakṛtipariṇāmarūpabhūtasaṃghasaṃsthānaviśeṣadevādiśarīrapraveśarūpaṃ janmāvarjanīyam
analyzed: karma vaśyānām brahma ādīnām an icchatām api tad tad karma anuguṇa prakṛti pariṇāma rūpa bhūta saṃgha saṃsthāna viśeṣa deva ādi śarīra praveśa rūpam janma avarjanīyam
translated: For Brahma and others, who are subject to karma, even those who do not desire it, birth in the form of entering the bodies of gods and others, which are the specific arrangements of the collection of elements that arise from the transformation of prakriti in accordance with their respective karma, is unavoidable.

original: ayaṃ tu sarveśvaraḥ satyasaṃkalpo bhagavān evaṃbhūtaśubhetarajanmākurvann api svecchayā svenaiva niratiśayakalyāṇarūpeṇa devādiṣu jagadupakārāya
analyzed: ayam tu sarveśvaraḥ satya saṃkalpaḥ bhagavān evaṃbhūta śubha itara janma a kurvan api sva icchayā svena eva niratiśaya kalyāṇa rūpeṇa deva ādiṣu jagat upakārāya
translated: But this Lord, the Supreme God, whose resolve is true, even though not performing such auspicious and inauspicious births, by His own will, in His own form of unsurpassed goodness, for the benefit of the world among gods and others,

original: bahudhā jāyate /
analyzed: bahudhā jāyate
translated: is born in many ways.

original: tasyaitasya śubhetarajanmākurvato 'pi svakalyāṇaguṇānantyena bahudhā yoniṃ bahuvidhajanma dhīrādhīramatām agresarā jānantītyarthaḥ /
analyzed: tasya etasya śubha itara janma a kurvataḥ sva kalyāṇa guṇa ānantyena bahudhā yonim bahuvidha janma dhīra adhīra matām agresarāḥ jānanti iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the wise, who are at the forefront of the minds of the wise and the unwise, know His source, which is His many kinds of births, even though He does not perform such auspicious and inauspicious births, by the infinity of His own good qualities.

original: tadetannikhilajagannimittopādānabhūtāj janmādy asya yataḥ prakṛtiś ca pratijñādṛṣṭāntānuparodhādityādisūtraiḥ
analyzed: tat etat nikhila jagat nimitta upādāna bhūtāt janma ādi asya yatas prakṛtiḥ ca pratijñā dṛṣṭānta an uparodhāt ityādi sūtraiḥ
translated: This is stated in the sutras beginning with The birth, etc. of this (Lord), which is the cause and material cause of the entire world, is from His prakriti, because it is not contradicted by the proposition and the example, etc.

original: pratipāditāt parasmād brahmaṇaḥ paramapuruṣād anyasya kasyacit parataratvaṃ paramataḥ🔽setūn mānasaṃbandhabhedavyapadeśebhya ityāśaṅkya sāmānyāt tu buddhyarthaḥ pādavat
analyzed: pratipāditāt parasmāt brahmaṇaḥ paramapuruṣāt anyasya kasyacid paratara tvam paramatas  setūn māna saṃbandha bheda vyapadeśebhyaḥ iti āśaṅkya sāmānyāt tu buddhi arthaḥ pāda vat
translated: The highest state of something other than Brahman, the Supreme Person, is denied by the word 'paramat' (highest).🔽The doubt is raised that the highest state may belong to something other than Brahman, the Supreme Person, on the basis of the statements about the connection with the mind, the difference, and the designation. The answer is: But the meaning of the word is Brahman, because of the general statement, like the word 'foot'.

original: sthānaviśeṣāt prakāśādivat upapatteś ca tathānyapratiṣedhāt anena sarvagatatvamāyām
analyzed: sthāna viśeṣāt prakāśa ādi vat upapatteḥ ca tathā anya pratiṣedhāt anena sarvagata tva māyām
translated: The omnipresence of Brahman is established by the word 'adi' (etc.) in the sutra.

original: ādiśabdādibhya iti sūtrakāraḥ svayam eva nirākaroti /
analyzed: ādi śabda ādibhyaḥ iti sūtrakāraḥ svayam eva nirākaroti
translated: The author of the sutra himself refutes the doubts raised by the words 'adi' (etc.).

original: mānave ca śāstre
analyzed: mānave ca śāstre
translated: And in the Manava Shastra (Manu Smriti),

original: prādurāsīt tamonudaḥ sisṛkṣur vividhāḥ prajāḥ /
analyzed: prādurāsīt tamonudaḥ sisṛkṣuḥ vividhāḥ prajāḥ
translated: The dispeller of darkness appeared, desiring to create various beings.

original: apa eva sasarjādau tāsu vīryam apāsṛjat //
analyzed: apaḥ eva sasarja ādau tāsu vīryam apāsṛjat
translated: He created water first, and released his semen into it.

original: tasmiñ jajñe svayaṃ brahma
analyzed: tasmin jajñe svayam brahma
translated: From that, Brahman was born by itself.

original: iti brahmaṇo janmaśravaṇāt kṣetrajñatvam evāvagamyate /
analyzed: iti brahmaṇaḥ janma śravaṇāt kṣetrajña tvam eva avagamyate
translated: Thus, from the statement about the birth of Brahman, it is understood that it is a Kshetrajna (knower of the field).

original: tathā ca sraṣṭuḥ paramapuruṣasya tadvisṛṣṭasya ca brahmaṇaḥ
analyzed: tathā ca sraṣṭuḥ parama puruṣasya tad visṛṣṭasya ca brahmaṇaḥ
translated: And thus, of the Creator, the Supreme Person, and of Brahman, who was created by Him,

original: ayaṃ tasya tāḥ pūrvaṃ tena nārāyaṇaḥ smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: ayam tasya tāḥ pūrvam tena nārāyaṇaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: He is known as Narayana from the beginning.

original: tadvisṛṣṭaḥ sa puruṣo loke brahmeti kīrtyate //
analyzed: tad visṛṣṭaḥ sa puruṣaḥ loke brahma iti kīrtyate
translated: That person, created by Him, is known in the world as Brahman.

original: iti nāmanirdeśāc ca /
analyzed: iti nāma nirdeśāt ca
translated: And from the statement of the name.

original: tathā ca vaiṣṇave purāṇe hiraṇyagarbhādīnāṃ bhāvanātrayānvayād aśuddhatvena śubhāśrayatvānarhatopapādanāt kṣetrajñatvaṃ niścīyate /
analyzed: tathā ca vaiṣṇave purāṇe hiraṇyagarbha ādīnām bhāvanā traya anvayāt aśuddha tvena śubha āśraya tva anarha tā upapādanāt kṣetrajña tvam niścīyate  /
translated: And in the same way, in the Viṣṇu Purāṇa, it is ascertained that Hiraṇyagarbha and others are Kṣetrajñas, because they are not worthy of being the abode of the auspicious due to impurity, by establishing that they are endowed with the three kinds of thought.

original: yad api kaiścid uktam sarvasya śabdajātasya vidhyarthavādamantrarūpasya
analyzed: yat api kaiścid uktam sarvasya śabda jātasya vidhi artha vāda mantra rūpasya
translated: What is said by some, that the validity of the entire class of words, which is in the form of injunctions, explanatory passages, and mantras,

original: kāryābhidhāyitvenaiva prāmāṇyaṃ varṇanīyam /
analyzed: kārya abhidhāyi tvena eva prāmāṇyam varṇanīyam
translated: should be described only as the power to denote what is to be done,

original: vyavahārād anyatra śabdasya bodhakatvaśaktyavadhāraṇāsaṃbhavād vyavahārasya ca kāryabuddhimūlatvāt kāryarūpa eva śabdārthaḥ /
analyzed: vyavahārāt anyatra śabdasya bodhaka tva śakti avadhāraṇa asaṃbhavāt vyavahārasya ca kārya buddhi mūla tvāt kārya rūpaḥ eva śabda arthaḥ
translated: because it is not possible to determine the power of words to convey meaning apart from usage, and because usage is rooted in the cognition of what is to be done, the meaning of words is only in the form of what is to be done.

original: na pariniṣpanne vastuni śabdaḥ pramāṇam iti /
analyzed: na pariniṣpanne vastuni śabdaḥ pramāṇam iti
translated: Words are not a means of valid knowledge regarding an accomplished entity.

original: atrocyate /
analyzed: atra ucyate
translated: To this it is said:

original: pravartakavākyavyavahāra eva śabdānām arthabodhakatvaśaktyavadhāraṇaṃ kartavyam iti kim iyaṃ rājājñā /
analyzed: pravartaka vākya vyavahāre eva śabdānām artha bodhaka tva śakti avadhāraṇam kartavyam iti kim iyam rāja ājñā
translated: Is this a royal decree that the power of words to convey meaning should be determined only in the usage of instigating sentences?

original: siddhavastuṣu śabdasya bodhakatvaśaktigrahaṇam atyantasukaram /
analyzed: siddha vastuṣu śabdasya bodhaka tva śakti grahaṇam atyanta sukaram
translated: The apprehension of the power of words to convey meaning regarding accomplished entities is extremely easy.

original: tathā hi kenacid dhastaceṣṭādināpavarake daṇḍaḥ sthita iti devadattāya jñāpayeti preṣitaḥ kaścit tajjñāpane pravṛtto 'pavarake daṇḍaḥ sthita
analyzed: tathā hi kenacid hasta ceṣṭā ādinā apavarake daṇḍaḥ sthitaḥ iti devadattāya jñāpaya iti preṣitaḥ kaścid tad jñāpane pravṛttaḥ upavarake daṇḍaḥ sthita
translated: For example, someone is sent with the message, Instruct Devadatta that a stick is standing in the inner chamber by some movement of the hand, etc. That person, engaged in conveying that message, says, A stick is standing in the inner chamber.

original: iti śabdaṃ prayuṅkte /
analyzed: iti śabdam prayuṅkte
translated: For example, someone is sent with the instruction: Convey to Devadatta that a stick is standing in the inner chamber by some movement of the hand, etc. That one, engaged in conveying that, uses the expression: A stick is standing in the inner chamber.

original: mūkavad dhastaceṣṭām imāṃ jānan pārśvastho 'nyaḥ prāgvyutpanno 'pi tasyārthasya bodhanāyāpavarake
analyzed: mūka vat hasta ceṣṭām imām jānan pārśva sthaḥ tasya arthasya bodhanāya apavarake
translated: Like one who is dumb, knowing this movement of the hand, another standing nearby, though previously unacquainted, uses the expression: A stick is standing in the inner chamber,

original: daṇḍaḥ sthita ityasya śabdasya prayogadarśanād asyārthasyāyaṃ śabdo bodhaka iti jānātīti kim atra duṣkaram /🔽tathā bālas tāto 'yam iyaṃ mātāyaṃ mātulo 'yaṃ manuṣyo 'yaṃ mṛgaś candro 'yam ayaṃ
analyzed: daṇḍaḥ sthitaḥ iti asya śabdasya prayoga darśanāt asya arthasya ayam śabdaḥ bodhakaḥ iti jānāti iti kim atra duṣkaram  tathā bālaḥ tātaḥ yam iyam mātā ayam mātulaḥ yam manuṣyaḥ yam mṛgaḥ candraḥ yam ayam
translated: in order to convey the meaning of that. Seeing the use of this expression, A stick is standing in the inner chamber, how is it difficult to know that this word conveys this meaning?🔽Similarly, a child is gradually taught by his mother, father, etc., with the words: This is father, this is mother, this is uncle, this is a man, this is an animal, this is the moon, this

original: ca sarpa iti mātāpitṛprabhṛtibhiḥ śabdaiḥ śanaiḥ śanair aṅgulyā nirdeśane tatra tatra
analyzed: ca sarpaḥ iti mātā pitṛ prabhṛtibhiḥ śabdaiḥ śanais śanais aṅgulyā nirdeśane tatra tatra
translated: is a snake, pointing to each with his finger here and there.🔽Having seen the arising of his own understanding of those meanings through those very words,

original: bahuśaḥ śikṣitas tair eva śabdais teṣv artheṣu svātmanaś ca buddhyutpattiṃ dṛṣṭvā
analyzed: bahuśas śikṣitaḥ taiḥ eva śabdaiḥ teṣu artheṣu sva ātmanaḥ ca buddhi utpattim dṛṣṭvā
translated: he comes to know that this word conveys this meaning.

original: teṣv artheṣu teṣāṃ śabdānām aṅgulyā nirdeśapūrvakaḥ prayogaḥ sambandhāntarābhāvāt
analyzed: teṣu artheṣu teṣām śabdānām aṅgulyāḥ nirdeśa pūrvakaḥ prayogaḥ sambandha antara abhāvāt
translated: The application of those words to those meanings, preceded by the pointing with the finger, is due to the absence of any other relation,

original: saṃketayitṛpuruṣājñānāc ca bodhakatvanibandhana iti krameṇa niścitya punar apy asya
analyzed: saṃketayitṛ puruṣa ajñānāt ca bodhaka tva nibandhanaḥ iti krameṇa niścitya punar api asya
translated: and is based on the power to convey the meaning, due to the knowledge of the person who made the convention. Having thus ascertained the order, he again

original: śabdasyāyam artha iti pūrvavṛddhaiḥ śikṣitaḥ sarvaśabdānām artham avagamya svayam
analyzed: śabdasya ayam arthaḥ iti pūrva vṛddhaiḥ śikṣitaḥ sarva śabdānām artham avagamya svayam
translated: learns from the elders that this is the meaning of this word, and having understood the meaning of all words,

original: api sarvaṃ vākyajātaṃ prayuṅkte /
analyzed: api sarvam vākya jātam prayuṅkte
translated: he himself uses all sentences.

original: evam eva sarvapadānāṃ svārthābhidhāyitvaṃ saṃghātaviśeṣaṇāṃ ca yathāvasthitasaṃsargaviśeṣavācitvaṃ ca jānātīti kāryārthaiva vyuttipattir ityādinirbandho
analyzed: evam eva sarva padānām svārtha abhidhāyi tvam saṃghāta viśeṣaṇām ca yathā avasthita saṃsarga viśeṣa vāci tvam ca jānāti iti kārya arthā eva vyutti pattiḥ
translated: In the same way, he knows that all words express their own meanings and that the particular arrangement of words expresses the particular relation as it stands. Thus, the derivation of words is based solely on their function. This is the contention

original: nirbandhanaḥ /🔽ataḥ pariṣpannaḥ vastuni śabdasyabodhakatvaśaktyavadhāraṇāt sarvāṇi vedāntavākyāni sakalajagatkāraṇaṃ sarvakalyāṇaguṇākaramuktalakṣaṇaṃ brahma
analyzed: nirbandhanaḥ  atas pariṣpannaḥ vastuni śabdasya a bodhaka tva śakti avadhāraṇāt sarvāṇi vedānta vākyāni sakala jagat kāraṇam sarva kalyāṇa guṇa ākaram ukta lakṣaṇam brahma  /
translated: of the Naiyāyikas.🔽Therefore, the determination of the power of words to convey meaning in relation to objects, all the Vedānta passages

original: bodhayanty eva /
analyzed: bodhayanti eva
translated: only convey Brahman, which has the characteristics mentioned above, as the cause of the entire world and as the abode of all auspicious qualities.

original: api ca kāryārtha eva vyutpattir astu /
analyzed: api ca kārya arthe eva vyutpattiḥ astu
translated: Moreover, let the derivation of words be based solely on their function.

original: vedāndavākyāny apy upāsanaviṣayakāryādhikṛtaviśeṣaṇabhūtaphalatvena duḥkhāsaṃbhinnadeśaviśeṣarūpasvargādivad
analyzed: vedānda vākyāni api upāsana viṣaya kārya adhikṛta viśeṣaṇa bhūta phala tvena duḥkha asaṃbhinna deśa viśeṣa rūpa svarga ādi vat
translated: The Vedic sentences also, by way of the fruit which is a qualification of the object of meditation and the rite enjoined, like heaven etc., which are a particular place not mixed with pain,

original: rātrisatrapratiṣṭhānādivad apagoraṇaśatayātanāsādhyasādhanabhāvavac ca karyopayogitayaiva sarvaṃ bodhayanti /
analyzed: rātri satra pratiṣṭhāna ādi vat apagoraṇa śata yātanā sādhya sādhana bhāva vat ca karya upayogi tayā eva sarvam bodhayanti
translated: and like the establishment of the night-long sacrifice etc., which are the means of accomplishing the suffering of a hundred beatings, make everything understood only by its usefulness to the rite.

original: tathāhi brahmavid āpnoti param ityatra brahmopāsanaviṣayakāryādhikṛtaviśeṣaṇabhūtaphalatvena
analyzed: tathā hi brahma vid āpnoti param iti atra brahma upāsana viṣaya kārya adhikṛta viśeṣaṇa bhūta phalatvena
translated: Thus, in the sentence One who knows Brahman attains the highest, the attainment of Brahman is heard as the fruit which is a qualification of the object of Brahman meditation and the rite enjoined.

original: brahmaprāptiḥ śrūyate paraprāptikāmo brahma vidyād ityatra prāpyatayā pratīyamānaṃ
analyzed: brahma prāptiḥ śrūyate para prāpti kāmaḥ brahma vidyāt iti atra prāpya tayā pratīyamānam
translated: In the sentence One who desires to attain the highest should know Brahman, the nature of Brahman, which is understood as the object of attainment,

original: brahmasvarūpaṃ tadviśeṣaṇaṃ ca sarvaṃ kāryopayogitayaiva siddhaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: brahma svarūpam tad viśeṣaṇam ca sarvam kārya upayogi tayā eva siddham bhavati
translated: and all its qualifications are established only by their usefulness to the rite.

original: tadantargatam eva jagatsraṣṭṛtvaṃ saṃhartṛtvam ādhāratvam antarātmatvam ityādy uktam anuktaṃ ca sarvam iti na kiṃcid anupapannam /
analyzed: tad antargatam eva jagat sraṣṭṛ tvam saṃhartṛ tvam ādhāra tvam antarātma tvam ityādi uktam anuktam ca sarvam iti na kiṃcid anupapannam
translated: And all that is included in it, such as being the creator of the world, being the destroyer, being the support, being the inner self, and so on, whether mentioned or not, is not at all inconsistent.

original: evaṃ ca sati mantrārthavādagatā hy aviruddhā apūrvāś cārthāḥ sarve vidhiśeṣatayaiva siddhā bhavanti /
analyzed: evam ca sati mantra arthavāda gatāḥ hi a viruddhāḥ apūrvāḥ ca arthāḥ sarve vidhi śeṣa tayā eva siddhāḥ bhavanti
translated: And in this way, all the unseen meanings found in the mantra and arthavada texts, which are not inconsistent, are established as being only supplementary to the injunctions.

original: yathoktaṃ dramiḍabhāṣye ṛṇaṃ hi vai jāyata iti śruter ity upakramya yady apy avadānastutiparaṃ vākyaṃ tathāpi nāsatā stutir upapadyata iti
analyzed: yathā uktam dramiḍa bhāṣye ṛṇam hi vai jāyate iti śruteḥ iti upakramya yadi api avadāna stuti param vākyam tathā api na asatā stutiḥ upapadyate iti
translated: As it is said in the commentary on the Dramidopanishad, beginning with For it is heard that a debt is indeed born, and concluding, Although the sentence has the purpose of praising the oblation, still praise is not possible without reality.

original: etad uktaṃ bhavati sarvo hy arthavādabhāgo devatārādhanabhūtayāgādeḥ sāṅgasyārādhyadevatāyāś cādṛṣṭarūpān guṇān sahasraśo vadan sahasraśaḥ
analyzed: etat uktam bhavati sarvaḥ hi arthavāda bhāgaḥ devatā ārādhana bhūta yāga ādeḥ sa aṅgasya ārādhya devatāyāḥ ca adṛṣṭa rūpān guṇān sahasraśas vadan sahasraśas
translated: This is what is said: For all the part of explanatory passages, speaking of the unseen qualities of the worshipful sacrifice and so on with its auxiliaries, and of the deity to be worshipped, in thousands,

original: karmaṇi prāśastyabuddhim utpādayati /
analyzed: karmaṇi prāśastya buddhim utpādayati
translated: produces the idea of excellence in the rite.

original: teṣām asadbhāve prāśastyabuddhir eva na syād iti karmaṇi prāśastyabuddhyarthaṃ guṇasadbhāvam eva bodhayatīti /
analyzed: teṣām asadbhāve prāśastya buddhiḥ eva na syāt iti karmaṇi prāśastya buddhi artham guṇa sadbhāvam eva bodhayati iti
translated: If those [qualities] did not exist, there would not even be the idea of excellence, so it makes one understand the existence of the qualities itself for the purpose of producing the idea of excellence in the rite.

original: anayaiva diśā sarve mantrārthavādāvagatā arthāḥ siddhāḥ /
analyzed: anayā eva diśā sarve mantra arthavāda avagatāḥ arthāḥ siddhāḥ
translated: By this very direction, all the meanings understood from mantras and explanatory passages are established.

original: api ca kāryavākyārthavādibhiḥ kim idaṃ kāryatvaṃ nāmeti vaktavyam /
analyzed: api ca kārya vākya artha vādibhiḥ kim idam kārya tvam nāma iti vaktavyam
translated: Moreover, those who maintain that the meaning of a sentence is an effect should be asked: What is this so-called effectivity?

original: kṛtibhāvabhāvitā kṛtyuddeśyatā ceti cet /
analyzed: kṛti bhāva bhāvi tā kṛti uddeśya tā ca iti ced
translated: If they say: The state of being the object of an act and the state of being the aim of an act,

original: kim idaṃ kṛtyuddeśyatvam /
analyzed: kim idam kṛti uddeśya tvam
translated: what is this being the aim of an act?

original: yad adhikṛtya kṛtir vartate tat kṛtyuddeśyatvam iti cet /
analyzed: yat adhikṛtya kṛtiḥ vartate tat kṛti uddeśya tvam iti ced
translated: If they say: That with reference to which an act occurs, that is being the aim of an act,🔽then,

original: puruṣavyāpārarūpāyāḥ kṛteḥ ko 'yam adhikāro nāma /
analyzed: puruṣa vyāpāra rūpāyāḥ kṛteḥ kaḥ yam adhikāraḥ nāma
translated: What is this thing called the object of activity of the injunction?

original: yatprāptīcchayā kṛtim utpādayati puruṣaḥ tat kṛtyuddeśyatvam iti ced dhanta tarhīṣṭatvam eva kṛtyuddeśyatvam /
analyzed: yad prāpti icchayā kṛtim utpādayati puruṣaḥ tat kṛti uddeśya tvam iti ced hanta tarhi iṣṭa tvam eva kṛti uddeśya tvam
translated: If it is said that the object of activity of the injunction is that for the attainment of which a person produces the activity, then in that case the object of activity of the injunction is just the desired thing.

original: athaivaṃ manuṣe iṣṭasyaiva rūpadvayam asti /
analyzed: atha evam manuṣe iṣṭasya eva rūpa dvayam asti
translated: If it is accepted that the desired thing has two forms,

original: icchāviṣayatayā sthitiḥ puruṣaprerakatvaṃ ca /
analyzed: icchā viṣaya tayā sthitiḥ puruṣa preraka tvam ca
translated: namely, being the object of desire and being the instigator of the person,

original: tatra prerakatvākāraḥ kṛtyuddeśyatvam iti so 'yaṃ svapakṣābhiniveśakārito vṛthāśramaḥ /
analyzed: tatra preraka tva ākāraḥ kṛti uddeśya tvam iti saḥ yam sva pakṣa abhiniveśa kāritaḥ vṛthā śramaḥ
translated: then this exertion for the sake of one's own position is futile, since the form of being the instigator is just the object of activity of the injunction.

original: tathā hīcchāviṣayatayā pratītasya svaprayatnotpattim antareṇāsiddhir eva prerakatvam /
analyzed: tathā hi icchā viṣaya tayā pratītasya sva prayatna utpattim antareṇa asiddhiḥ eva preraka tvam
translated: For thus, the instigator is just the desired thing, which is not accomplished without the production of one's own effort, being the object of desire.

original: tata eva pravṛtteḥ /
analyzed: tatas eva pravṛtteḥ
translated: Because activity arises from that alone.

original: icchāyāṃ jātāyām iṣṭasya svaprayatnotpattim antareṇāsiddhiḥ pratīyate cet tataś cikīrṣā jāyate tataḥ pravartate puruṣa iti tattvavidāṃ prakriyā
analyzed: icchāyām jātāyām iṣṭasya sva prayatna utpattim antareṇa asiddhiḥ pratīyate ced tatas cikīrṣā jāyate tatas pravartate puruṣaḥ iti tattva vidām prakriyā
translated: If it is thought that when desire arises, the desired thing is perceived as not accomplished without the production of one's own effort, then from that there is the desire to accomplish, from that the person engages in activity - this is the procedure of those who know the truth.

original: tasmād iṣṭasya kṛtyadhīnātmalābhatvātireki kṛtyuddeśyatvaṃ nāma kim pi na dṛṣyate /
analyzed: tasmāt iṣṭasya kṛti adhīna ātmalābha tva atireki kṛti uddeśya tvam nāma kim na dṛṣyate
translated: Therefore, apart from the desired thing obtaining its existence through activity, nothing else called the object of activity of the injunction is seen.

original: athocyate iṣṭatāhetuś ca puruṣānukūlatā /
analyzed: athā ucyate iṣṭa tā hetuḥ ca puruṣa anukūla tā
translated: Now, if it is said that the cause of desirability is conformity with the person,

original: tatpuruṣānukūlatvaṃ kṛtyuddeśyatvam iti cet /
analyzed: tatpuruṣa anukūla tvam kṛti uddeśya tvam iti ced
translated: and that conformity with the person is the state of being the aim of action,

original: naivam /
analyzed: na evam
translated: it is not so.

original: puruṣānukūlaṃ sukham ity anarthāntaram /
analyzed: puruṣa anukūlam sukham iti anarthāntaram
translated: That which is desirable is not a synonym for pleasure.

original: tathā puruṣānukūlaṃ duḥkhaparyāyam /
analyzed: tathā puruṣa anukūlam duḥkha paryāyam
translated: Similarly, that which is undesirable is a synonym for pain.

original: ataḥ sukhavyatiriktasya kasyāpi puruṣānukūlatvaṃ na saṃbhavati /
analyzed: atas sukha vyatiriktasya kasya api puruṣa anukūla tvam na saṃbhavati
translated: Therefore, nothing other than pleasure can be desirable for a person.

original: nanu ca duḥkhanivṛtter api sukhavyatiriktāyāḥ puruṣānukūlatā dṛṣṭā /
analyzed: nanu ca duḥkha nivṛtteḥ api sukha vyatiriktāyāḥ puruṣa anukūla tā dṛṣṭā
translated: But isn't the cessation of pain also seen to be desirable for a person, even though it is not pleasure?

original: naitat /
analyzed: na etat
translated: No, that is not so.

original: ātmānukūlaṃ sukham ātmapratikūlaṃ duḥkham iti hi sukhaduḥkhayor vivekaḥ /
analyzed: ātma anukūlam sukham ātma pratikūlam duḥkham iti hi sukha duḥkhayoḥ vivekaḥ
translated: For the distinction between pleasure and pain is that pleasure is what is favorable to the self and pain is what is unfavorable to the self.

original: tatrātmānukūlaṃ sukham iṣṭaṃ bhavati /🔽tatpratikūlaṃ duḥkhaṃ cāniṣṭam /
analyzed: tatra ātma anukūlam sukham iṣṭam bhavati  tad pratikūlam duḥkham ca aniṣṭam
translated: Among them, that which is favorable to the self, i.e., pleasure, is desired.🔽That which is unfavorable to it, i.e., pain, is not desired.

original: ato duḥkhasaṃyogasyāsahyatayā tannivṛttir apīṣṭā bhavati /
analyzed: atas duḥkha saṃyogasya asahya tayā tad nivṛttiḥ api iṣṭā bhavati
translated: Therefore, the cessation of pain is also desired because of the unbearable nature of association with pain.

original: tata eveṣṭatāsāmyād anukūlatābhramaḥ /
analyzed: tatas evā iṣṭa tā sāmyāt anukūla tā bhramaḥ
translated: From that itself, there is a delusion of conformity due to the similarity of desirability.

original: tathā hi prakṛtisaṃsṛṣṭasya saṃsāriṇaḥ puruṣasyānukūlasaṃyogaḥ pratikūlasaṃyogaḥ svarūpeṇāvasthitir iti ca tisro 'vasthāḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi prakṛti saṃsṛṣṭasya saṃsāriṇaḥ puruṣasya anukūla saṃyogaḥ pratikūla saṃyogaḥ sva rūpeṇa avasthitiḥ iti ca tisraḥ vasthāḥ
translated: For thus, for the person who is engaged in worldly existence due to primordial nature, there are three states: association with what is favorable, association with what is unfavorable, and remaining in one's own nature.

original: tatra pratikūlasaṃbandhanivṛttiś cānukūlasaṃbandhanivṛttiś ca svarūpeṇāvasthitir eva /
analyzed: tatra pratikūla saṃbandha nivṛttiḥ ca anukūla saṃbandha nivṛttiḥ ca sva rūpeṇa avasthitiḥ eva
translated: Of these, the cessation of the relation of opposition and the cessation of the relation of conformity are nothing but the persistence of the form itself.

original: tasmāt pratikūlasaṃyoge vartamāne tannivṛttirūpā svarūpeṇāvasthitir apīṣṭā bhavati /
analyzed: tasmāt pratikūla saṃyoge vartamāne tad nivṛtti rūpā sva rūpeṇa avasthitiḥ api iṣṭā bhavati
translated: Therefore, even when there is a conjunction of opposition, the persistence of the form in the form of the cessation of that is desired.

original: tatreṣṭatāsāmyād anukūlatābhramaḥ /
analyzed: tatra iṣṭa tā sāmyāt anukūla tā bhramaḥ
translated: There, due to the similarity of being desired, there is a delusion of conformity.

original: ataḥ sukharūpatvād anukūlatāyāḥ niyogasyānukūlatāṃ vadantaṃ prāmāṇikāḥ parihasanti /
analyzed: atas sukha rūpa tvāt anukūla tāyāḥ niyogasya anukūla tām vadantam prāmāṇikāḥ parihasanti
translated: Therefore, because conformity is of the nature of pleasure, the authoritative ones ridicule the injunction which speaks of conformity.

original: iṣṭasyārthaviśeṣasya nivartakatayaiva hi niyogasya niyogatvaṃ sthiratvam apūrvatvaṃ ca pratīyate /
analyzed: iṣṭasya artha viśeṣasya nivartaka tayā eva hi niyogasya niyoga tvam sthira tvam apūrva tvam ca pratīyate
translated: For the nature of an injunction, its stability and novelty are understood only through its causing the cessation of a desired particular object.

original: svargakāmo yajetety atra kāryasya kriyātiriktā svargakāmapadasamabhivyāhāreṇa svargasādhanatvaniścayād eva bhavanti /
analyzed: svarga kāmaḥ yajeta iti atra kāryasya kriyā atiriktā svarga kāma pada samabhivyāhāreṇa svarga sādhanatva niścayāt eva bhavanti
translated: In the case of one who desires heaven should sacrifice, they arise only from the ascertainment of heaven as the means, by the co-occurrence of the word one who desires heaven with the action other than the action to be performed.

original: na ca vācyaṃ yajetety atra prathamaṃ niyogaḥ svapradhānatayaiva pratīyate svargakāmapadasamabhivyāhārāt svasiddhaye svargasiddhyanukūlatā ca
analyzed: na ca vācyam yajeta iti atra prathamam niyogaḥ sva pradhāna tayā eva pratīyate svarga kāma pada samabhivyāhārāt sva siddhaye svarga siddhi anukūla tā ca
translated: And it should not be said that in one should sacrifice, the injunction is first understood as the principal itself by the co-occurrence of the word one who desires heaven, and the conformity of the injunction to the accomplishment of heaven for its own accomplishment

original: niyogasyeti /
analyzed: niyogasya iti
translated: is understood.

original: yajeteti hi dhātvarthasya puruṣaprayatnasādhyatā pratīyate /
analyzed: yajeta iti hi dhātvarthasya puruṣa prayatna sādhya tā pratīyate
translated: For the meaning of the verbal root is understood to be accomplished by human effort.

original: svargakāmapadasamabhivyāhārād eva dhātvarthātirekiṇo niyogatvaṃ sthiratvam apūrvatvaṃ cetyādi /
analyzed: svarga kāma pada samabhivyāhārāt eva dhātvartha atirekiṇaḥ niyoga tvam sthira tvam apūrva tvam ca ityādi
translated: By the mere combination with the word 'desiring heaven', the nature of injunction, permanence, and novelty, etc., which are beyond the meaning of the verbal root, are understood.

original: tac ca svargasādhanatvapratītinibandhanam /
analyzed: tat ca svarga sādhanatva pratīti nibandhanam
translated: And that is based on the understanding of being the means to attaining heaven.

original: samabhivyāhṛtasvargakāmapadārthānvayayogyaṃ svargasādhanam eva kāryaṃ liṅādayo 'bhidadhatīti lokavyutpattir api tiraskṛtā /
analyzed: samabhivyāhṛta svarga kāma padārtha anvaya yogyam svarga sādhanam eva kāryam liṅ ādayaḥ bhidadhati iti loka vyutpattiḥ api tiraskṛtā
translated: The optative suffix, etc., express only the means to attaining heaven, which is suitable to be connected with the meaning of the word 'desiring heaven' that is combined with it. Thus, even the understanding of the world is set aside.

original: etad uktaṃ bhavati samabhivyahṛtapadāntaravācyārthānvayayogyam evetarapadapratipādyam ityanvitābhidhāyipadasaṃghātarūpavākyaśravaṇasaman antaram
analyzed: etat uktam bhavati antaram
translated: This is what is said: Only that which is suitable to be connected with the meaning expressed by the other words that are combined with it is to be conveyed by the other words. Immediately upon hearing the sentence, which is a collection of words that express the connected meaning,

original: eva pratīyate /
analyzed: eva pratīyate
translated: it is understood.

original: tac ca svargasādhanarūpam /
analyzed: tat ca svarga sādhana rūpam
translated: And that is of the nature of being the means to attaining heaven.

original: ataḥ kriyāvad ananyārthatāpi virodhād eva parityakteti /
analyzed: atas kriyā vat ananyārthatā api virodhāt eva parityaktā iti
translated: Therefore, the non-different meaning of the optative suffix, like the meaning of the verbal root, is also abandoned due to contradiction itself.

original: ata eva gaṅgāyāṃ ghoṣa ityādau ghoṣaprativāsayogyārthopasthāpanaparatvaṃ gaṅgāpadasyāśrīyate /
analyzed: atas eva gaṅgāyām ghoṣaḥ ityādau ghoṣa prativāsa yogya artha upasthāpana para tvam gaṅgā padasya āśrīyate
translated: For this very reason, in expressions like 'the hermitage on the Ganges', it is accepted that the word 'Ganges' has the purpose of presenting the meaning that is suitable to be the abode of the hermitage.

original: prathamaṃ gaṅgāpadena gaṅgārthaḥ smṛta iti gaṅgāpadārthasya peyatvaṃ na vākyārthānvayībhavati /
analyzed: prathamam gaṅgā padena gaṅgā arthaḥ smṛtaḥ iti gaṅgā pada arthasya peya tvam na vākya artha anvayībhavati
translated: First, the meaning of the word 'Gaṅgā' is remembered as the water of the Gaṅgā, so the drinkability of the meaning of the word 'Gaṅgā' does not become connected with the meaning of the sentence.

original: evam atra api yajetetyetāvanmātraśravaṇe kāryam ananyārthaṃ smṛtam iti vākyārthānvayasamaye kāryasyānanyārthatā nāvatiṣṭhate /
analyzed: evam atra api yajeta iti etāvat mātra śravaṇe kāryam ananya artham smṛtam iti vākya artha anvaya samaye kāryasya ananya artha tā na avatiṣṭhate
translated: Similarly, here also, when only 'one should sacrifice' is heard, the meaning of the word 'sacrifice' is remembered as not having any other meaning, so at the time of connecting with the meaning of the sentence, the fact that the meaning of the word 'sacrifice' is not having any other meaning does not hold.

original: kāryābhidhāyipadaśravaṇavelāyāṃ prathamaṃ kāryam ananyārthaṃ pratītam ity etad api na saṃgacchate /
analyzed: kārya abhidhāyi pada śravaṇa velāyām prathamam kāryam ananya artham pratītam iti etat api na saṃgacchate
translated: The statement that 'when the word expressing the meaning of the word 'sacrifice' is heard, the meaning of the word 'sacrifice' is first understood as not having any other meaning' also does not make sense.

original: vyutpattikāle gavānayanādikriyāyā duḥkharūpāyā iṣṭaviśeṣasādhanatayaiva kāryatāpratīteḥ /
analyzed: vyutpatti kāle gavānayana ādi kriyāyāḥ duḥkha rūpāyāḥ iṣṭa viśeṣa sādhanatayā eva kāryatā pratīteḥ
translated: Because at the time of learning, the meaning of the word 'sacrifice' is understood as the means of accomplishing a particular desirable thing, in the case of actions like bringing the cow, which are of the nature of suffering.

original: ato niyogasya puruṣānukūlatvaṃ sarvalokaviruddhaṃ niyogasya sukharūpapuruṣānukūlatāṃ vadataḥ svānubhavavirodhaś ca /
analyzed: atas niyogasya puruṣa anukūla tvam sarva loka viruddham niyogasya sukha rūpa puruṣa anukūla tām vadataḥ sva anubhava virodhaḥ ca
translated: Therefore, the fact that the injunction is favorable to the person, which is contrary to the opinion of all people, and the contradiction of one's own experience for one who says that the injunction is favorable to the person in the form of happiness,

original: karīryā vṛṣṭikāmo yajeytetyādiṣu siddhe 'pi niyoge vṛṣṭyādisiddhinimittasya vṛṣṭivyatirekeṇa niyogasyānukūlatā
analyzed: karīryā vṛṣṭi kāmaḥ yajeyta ityādiṣu siddhe niyoge vṛṣṭi ādi siddhi nimittasya vṛṣṭi vyatirekeṇa niyogasya anukūla tā
translated: In cases like 'one desiring rain should sacrifice with the Karīrī', even though the injunction is established, the favorableness of the injunction to the accomplishment of rain etc., apart from rain etc.,

original: nānubhūyate /
analyzed: na anubhūyate
translated: is not experienced.

original: yady apy asmiñ janmani vṛṣṭyādisiddher aniyamas tathāpy aniyamād eva niyogasiddhir avaśyāśrayaṇīyā /
analyzed: yadi api asmin janmani vṛṣṭi ādi siddheḥ aniyamaḥ tathā api aniyamāt eva niyoga siddhiḥ avaśya āśrayaṇīyā
translated: Even though in this life there is no rule because of the establishment of rain etc., still the establishment of the rule must necessarily be relied upon because of the very absence of rule.

original: tasminn anukūlatāparyāyasukhānubhūtir na dṛśyate /
analyzed: tasmin anukūla tā paryāya sukha anubhūtiḥ na dṛśyate
translated: The experience of pleasure, which is synonymous with favorableness, is not seen in that.

original: evam uktarītyā kṛtisādhyeṣṭatvātireki kṛtyuddeśyatvaṃ na dṛśyate /
analyzed: evam ukta rītyā kṛti sādhya iṣṭatva atireki kṛti uddeśya tvam na dṛśyate
translated: In the same way, as stated, the being the object of an action which is in excess of being the desirable which is to be accomplished by an action is not seen.

original: kṛtiṃ prati śeṣitvaṃ kṛtyuddeśyatvam iti cet /
analyzed: kṛtim prati śeṣi tvam kṛti uddeśya tvam iti ced
translated: If it is said that being the object of an action is being subordinate to the action,

original: kim idaṃ śeṣitvaṃ kiṃ ca śeṣatvam iti vaktavyam /
analyzed: kim idam śeṣi tvam kim ca śeṣa tvam iti vaktavyam
translated: it must be stated what this subordination is and what the subordinate is.

original: kāryaṃ prati saṃbandhī śeṣaḥ /
analyzed: kāryam prati saṃbandhī śeṣaḥ
translated: The subordinate is that which is related to the effect.

original: tatpratisaṃbandhitvaṃ śeṣitvam iti cet /
analyzed: tad pratisaṃbandhi tvam śeṣi tvam iti ced
translated: If it is said that subordination is the state of being related to that,

original: evaṃ tarhi kāryatvam eva śeṣitvam ity uktaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: evam tarhi kārya tvam eva śeṣi tvam iti uktam bhavati
translated: then in that case it is said that being subordinate is just being an effect.

original: kāryatvam eva vicāryate /
analyzed: kārya tvam eva vicāryate
translated: Being an effect is being subordinate.

original: paroddeśapravṛttakṛtivyāptyarhatvam śeṣatvam iti cet /
analyzed: para uddeśa pravṛtta kṛti vyāpti arha tvam śeṣa tvam iti ced
translated: If it is said that being subordinate is the state of being fit to be pervaded by an action which is engaged for the sake of another,

original: ko 'yaṃ paroddeśo nāmeti /
analyzed: kaḥ yam para uddeśaḥ nāma iti
translated: what is this so-called other's purpose?

original: ayam eva hi vicāryate /
analyzed: ayam eva hi vicāryate
translated: This very thing is being considered.

original: uddeśyatvaṃ nāmepsitatvasādhyatvam iti cet /
analyzed: uddeśya tvam nāma īpsitatva sādhyatvam iti ced
translated: If it is said that being the object is being desired and being to be accomplished,

original: kim idam īpsitatvam /
analyzed: kim idam īpsita tvam
translated: what is this being desired?

original: kṛtiprayojanatvam iti cet puruṣasya kṛtyārambhaprayojanam eva hi kṛtiprayojanam /
analyzed: kṛti prayojana tvam iti ced puruṣasya kṛtya ārambha prayojanam eva hi kṛti prayojanam
translated: If it be said that the purpose of an act is the purpose of the operation, the purpose of an act is indeed the purpose of the operation of a man's activity.

original: sa cecchāviṣayaḥ kṛtyadhīnātmalābha iti pūrvokta eva /
analyzed: sa ca icchā viṣayaḥ kṛti adhīna ātmalābhaḥ iti pūrva uktaḥ eva
translated: And that is the object of desire, the attainment of which depends on action. So it is as stated before.

original: ayam eva hi sarvatra śeṣaśeṣibhāvaḥ /
analyzed: ayam eva hi sarvatra śeṣa śeṣi bhāvaḥ
translated: For this is the relation of subordinate and principal everywhere.

original: paragatātiśayādhānecchopādeyatvam eva yasya svarūpaṃ sa śeṣaḥ paraḥ śeṣī /
analyzed: para gata atiśaya ādhāna icchā upādeya tvam eva yasya svarūpam sa śeṣaḥ paraḥ śeṣī
translated: That which has as its nature the quality of being adopted by one who desires to bring about an excellence in another is subordinate; the other is the principal.

original: phalotpattīcchayā yāgādes tatprayatnasya copādeyatvaṃ yāgādisiddhīcchayānyat sarvam upādeyam /
analyzed: phala utpatti icchayā yāga ādeḥ tad prayatnasya ca upādeya tvam yāga ādi siddhi icchayā anyat sarvam upādeyam
translated: The sacrifice, etc., and the effort for that are to be adopted by one who desires the production of the result. Everything else is to be adopted by one who desires the accomplishment of the sacrifice, etc.

original: evaṃ garbhadāsādīnām api puruṣaviśeṣātiśayādhānopādeyatvam eva svarūpam /🔽evam īśvaragatātiśayādhānecchayopādeyatvam eva cetanācetanātmakasya nityasyānityasya🔽ca sarvasya vastunaḥ svarūpam iti sarvam īśvaraśeṣatvam eva sarvasya ceśvaraḥ śeṣīti
analyzed: evam garbha dāsa ādīnām api puruṣa viśeṣa atiśaya ādhāna upādeya tvam eva svarūpam  evam īśvara gata atiśaya ādhāna icchayā upādeya tvam eva cetana acetana ātmakasya nityasya anityasya  ca sarvasya vastunaḥ svarūpam iti sarvam īśvara śeṣa tvam eva sarvasya ca īśvaraḥ śeṣi iti
translated: In the same way, the nature of even a womb-born slave, etc., is the quality of being adopted by one who desires to bring about an excellence in a particular man.🔽In the same way, the nature of all things, whether eternal or non-eternal, consisting of conscious and unconscious entities, is the quality of being adopted by one who desires to bring about an excellence in God.🔽Thus everything is subordinate to God, and God is the principal of everything.

original: sarvasya vaśī sarvasyeśānaḥ patiṃ viśvasyetyādyuktam /
analyzed: sarvasya vaśī sarvasya īśānaḥ patim viśvasya ityādi uktam
translated: Therefore it is said that He is the Lord of all, the Master of all, the Lord of the universe, and so on.

original: kṛtisādhyaṃ pradhānaṃ yat tatkāryam abhidhīyata ity ayam arthaḥ śraddadhāneṣv eva śobhate /
analyzed: kṛti sādhyam pradhānam yat tat kāryam abhidhīyate iti ayam arthaḥ śraddadhāneṣu eva śobhate  /
translated: This meaning, namely, that what is to be accomplished by an action is called its effect, shines forth only among the faithful.

original: api ca svargakāmo yajetetyādiṣu lakāravācyakartṛviśeṣasamarpaṇaparāṇāṃ svargakāmādipadānāṃ niyojyaviśeṣasamarpaṇaparatvaṃ śabdānuśāsanaviruddhaṃ
analyzed: api ca svarga kāmaḥ yajeta ityādiṣu lakāra vācya kartṛ viśeṣa samarpaṇa parāṇām svarga kāma ādi padānām niyojya viśeṣa samarpaṇa para tvam śabda anuśāsana viruddham
translated: Moreover, in sentences like One desiring heaven should sacrifice, the words one desiring heaven etc., which are intended to convey the particular agent denoted by the optative ending, convey the particular person to be enjoined, which is contrary to the rules of grammar.

original: kenāvagamyate /🔽sādhyasvargaviśiṣṭasya svargasādhane kartṛtvānvayo na ghaṭata iti cet /
analyzed: kena avagamyate  sādhya svarga viśiṣṭasya svarga sādhane kartṛ tva anvayaḥ na ghaṭate iti ced
translated: How is this understood?🔽If it is argued that the connection of the person qualified by the desired heaven as the agent in the means of attaining heaven is not possible,

original: niyojyatvānvayo 'pi na ghaṭata iti hi svargasādhanatvaniścayaḥ /
analyzed: niyojya tva anvayaḥ api na ghaṭate iti hi svarga sādhanatva niścayaḥ
translated: then it is said that the ascertainment of being the means of attaining heaven is not possible even if the connection as the person to be enjoined is established.

original: sa tu śāstrasiddhe kartṛtvānvaye svargasādhanatvaniścayaḥ kriyate /
analyzed: sa tu śāstra siddhe kartṛ tva anvaye svarga sādhana tva niścayaḥ kriyate
translated: But that ascertainment of being the means of attaining heaven is made when the connection as the agent is established by the scriptures.🔽Just as when it is said One desiring to eat should go to Devadatta's house, the fact that going to Devadatta's house is the means of attaining eating is known even before it is heard,

original: yathā bhoktukāmo devadattagṛhaṃ gacched ityukte bhojanakāmasya devadattagṛhagamane kartṛtvaśravaṇād eva prāgajñātam api bhojanasādhanatvaṃ
analyzed: yathā bhoktu kāmaḥ devadatta gṛham gacchet iti ukte bhojana kāmasya devadatta gṛha gamane kartṛ tva śravaṇāt eva prāk ajñātam api bhojana sādhanatvam
translated: because the agent is heard to be one desiring to eat.

original: evam atrāpi bhavati /
analyzed: evam atra api bhavati
translated: In the same way, it happens here also.

original: na kriyāntaraṃ prati kartṛtayā śrutasya kriyāntare kartṛtvakalpanaṃ yuktam yajeteti hi yāgakartṛtayā śrutasya biddhau kartṛtvakalpanaṃ kriyate
analyzed: na kriyā antaram prati kartṛ tayā śrutasya kriyā antare kartṛ tva kalpanam yuktam yajeta iti hi yāga kartṛ tayā śrutasya biddhau kartṛ tva kalpanam kriyate
translated: It is not proper to assume the agency of what is mentioned as the agent in one action in another action. For the agency of Devadatta in cooking is assumed from the mention of his agency in the injunction to sacrifice.

original: buddheḥ kartṛtvakalpanam eva hi niyojyatvam / yathoktaṃ
analyzed: buddheḥ kartṛ tva kalpanam eva hi niyojya tvam yathā uktam
translated: For the assumption of Devadatta's agency in cooking is itself his being the person to be directed, as stated

original: niyojya sarvakāryaṃ yaḥ svakīyatvena budhyate /
analyzed: niyojya sarva kāryam yaḥ svakīya tvena budhyate
translated: He who is understood as his own in all actions to be performed by the person to be directed.

original: iti / yaṣṭṛtvānuguṇaṃ tadbodhṛtvam iti cet /
analyzed: iti yaṣṭṛ tva anuguṇam tad bodhṛ tvam iti ced
translated: If it is argued that his agency in cooking is in accordance with his agency in sacrificing,

original: devadattaḥ paced iti pāke kartṛtayā śrutasya devadattasya pākārthagamanaṃ pākānuguṇam iti gamane kartṛtvakalpanaṃ na yujyate / 🔽kiṃ ca liṅādiśabdavācyaṃ sthāyirūpaṃ kim ity apūrvam āśrīyate /
analyzed: devadattaḥ pacet iti pāke kartṛ tayā śrutasya devadattasya pāka artha gamanam pāka anuguṇam iti gamane kartṛ tva kalpanam na yujyate  / kim ca liṅ ādi śabda vācyam sthāyi rūpam kim iti apūrvam āśrīyate
translated: it is not proper to assume Devadatta's agency in going, from the mention of his agency in cooking in the injunction Devadatta should cook, as the going is in accordance with the cooking.🔽Moreover, what is denoted by the optative suffix etc. is assumed to be an unseen potency.

original: svargakāmapadasamabhivyāhārānupapatter iti cet /
analyzed: svarga kāma pada samabhivyāhāra anupapatteḥ iti ced
translated: If it is argued that this is because it is not possible to construe the word desiring heaven,

original: kātrānupapattiḥ /
analyzed: kā atra anupapattiḥ
translated: what is the impossibility here?

original: siṣādhayiṣitasvargo hi svargakāmaḥ /
analyzed: siṣādhayiṣita svargaḥ hi svarga kāmaḥ
translated: For one desiring heaven is one who desires to accomplish heaven, which is to be accomplished.

original: tasya svargakāmasya kālāntarabhāvisvargasiddhau kṣaṇabhaṅginī yāgādikriyā na samartheti cet /
analyzed: tasya svarga kāmasya kāla antara bhāvi svarga siddhau kṣaṇabhaṅginī yāga ādi kriyā na samarthā iti ced
translated: If it is argued that the momentary action such as sacrifice etc. is not capable of accomplishing heaven, which is to be accomplished at a later time, for one who desires heaven,🔽then it is replied:

original: anāghrātavedasiddhāntānām iyam anupapattiḥ /
analyzed: an āghrāta veda siddhāntānām iyam anupapattiḥ
translated: This is the impossibility for those who do not smell the Vedanta conclusions.

original: sarvaiḥ karmabhir ārādhitaḥ parameśvaro bhagavān nārāyaṇas tattadiṣṭaṃ phalaṃ dadātīti vedavido vadanti /
analyzed: sarvaiḥ karmabhiḥ ārādhitaḥ parameśvaraḥ bhagavān nārāyaṇaḥ tad tad iṣṭam phalam dadāti iti veda vidaḥ vadanti
translated: The wise who know the Vedas say that Lord Narayana, the Supreme God, who is worshipped by all actions, grants the desired fruits.

original: yathāhur vedavidagresarā dramiḍācāryāḥ phalasaṃbibhatsayā hi karmabhir ātmānaṃ piprīṣanti sa prīto 'laṃ phalāyeti śāstramaryādā iti /
analyzed: yathā āhuḥ veda vid agresarāḥ dramiḍa ācāryāḥ phala saṃbibhatsayā hi karmabhiḥ ātmānam piprīṣanti sa prītaḥ laṃ phalāya iti śāstra maryādā iti
translated: As the Dramila teachers, who are at the forefront of those who know the Vedas, say: People desire to please themselves with actions out of a desire for the connection with fruits. He, being pleased, is enough for the fruits. This is the limit of the scriptures.

original: phalasaṃbandhecchayā karmabhir yāgadānahomādibhir indriyādidevatāmukhena tattadantaryāmirūpeṇāvasthitam indrādiśabdavācyaṃ paramātmānaṃ bhagavantaṃ
analyzed: phala saṃbandha icchayā karmabhiḥ yāga dāna homa ādibhiḥ indriya ādi devatā mukhena tad tad antaryāmi rūpeṇa avasthitam indra ādi śabda vācyam paramātmānam bhagavantam
translated: With a desire for the connection with fruits, they worship the Supreme Self, called Vāsudeva, who is present in the form of the inner controller of each deity such as Indra, through the doors of the senses such as Indra, etc., by actions such as sacrifices, gifts, oblations, etc.

original: vāsudevam ārirādhayiṣanti /
analyzed: vāsudevam ārirādhayiṣanti
translated: They desire to worship Lord Vāsudeva.

original: sa hi karmabhir ārādhitas teṣām iṣṭāni phalāni prayacchatītyarthaḥ /
analyzed: sa hi karmabhiḥ ārādhitaḥ teṣām iṣṭāni phalāni prayacchati iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that he, being worshipped by actions, grants the desired fruits to them.

original: tathā ca śrutiḥ iṣṭāpūrtaṃ bahudhā jātaṃ jāyamānaṃ viśvaṃ bibharti bhuvanasya nābhir iti /
analyzed: tathā ca śrutiḥ iṣṭāpūrtam bahudhā jātam jāyamānam viśvam bibharti bhuvanasya nābhiḥ iti
translated: And thus the Śruti says: The many kinds of sacrifices and good works, being born, support the universe, the navel of the world.

original: iṣṭāpūrtam iti sakalaśrutismṛticoditaṃ karmocyate /
analyzed: iṣṭāpūrtam iti sakala śruti smṛti coditam karma ucyate
translated: Sacrifices and good works refers to the actions enjoined by all the Vedas and Smṛtis.

original: tadviśvaṃ bibharti indrāgnivaruṇādisarvadevatāsaṃbandhitayā pratīyamānaṃ tattadantarātmatayāvasthitaḥ paramapuruṣaḥ svayam eva bibharti svayam
analyzed: tat viśvam bibharti indra agni varuṇa ādi sarva devatā saṃbandhi tayā pratīyamānam tat tat antarātma tayā avasthitaḥ paramapuruṣaḥ svayam eva bibharti svayam
translated: That universe, which is perceived as connected with all deities such as Indra, Agni, Varuna, etc., is sustained by the Supreme Person Himself, abiding as the inner Self of each of them. He Himself

original: eva svīkaroti /
analyzed: eva svīkaroti
translated: accepts it.

original: bhuvanasya nābhiḥ brahmakṣatrādisarvavarṇapūrṇasya bhuvanasya dhārakaḥ tais taiḥ karmabhir ārādhitas tattadiṣṭaphalapradānena bhuvanānāṃ dhāraka
analyzed: bhuvanasya nābhiḥ brahma kṣatra ādi sarva varṇa pūrṇasya bhuvanasya dhārakaḥ taiḥ taiḥ karmabhiḥ ārādhitaḥ tad tad iṣṭa phala pradānena bhuvanānām dhāraka
translated: The navel of the universe, the sustainer of the universe filled with all castes such as Brahmins, Kshatriyas, etc., is worshipped by those duties, and by granting the desired fruits, He is the sustainer of the worlds.

original: iti nābhir ityuktaḥ /
analyzed: iti nābhiḥ iti uktaḥ
translated: Therefore, He is called the navel.

original: agnivāyuprabhṛtidevatāntarātmatayā tattacchabdābhidheyo 'yam evety āha tad evāgnis tadvāyus tatsūryas tad u candramā iti /
analyzed: agni vāyu prabhṛti devatā antarātma tayā tad tad śabda abhidheyaḥ yam eva iti āha tat eva agniḥ tat vāyuḥ tat sūryaḥ tat u candramāḥ iti
translated: He Himself is the deity in the form of Agni, Vayu, etc., and is denoted by those words. Thus it is said: That is Agni, that is Vayu, that is Surya, and that is the moon.

original: yathoktaṃ bhagavatā
analyzed: yathā uktam bhagavatā
translated: As it is said by the Lord:

original: yo yo yām yāṃ tanuṃ bhaktaḥ śraddhayārcitum icchati /
analyzed: yaḥ yaḥ yām yām tanum bhaktaḥ śraddhayā arcitum icchati
translated: Whatever form a devotee wishes to worship with faith,

original: tasya tasyācalāṃ śraddhāṃ tām eva vidadhāmy aham //
analyzed: tasya tasya acalām śraddhām tām eva vidadhāmi aham
translated: I ordain that very unshakable faith of his.

original: sa tasya śraddhayā yuktas tasyārādhanam īhate /
analyzed: sa tasya śraddhayā yuktaḥ tasya ārādhanam īhate
translated: Endowed with that faith, he strives to propitiate that (form).

original: labhate ca tataḥ kāmān mayaiva vihitān iha tān // iti /
analyzed: labhate ca tatas kāmān mayā eva vihitān iha tān  iti
translated: And he obtains from that the desired objects ordained by Me here.

original: yāṃ yāṃ tanum itīndrādidevatāviśeṣās tattadantaryāmitayāvasthitasya bhagavatas tanavaḥ śarīrāṇītyarthaḥ /
analyzed: yām yām tanum iti indra ādi devatā viśeṣāḥ tad tad antaryāmi tayā avasthitasya bhagavataḥ tanavaḥ śarīrāṇi iti arthaḥ
translated: The various bodies, meaning that the Lord, who abides as the inner controller of specific deities like Indra, etc., has those as His bodies, i.e., as His physical forms.

original: ahaṃ hi sarvayajñānāṃ bhoktā ca prabhur eva ca /
analyzed: aham hi sarva yajñānām bhoktā ca prabhuḥ eva ca
translated: For I am the enjoyer and also the Lord of all sacrifices.

original: ityādi / prabhur eva ceti sarvaphalānāṃ pradātā cetyarthaḥ / yathā ca
analyzed: ityādi prabhuḥ eva ca iti sarva phalānām pradātā ca iti arthaḥ yathā ca
translated: And so on. The meaning of and also the Lord is that He is also the giver of all fruits. And as it is said:

original: yajñais tvam ijyase nityaṃ sarvadevamayācyuta /
analyzed: yajñaiḥ tvam ijyase nityam sarva deva maya acyuta
translated: You are always worshipped through sacrifices, O Achyuta, who are the essence of all gods.

original: yaiḥ svadharmaparair nātha narair ādādhito bhavān /
analyzed: yaiḥ svadharma paraiḥ nātha naraiḥ ādādhitaḥ bhavān
translated: O Lord, those men who, devoted to their own duties, have worshipped You,

original: te taranty akhilām etāṃ mayām ātmavimuktaye //
analyzed: te taranti akhilām etām mayām ātma vimuktaye
translated: they cross over this entire world of the ego for the liberation of the self.

original: iti / setihāsapurāṇeṣu sarveṣv eva vedeṣu sarvāṇi karmāṇi sarveśvarārādhanarūpāṇi /
analyzed: iti sa itihāsa purāṇeṣu sarveṣu eva vedeṣu sarvāṇi karmāṇi sarva īśvara ārādhana rūpāṇi
translated: Thus, in all the Vedas along with the Itihasas and Puranas, all actions are of the nature of propitiating the Supreme Lord.

original: tais taiḥ karmabhir ārādhitaḥ puruṣottamas tattadiṣṭaṃ phalaṃ dadātīti tatra tatra prapañcitam /
analyzed: taiḥ taiḥ karmabhiḥ ārādhitaḥ puruṣottamaḥ tad tad iṣṭam phalam dadāti iti tatra tatra prapañcitam
translated: The Supreme Person, propitiated by those various actions, grants the desired fruits. This is elaborated in various places.

original: evam hi sarvaśaktiṃ sarvajñaṃ sarveśvaraṃ bhagavantam indrādidevatāntaryāmirūpeṇa yāgadānahomādivedoditasarvakarmaṇāṃ bhoktāraṃ sarvaphalānāṃ
analyzed: evam hi sarva śaktim sarvajñam sarva īśvaram bhagavantam indra ādi devatā antaryāmi rūpeṇa yāga dāna homa ādi veda udita sarva karmaṇām bhoktāram sarva phalānām
translated: For it is thus that the all-powerful, omniscient, and supreme Lord, as the inner controller of deities like Indra, etc., is the enjoyer of all actions enjoined by the Vedas such as sacrifices, gifts, oblations, etc., and is the bestower of all fruits.

original: pradātāraṃ ca sarvāḥ śrutayo vadanti /
analyzed: pradātāram ca sarvāḥ śrutayaḥ vadanti
translated: And all the sacred texts declare the giver.

original: caturhotāro yatra saṃpadaṃ gacchanti devair ityādyāḥ /
analyzed: catur hotāraḥ yatra saṃpadam gacchanti devaiḥ ityādyāḥ
translated: Such as where the four hotr priests go to completion with the gods and so on.

original: caturhotāro yajñāḥ /🔽yatra paramātmani deveṣv antaryāmirūpeṇāvasthite /
analyzed: catur hotāraḥ yajñāḥ  yatra paramātmani deveṣu antaryāmi rūpeṇa avasthite
translated: The four hotr priests are the sacrifices.

original: devaiḥ saṃpadaṃ gacchanti devaiḥ saṃbandhaṃ gacchanti yajñā ityarthaḥ /
analyzed: devaiḥ saṃpadam gacchanti devaiḥ saṃbandham gacchanti yajñāḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: Where they go to completion with the gods, i.e., they attain union with the gods, meaning the sacrifices attain connection with the gods, in the supreme self who abides in the form of the immanent.

original: antaryāmirūpeṇāvasthitasya paramātmanaḥ śarīratayāvasthitānām indrādīnāṃ yāgādisaṃbandha ity uktaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: antaryāmi rūpeṇa avasthitasya paramātmanaḥ śarīra tayā avasthitānām indra ādīnām yāga ādi saṃbandhaḥ iti uktam bhavati
translated: It is said that the connection with the sacrifice and so on belongs to Indra and others who abide in the body of the supreme self who abides in the form of the immanent.

original: yathoktaṃ bhagavatā
analyzed: yathā uktam bhagavatā
translated: As it is said by the Blessed Lord:

original: bhoktāraṃ yajñatapasāṃ sarvalokamaheśvaram /
analyzed: bhoktāram yajña tapasām sarva loka mahā īśvaram
translated: The enjoyer of sacrifices and austerities, the great lord of all worlds.

original: iti / tasmād agnyādidevatāntarātmabhūtaparamapuruṣārādhanarūpabhūtāni sarvāṇi karmāṇi /
analyzed: iti tasmāt agni ādi devatā antarātma bhūta paramapuruṣa ārādhana rūpa bhūtāni sarvāṇi karmāṇi
translated: Therefore, all actions are of the nature of the worship of the supreme person who is the inner self of the deities such as Agni, and so on.

original: sa eva cābhilaṣitaphalapradāteti kim atrāpūrveṇa vyutpattipathadūravartinā vācyatayābhyupagatena kalpitena vā prayojanam /
analyzed: saḥ eva ca abhilaṣita phala pradātā iti kim atra apūrveṇa vyutpatti patha dūra vartinā vācya tayā abhyupagatena kalpitena vā prayojanam
translated: And he alone is the bestower of the desired fruits. What purpose is served by postulating an unseen entity, which is far removed from the path of inference, as the meaning of the optative suffix, or by imagining it?

original: evaṃ ca sati liṅādeḥ ko 'yam arthaḥ parigṛhīto bhavati /
analyzed: evam ca sati liṅ ādeḥ kaḥ yam arthaḥ parigṛhītaḥ bhavati
translated: And in this case, what meaning is accepted as being conveyed by the optative suffix and so on?

original: yaja devapūjāyām iti devatārādhanabhūtayāgādeḥ prakṛtyarthasya kartṛvyāpārasādhyatāṃ vyutpattisiddhāṃ liṅādayo 'bhidadhatīti na kiṃcid anupapannam
analyzed: yaja deva pūjāyām iti devatā ārādhana bhūta yāga ādeḥ prakṛti arthasya kartṛ vyāpāra sādhyatām vyutpatti siddhām liṅ ādayaḥ bhidadhati iti na kiṃcid anupapannam
translated: In the case of the root yaj 'to sacrifice' the sense of the root, which is the worship of the gods, is understood to be accomplished by the activity of the agent. The optative and other verbal endings express this. So there is nothing that is not logically possible.

original: kartṛvācināṃ pratyayānāṃ prakṛtyarthasya kartṛvyāpārasaṃbandhaprakāro hi vācyaḥ /
analyzed: kartṛ vācinām pratyayānām prakṛti arthasya kartṛ vyāpāra saṃbandha prakāraḥ hi vācyaḥ
translated: The verbal endings which express the agent must express the relation of the sense of the root to the activity of the agent.

original: bhūtavartamānādikam anye vadanti /
analyzed: bhūta vartamāna ādikam anye vadanti
translated: Others say that the optative and other verbal endings express the past, present, and so on.

original: liṅādayas tu kartṛvyāpārasādhyatāṃ vadanti / 🔽api ca kāminaḥ kartavyatā karma vidhāya karmaṇo devatārādhanarūpatāṃ taddvārā phalasaṃbhavaṃ ca tattatkarmavidhivākyāny eva vadanti /
analyzed: liṅ ādayaḥ tu kartṛ vyāpāra sādhyatām vadanti  api ca kāminaḥ kartavya tā karma vidhāya karmaṇaḥ devatā ārādhana rūpa tām tad dvārā phala saṃbhavam ca tad tad karma vidhi vākyāni eva vadanti
translated: But the optative and other verbal endings express the fact that the sense of the root is to be accomplished by the activity of the agent.

original: vāyavyaṃ śvetam ālabhata bhūtikāmo vāyur vai kṣepiṣṭhā devatā vāyum eva svena bhāgadheyenopadhāvati sa evainaṃ bhūtiṃ gamayatītyādīni /
analyzed: vāyavyam śvetam ālabhata bhūti kāmaḥ vāyuḥ vai kṣepiṣṭhā devatā vāyum eva svena bhāgadheyena upadhāvati saḥ eva enam bhūtim gamayati ityādīni
translated: Moreover, the injunctions of particular sacrifices, such as 'One desiring prosperity should sacrifice a white animal to Vayu', express the fact that the sacrifice is to be accomplished by the activity of the agent, and that the sacrifice leads to the worship of the deity, and through that to the attainment of the desired result.

original: nātra phalasiddhyanupapattiḥ kāpi dṛśyata iti phalasādhanatvāvagatir aupādānikīty api na saṃgacchati /
analyzed: na atra phala siddhi anupapattiḥ kā api dṛśyate iti phala sādhanatva avagatiḥ aupādānikī iti api na saṃgacchati
translated: There is no logical impossibility seen here in the attainment of the result. Therefore the understanding of the means of attaining the result is not logically possible.

original: vidhyapekṣitaṃ yāgādeḥ phalasādhanatvaprakāraṃ vākyaśeṣa eva bodhayatītyarthaḥ /
analyzed: vidhi apekṣitam yāga ādeḥ phala sādhanatva prakāram vākyaśeṣaḥ eva bodhayati iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the supplementary passage itself reveals the mode in which the sacrifice etc. is the means to the result, which is required by the injunction.

original: tasmād brāhmaṇāya nāpaguretety atrāpagoraṇaniṣedhavidhiparavākyaśeṣe śrūyamāṇaṃ niṣedhyasyāpagoraṇasya śatayātanāsādhanatvaṃ niṣedhavidhyupayogīti
analyzed: tasmāt brāhmaṇāya na apagureta iti atra apagoraṇa niṣedha vidhi para vākya śeṣe śrūyamāṇam niṣedhyasya apagoraṇasya śata yātanā sādhana tvam niṣedha vidhi upayogi iti
translated: Therefore, in the sentence which has the purport of enjoining the prohibition of not giving to a Brahmin, the fact that the prohibited act of not giving, which is heard in the supplementary passage, is the means to a hundred tortures is accepted

original: hi svīkriyate /
analyzed: hi svīkriyate
translated: as being useful for the injunctive statement.

original: atra punaḥ kāminaḥ kartavyatayā vihitasya yāgādeḥ kāmyasvargādisādhanatvaprakāraṃ vākyaśeṣāvagatam anādṛtya kim ity upādānena yāgādeḥ phalasādhanatvaṃ
analyzed: atra punar kāminaḥ kartavya tayā vihitasya yāga ādeḥ kāmya svarga ādi sādhanatva prakāram vākyaśeṣa avagatam an ādṛtya kim iti upādānena yāga ādeḥ phala sādhanatvam
translated: But here, disregarding the mode in which the sacrifice etc., which is enjoined as something to be done by the desirer, is the means to the desired heaven etc., which is understood from the supplementary passage, the fact that the sacrifice etc. is the means to the result

original: parikalpyate /
analyzed: parikalpyate
translated: is imagined by the addition of the word 'kim'.

original: hiraṇyanidhim apavarake nidhāya yācate kodravādilubdhaḥ kṛpaṇaṃ janam iti śrūyate tad etad yuṣmāsu dṛśyate /
analyzed: hiraṇyanidhim apavarake nidhāya yācate kodrava ādi lubdhaḥ kṛpaṇam janam iti śrūyate tat etat yuṣmāsu dṛśyate
translated: It is heard that a miser, greedy for kodrava grain etc., having placed a treasure of gold in a secret place, begs from a poor person. This is seen in you.

original: śatayātanāsādhanatvam api nādṛṣṭadvāreṇa /
analyzed: śata yātanā sādhanatvam api na adṛṣṭa dvāreṇa
translated: Even the fact of being the means to a hundred tortures is not through an unseen [means].

original: coditāny anutiṣṭho vihitaṃ karmākurvato ninditāni ca kurvataḥ sarvāṇi sukhāni duḥkhāni ca paramapuruṣānugrahanigrahābhyām eva bhavanti /
analyzed: coditāni vihitam karma a kurvataḥ ninditāni ca kurvataḥ sarvāṇi sukhāni duḥkhāni ca paramapuruṣa anugraha nigrahābhyām eva bhavanti
translated: All happiness and sorrow of one who performs the enjoined actions and does not perform the prohibited actions, and of one who does the opposite, arise only through the grace and punishment of the Supreme Person.

original: eṣa hy evānandayati atho so 'bhayaṃ gato bhavati atha tasya bhayaṃ bhavati bhīṣāsmād vātaḥ pavate bhīṣodeti sūryo bhīṣāsmād agniś candraś ca
analyzed: eṣa hi eva ānandayati atha u saḥ bhayam gataḥ bhavati atha tasya bhayam bhavati bhīṣā asmāt vātaḥ pavate bhīṣā udeti sūryaḥ bhīṣā asmāt agniḥ candraḥ ca  /
translated: For this indeed delights, then he has gone to safety. Then he has fear, from this fear the wind blows, from this fear the sun rises, from this fear the fire and the moon,

original: mṛtyur dhāvati pañcamaḥ iti /🔽etasya vā akṣarasya praśāsane gārgi sūryācandramasau vidhṛtau tiṣṭhataḥ etasya vā
analyzed: mṛtyuḥ dhāvati pañcamaḥ iti  etasya vā akṣarasya praśāsane gārgi sūryācandramasau vidhṛtau tiṣṭhataḥ etasya vā
translated: Death runs as the fifth.

original: akṣarasya praśāsane gārgi dadato manuṣyāḥ praśaṃsanti yajamānaṃ devā darvīṃ pitaro
analyzed: akṣarasya praśāsane gārgi dadataḥ manuṣyāḥ praśaṃsanti yajamānam devāḥ darvīm pitaraḥ
translated: Under the rule of this syllable, O Gargi, the sun and moon are held and stand. Under the rule of this syllable, O Gargi, men praise the giver, the gods praise the sacrificer, the ancestors

original: 'nvāyattā ityādyanekavidhāḥ śrutayaḥ santi /
analyzed: nu āyattāḥ ityādi anekavidhāḥ śrutayaḥ santi
translated: praise the offering. Thus there are many such scriptural passages.

original: yathoktaṃ dramiḍabhāṣye tasyājñayā dhāvati vāyur nadyaḥ sravanti tena ca kṛtasīmāno jalāśayāḥ samadā iva meṣavirsapitaṃ kurvantīti /
analyzed: yathā uktam dramiḍabhāṣye tasya ājñayā dhāvati vāyuḥ nadyaḥ sravanti tena ca kṛta sīmānaḥ jalāśayāḥ samadāḥ iva meṣa virsapitam kurvanti iti
translated: As it is said in the commentary on the Dramiḍa language, By his command the wind runs, the rivers flow, and the reservoirs, whose boundaries are made by him, act like intoxicated rams.

original: tatsaṃkalpanibandhanā hīme loke na cyavante na sphuṭante /
analyzed: tad saṃkalpa nibandhanāḥ hi ime loke na cyavante na sphuṭante
translated: For these worlds are bound by his will, they do not fall away, they do not break.

original: svaśāsanānuvartināṃ jñātvā kāruṇyāt
analyzed: sva śāsana anuvartinām jñātvā kāruṇyāt
translated: Knowing that those who follow his rule are compassionate,

original: sa bhagavān vardhayeta vidvān karmadakṣa iti ca /
analyzed: sa bhagavān vardhayeta vidvān karma dakṣaḥ iti ca
translated: the Blessed One, the wise one, the skillful in action, would increase them.

original: paramapuruṣayāthātmyajñānapūrvakatadupāsanādivihitakarmānuṣṭhāyinas tatprasādāt tatprāptiparyantāni sukhāny abhayaṃ ca yathādhikāraṃ bhavanti
analyzed: paramapuruṣa yāthātmya jñāna pūrvaka tad upāsana ādi vihita karma anuṣṭhāyinaḥ tad prasādāt tad prāpti paryantāni sukhāni abhayam ca yathā adhikāram bhavanti
translated: For those who perform the enjoined actions such as the knowledge of the Supreme Person and His worship etc., there are pleasures up to the attainment of Him by His grace and fearlessness according to their eligibility.

original: tajjñānapūrvakaṃ tadupāsanādivihitaṃ karmākurvato ninditāni ca kurvatas tannigrahād eva tadaprāptipūrvakāparimitaduḥkhāni bhayaṃ ca bhavanti
analyzed: tad jñāna pūrvakam tad upāsana ādi vihitam karma a kurvataḥ ninditāni ca kurvataḥ tad nigrahāt eva tad aprāpti pūrvaka aparimita duḥkhāni bhayam ca bhavanti
translated: For those who do not perform the enjoined actions such as the knowledge of Him and His worship etc. and who perform the condemned actions, there are immeasurable sufferings beginning with the non-attainment of Him and fear due to His chastisement alone.

original: yathoktaṃ bhagavatā
analyzed: yathā uktam bhagavatā
translated: As has been said by the Lord:

original: niyataṃ kuru karma tvaṃ karma jyāyo hy akarmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: niyatam kuru karma tvam karma jyāyaḥ hi akarmaṇaḥ
translated: Perform your own duty, for action is better than inaction.

original: ityādinā kṛtsnaṃ karma jñānapūrvakam anuṣṭheyaṃ vidhāya
analyzed: ityādinā kṛtsnam karma jñāna pūrvakam anuṣṭheyam vidhāya
translated: Thus, having enjoined the performance of all actions preceded by knowledge,

original: mayi sarvāṇi karmāṇi saṃnyasya
analyzed: mayi sarvāṇi karmāṇi saṃnyasya
translated: Having dedicated all actions to Me,

original: iti sarvasya karmaṇaḥ svārādhanatām ātmanāṃ svaniyāmyatāṃ ca pratipādya
analyzed: iti sarvasya karmaṇaḥ sva ārādhana tām ātmanām sva niyāmya tām ca pratipādya
translated: having taught that all actions are to be performed as self-worship and that the self is to be controlled by Him,

original: ye me matam idaṃ nityam anutiṣṭhanti mānavāḥ /
analyzed: ye me matam idam nityam anutiṣṭhanti mānavāḥ
translated: Those men who always follow this doctrine of Mine,

original: śraddhāvanto 'nasūyanto mucyante te 'pi karmabhiḥ //
analyzed: śraddhāvantaḥ nasūyantaḥ mucyante te pi karmabhiḥ
translated: with faith and without malice, they are also liberated from actions.

original: ye tv etadabhyasūyanto nānutiṣṭhanti me matam /
analyzed: ye tu etat abhyasūyantaḥ na anutiṣṭhanti me matam
translated: But those who, out of contempt, do not follow this doctrine of Mine,

original: sarvajñānavimūḍhāṃs tān viddhi naṣṭān acetasaḥ //
analyzed: sarva jñāna vimūḍhān tān viddhi naṣṭān acetasaḥ
translated: Know them to be lost, devoid of consciousness, who are deluded about all knowledge.

original: iti svājñānuvartinaḥ praśasya viparītān vinindya punar api svājñānupālanam akurvatām āsur aprakṛtyantarbhāvam abhidhāyādhamā gatiś coktā🔽tān ahaṃ dviṣataḥ krūrān saṃsāreṣu narādhamān /
analyzed: iti sva ājñā anuvartinaḥ praśasya viparītān vinindya punar api sva ājñā anupālanam akurvatām āsuḥ a prakṛti antarbhāvam abhidhāya adhamā gatiḥ ca uktā  tān aham dviṣataḥ krūrān saṃsāreṣu nara adhamān
translated: Thus, praising those who follow their own knowledge and condemning those who are the opposite, it is again said that those who do not uphold their own knowledge fall into the category of the lowest, and their destination is described as:

original: kṣipāmy ajasram aśubhān āsurīṣv eva yoniṣu //🔽āsurīṃ yonim āpannā mūḍhā janmani janmani /
analyzed: kṣipāmi ajasram aśubhān āsurīṣu eva yoniṣu  āsurīm yonim āpannāḥ mūḍhāḥ janmani janmani
translated: I cast into the worlds, O Arjuna, those most contemptible of men, those haters, those of cruel deeds, those eaters of impure food, those sinful and deluded ones, again and again, into the wombs of demons.

original: mām aprāpyaiva kaunteya tato yānty adhamāṃ gatim // iti /
analyzed: mām a prāpya eva kaunteya tatas yānti adhamām gatim iti
translated: Having attained demonhood, being deluded in birth after birth, they do not attain Me, O son of Kunti, and therefore go to the lowest state.

original: sarvakarmāṇy api sadā kurvāṇo madvypāśrayaḥ /
analyzed: sarva karmāṇi api sadā kurvāṇaḥ mad vypāśrayaḥ
translated: Even while always performing all actions, taking refuge in Me,

original: matprasādād avāpnoti śāśvataṃ padam avyayam //
analyzed: mad prasādāt avāpnoti śāśvatam padam avyayam
translated: he attains the eternal, imperishable state by My grace.

original: iti ca svājñānuvartināṃ śāśvataṃ padaṃ coktam /
analyzed: iti ca sva ājñā anuvartinām śāśvatam padam ca uktam
translated: Thus, the eternal state is also described for those who follow their own knowledge.

original: aśrutavedāntānāṃ karmaṇy aśraddhā mā bhūd iti devatādhikaraṇe 'tivādāḥ kṛtāḥ karmamātre yathā śraddhā syād iti sarvam ekaśāstram iti vedavitsiddhāntaḥ
analyzed: aśruta vedāntānām karmaṇi aśraddhā mā bhūt iti devatā adhikaraṇe ti vādāḥ kṛtāḥ karma mātre yathā śraddhā syāt iti sarvam eka śāstram iti veda vid siddhāntaḥ
translated: In order that those who have not heard the Vedanta may have faith in action, supererogatory rites were performed in the chapter on deities, in order that there may be faith in mere action. The conclusion of those who know the Vedas is that everything is one scripture.

original: tasyaitasya parasya brahmaṇo
analyzed: tasya etasya parasya brahmaṇaḥ
translated: Of this supreme Brahman,
