translated: Therefore, that alone is stable and of unlimited excellence, as stated in the scriptures: Brahman is the bliss, Brahman is truth, knowledge, and infinite.

original: brahmavyatiriktasya kṛtsnasya vastunaḥ svarūpeṇa sukhatvābhāvaḥ karmakṛtatvena cāsthiratvaṃ bhagavatā parāśareṇoktam
analyzed: brahma vyatiriktasya kṛtsnasya vastunaḥ svarūpeṇa sukha tva abhāvaḥ karma kṛta tvena ca asthira tvam bhagavatā parāśareṇa uktam
translated: The absence of happiness in the nature of all things except Brahman, and their instability due to being created by karma, have been stated by the blessed Parashara:

original: narakasvargasaṃjñe vai pāpapuṇye dvijottama /
analyzed: naraka svarga saṃjñe vai pāpa puṇye dvijottama
translated: O best of Brahmins, heaven and hell are known as virtue and sin.

original: vastv ekam eva duḥkhāya sukhāyerṣyāgamāya ca /
analyzed: vastu ekam eva duḥkhāya sukhāya īrṣyā āgamāya ca
translated: One and the same thing causes sorrow, joy, jealousy, and anger.

original: kopāya ca yatas tasmād vastu vastvātmakaṃ kutaḥ //
analyzed: kopāya ca yatas tasmāt vastu vastu ātmakam kutas
translated: Therefore, how can a thing have the nature of a thing?

original: sukhaduḥkhādyekāntarūpiṇo vastuno vastutvaṃ kutaḥ /
analyzed: sukha duḥkha ādi ekānta rūpiṇaḥ vastunaḥ vastu tvam kutas
translated: How can a thing have the nature of a thing that causes sorrow, joy, etc. exclusively?

original: tadekāntatā puṇyapāpakṛtetyarthaḥ /
analyzed: tad ekānta tā puṇya pāpa kṛtā iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is the result of good and bad deeds.

original: evam anekapuruṣāpekṣayā kasyacit sukham eva kasyacid duḥkhaṃ bhavatītyavasthāṃ pratipādya /
analyzed: evam aneka puruṣa apekṣayā kasyacid sukham eva kasyacid duḥkham bhavati iti avasthām pratipādya
translated: Thus, in relation to many people, happiness belongs to some, and suffering to others. Having explained the situation,

original: ekasminn api puruṣe na vyavasthitam ityāha
analyzed: ekasmin api puruṣe na vyavasthitam iti āha
translated: he says that even in one person, it is not fixed.

original: tad eva prīyate bhūtvā punarsuḥkhāya jāyate /
analyzed: tat eva prīyate bhūtvā punar suṣkhāya jāyate
translated: That very thing, having become pleasing, is born again for happiness.

original: tad eva kopāya yataḥ prasādāya ca jāyate //
analyzed: tat eva kopāya yatas prasādāya ca jāyate
translated: That very thing is born for anger and for favor.

original: tasmād duḥkhātmakaṃ nāsti na ca kiṃcit sukhātmakam /
analyzed: tasmāt duḥkha ātmakam nā asti na ca kiṃcid sukha ātmakam
translated: Therefore, there is nothing that is of the nature of suffering, nor anything that is of the nature of happiness.

original: iti sukhaduḥkhātmakatvaṃ sarvasya vastunaḥ karmakṛtaṃ na vastusvarūpakṛtam /
analyzed: iti sukha duḥkha ātmaka tvam sarvasya vastunaḥ karma kṛtam na vastu svarūpa kṛtam
translated: Thus, the nature of all things as being of the nature of happiness and suffering is created by karma, not by the nature of the thing itself.

original: ataḥ karmāvasāne tad apaitītyarthaḥ /
analyzed: atas karma avasāne tat apaiti iti arthaḥ
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that when karma ends, that [nature] disappears.

original: yat tu sarvaṃ paravaśaṃ duḥkham ityuktaṃ tatparamapuruṣavyatiriktānāṃ parasparaśeṣaśeṣibhāvābhāvāt tadvyatiriktaṃ prati śeṣatā duḥkham evetyuktam
analyzed: yat tu sarvam paravaśam duḥkham iti uktam tat paramapuruṣa vyatiriktānām paraspara śeṣa śeṣi bhāva abhāvāt tad vyatiriktam prati śeṣa tā duḥkham eva iti uktam
translated: But it was said that everything that is dependent on another is suffering. That is said because, except for the Supreme Person, they are mutually dependent, and being dependent on something other than that is suffering itself.

original: sevā śvavṛttir ākhyātety atrāpy asevyasevā śvavṛttir evetyuktam /
analyzed: sevā śvavṛttiḥ ākhyātā iti atra api asevya sevā śvavṛttiḥ evā iti uktam
translated: Here, it is said that service is the occupation of a dog, and even the service of one who should not be served is the occupation of a dog.

original: sa hy āśramaiḥ sadopāsyaḥ samastair eka eva tv iti sarvair ātmayāthātmyavedibhiḥ sevyaḥ puruṣottama eka eva /
analyzed: sa hi āśramaiḥ sadā upāsyaḥ samastaiḥ ekaḥ eva tu iti sarvaiḥ ātma yāthātmya vedibhiḥ sevyaḥ puruṣottamaḥ ekaḥ eva
translated: For he is to be constantly attended upon by all the stages of life, but he alone is to be served by all who know the true nature of the Self.

original: yathoktaṃ bhagavatā
analyzed: yathā uktam bhagavatā
translated: As it has been said by the Blessed Lord:

original: māṃ ca yo 'vyabhicāreṇa bhaktiyogena sevate /
analyzed: mām ca yaḥ vyabhicāreṇa bhakti yogena sevate
translated: And he who serves me with unwavering devotion of love,

original: sa guṇān samatītyaitān brahmabhūyāya kalpate //
analyzed: sa guṇān samatītya etān brahma bhūyāya kalpate
translated: surpassing these qualities, becomes fit for union with Brahman.

original: itīyam eva bhaktirūpā sevā brahmavid āpnoti param tam evaṃ vidvān amṛta iha bhavati brahma veda brahmaiva bhavatītyādiṣu vedanaśabdenābhidhīyata
analyzed: iti iyam eva bhakti rūpā sevā brahma vid āpnoti param tam evam vidvān amṛtaḥ iha bhavati brahma veda brahmā eva bhavati ityādiṣu vedana śabdena abhidhīyata
translated: Thus this very service in the form of devotion is spoken of by the word knowledge in such passages as The knower of Brahman attains the highest, One who knows him thus becomes immortal in this world, One who knows Brahman becomes Brahman himself, and so on.

original: ityuktam /
analyzed: iti uktam
translated: This has been stated.

original: yam evaiṣa vṛṇute tena labhya iti viśeṣaṇād yam evaiṣa vṛṇuta iti bhavagatā varaṇīyatvaṃ pratīyate /
analyzed: yam eva eṣa vṛṇute tena labhyaḥ iti viśeṣaṇāt yam eva eṣa vṛṇute iti bhava gatā varaṇīya tvam pratīyate
translated: He is to be obtained by him alone whom he chooses, due to this specification, it is understood from the Blessed Lord's statement He is to be obtained by him alone whom he chooses that he is to be chosen.

original: varaṇīyaś ca priyatamaḥ /
analyzed: varaṇīyaḥ ca priyatamaḥ
translated: And he who is to be chosen is the dearest.

original: yasya bhagavaty anavadhikātiśayā prītir jāyate sa eva bhagavataḥ priyatamaḥ /
analyzed: yasya bhagavati anavadhika atiśayā prītiḥ jāyate saḥ eva bhagavataḥ priyatamaḥ
translated: He in whom arises unbounded, excessive love for the Blessed Lord, he alone is the dearest to the Blessed Lord.

original: tad uktaṃ bhagavatā
analyzed: tat uktam bhagavatā
translated: This has been stated by the Blessed Lord:

original: priyo hi jñānino 'tyartham ahaṃ sa ca mama priyaḥ /
analyzed: priyaḥ hi jñāninaḥ tyartham aham sa ca mama priyaḥ
translated: For I am exceedingly dear to the knower of the Self, and he is dear to me.

original: iti / tasmāt parabhaktirūpāpannam eva vedanaṃ tattvato bhagavatprāptisādhanam /
analyzed: iti tasmāt para bhakti rūpa āpannam eva vedanam tattvataḥ bhagavat prāpti sādhanam
translated: Thus, it is only the knowledge that has become a form of devotion to the Supreme Lord that is truly the means of attaining Him.

original: yathoktaṃ bhagavatā dvaipāyanena mokṣadharme sarvopaniṣadvyākhyānarūpam
analyzed: yathā uktam bhagavatā dvaipāyanena mokṣadharme sarva upaniṣad vyākhyāna rūpam
translated: As it has been said by the Blessed Dvaipayana in the Mokshadharma, which is like the commentary on all the Upanishads:

original: na saṃdṛśo tiṣṭhati rūpam asya na cakṣuṣā paśyati kaścanainam /
analyzed: na saṃdṛśaḥ tiṣṭhati rūpam asya na cakṣuṣā paśyati kaścana enam
translated: His form is not seen, no one sees Him with the eye.

original: bhaktyā ca dhṛtyā ca samāhitātmā jñānasvarūpaṃ paripaśyatītīha //
analyzed: bhaktyā ca dhṛtyā ca samāhita ātmā jñāna sva rūpam paripaśyati iti iha
translated: Here, one sees the knowledge-form of the Supreme Self with a mind controlled by devotion and steadfastness.

original: dhṛtyā samāhitātmā bhaktyā puruṣottamaṃ paśyati sākṣātkaroti prāpnotītyarthaḥ /
analyzed: dhṛtyā samāhita ātmā bhaktyā puruṣottamam paśyati sākṣātkaroti prāpnoti iti arthaḥ
translated: By steadfastness and a controlled mind, one sees the Supreme Lord, one realizes Him, one attains Him, is the meaning.

original: bhaktyā tv anannyayā śakya ityanenāikārthyāt /
analyzed: bhaktyā tu śakyaḥ iti anena aikārthyāt
translated: And by but He is attainable by undivided devotion, the same meaning is expressed.

original: bhaktiś ca jñānaviśeṣa eveti sarvam upapannam /
analyzed: bhaktiḥ ca jñāna viśeṣaḥ eva iti sarvam upapannam
translated: And devotion is nothing but a special kind of knowledge, so everything is reasonable.

original: sārāsāravivekajñā garīyāṃso vimatsarāḥ /
analyzed: sāra asāra viveka jñāḥ garīyāṃsaḥ vimatsarāḥ
translated: Those who know the difference between the essential and the non-essential, who are superior, who are free from envy,

original: pramāṇatantrāḥ santīti kṛto vedārthasaṅgrahaḥ //
analyzed: pramāṇa tantrāḥ santi iti kṛtaḥ veda artha saṅgrahaḥ
translated: who are based on valid means of knowledge, they exist. Thus the essence of the meaning of the Vedas is composed.
